placeInfo/address: 670/5 Galle Road, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Absolutely stunning - all was great
text:
I was in Sri Lanka for business meetings on Thursday and Friday, with more scheduled for Monday and Tuesday. Wanting to make the most of the weekend, I decided to get out of busy Colombo—and discovered the incredible Kumu Beach.

What a fantastic decision! From the moment I arrived, the team made me feel genuinely welcome. The service was warm, personal, and incredibly professional throughout my stay.

The rooms are stunning – stylish, spacious, and filled with natural light. Everything was spotless, and the attention to detail made it feel like a true luxury retreat. The setting is serene and beautifully maintained, perfect for unwinding.

A real highlight was the cuisine. The chef is world-class, and every meal was a culinary masterpiece. Fresh, flavorful, and artfully presented – honestly on par with top fine dining experiences I’ve had anywhere in the world.

Everything about my stay was flawless. If you’re looking for an intimate, high-end boutique hotel on Sri Lanka’s coast, Kumu Beach is the place. It’s peaceful, elegant, and far exceeded my expectations.

Already dreaming of my next visit – absolutely recommended!
title: Pure Bliss at Kumu Beach – A Perfect Weekend Escape

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Amber,

Thank you so much for sharing such a heartfelt and glowing review of your time at Kumu Beach. We’re honoured to have been the setting for such a special occasion, and it brings us immense joy to know the wedding and your five-day stay felt like paradise.

We take great pride in offering attentive, personalised service, and it's rewarding to hear that our staff made you feel so well cared for throughout your stay.

Thank you again for choosing Kumu Beach to celebrate such a memorable moment. We can’t wait to welcome you back for another stay as the sun, sea, and our team will be waiting.

Sincerely,

Sakuni Wisanperuma
placeInfo/address: 670/5 Galle Road, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text:
My friend hosted her wedding at Kumu Beach, and I cannot think of a more ethereal setting for a wedding. We stayed at the hotel for 5 days, and for that time, it felt like we had been transported to Paradise. I have never experienced such kind and attentive staff, they couldn't do enough for us all. We were all looked after so well, and everyone was so personable and understanding of our requests. The hotel itself is perfect. Our room, an ocean view room, was gorgeous. Clean and comfortable, with a fantastic rainfall shower, the staff were kind enough to turn down our rooms in the evening. Our meals were all amazing. We had the delight of being able to enjoy not only the chef's regular menu, but also the wedding/event fare as well. All dishes, sweet and savoury, were fantastic. It was some of the best seafood that my partner and I had ever tasted. Everything was fresh, very tasty and I wish I could go back for more! 
The poolside was a lovely, calming area, listening to the Indian Ocean on a sun lounger was idyllic, but remember the strong UV! The Sri Lankan sun is no joke. 
With the wedding, the staff were amazing in making sure that everything was in order, and all we had to do was relax and enjoy the day. It couldn't have been more perfect. 
We are counting down the days to our text trip to Kumu Beach, I hope there will be many more.
title: Heaven on earth

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: 670/5 Galle Road, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We thought the upgrade to a sea view suite for more space well worth it but all the rooms looked lovely.
text: A truly fabulous hotel and a lovely way to end our tour of Sri Lanka!  We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our tour in March and had a wonderful, relaxing few days.  We didn't venture out of the hotel so cannot comment on surrounding facilities or attractions.  Hotel is amazing and the attention to detail here is second to none. It benefits from being small and exclusive.  We had upgraded to a superior room and it was well worth it. One of the nicest suites we have ever had on our world travels.  This hotel is a sister to Goat Fell at Nuwara Eliya which we stayed in and was equally fabulous.  We had requested a higher floor but initially we were accommodated on the ground floor.  However next day the staff moved us upstairs which we were delighted with; two balconies with fab views of sea.  (The duty manager who looked after us here was exceptional, I am so sorry I have forgotten his name). Food here is also exceptional with personalised and cheery service from the chef (India?) who will tweak any dish to your liking. My husband said he cooked the best Tiger prawns in the world and he had them every day!!  Complimentary G&Ts at 5pm were a lovely touch and the pool and loungers are perfect for this hotel. A few steps down to the beach and you can walk along in both directions dipping your toes in the sea.  We had the most perfect four days here and were sorry to have to leave.  A HUGE thank you to team Kumu Beach!
title: A small paradise of perfection!

placeInfo/address: 670/5 Galle Road, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The hotel offered trips looked good and if time permitted we'd have done the turtles. Trip to Galle, appears a good alternative to staying in the walled city.
text: We ended our two week tour of Sri Lanka here for 2 nights, and wished we had booked longer. Situated well back from the road and immediately next to a quiet (almost unused) beach, with a lovely grassed garden area and surrounded by local fauna, it felt like an idyllic island. With only a few rooms, it felt very special. The staff were of course, very attentive and helpful, and we were especially well looked after by Ruchinia. Food was excellent and room very comfortable, with an enormous bathroom. Nothing could be better than lazing in the garden shade watching the ocean and looking forward to (complimentary) afternoon tea & cake, with G&Ts at 5 - truly memorable. Highly recommend.
title: A slice of paradise, nestled alongside the Indian Ocean

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Phillip,

Thank you so much for this heartwarming and detailed review! We’re truly delighted that your family had such a memorable stay with us at Kumu Beach. It’s wonderful to hear you enjoyed the peaceful Oceanview Suite, the pool, the beach, and all the thoughtful touches — from our daily Social Hour on the lawn to the personalised BBQ evening.

We’re so pleased the activities, especially the turtle hatchery and puppet museum visits, added to your family’s experience and that the kids had such a great time. 

Your kind words mean a great deal to all of us, and we’re honoured to have been part of your Teardrop Journey. We'd love nothing more than to welcome you back again — hopefully very soon!

Sakuni Wisanperuma
placeInfo/address: 670/5 Galle Road, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text:
What a beautiful hotel! We stayed three nights and it was absolutely perfection.
Our room - Oceanview Suite was fantastic - silent at night and with plenty of space for our family of four.

We all loved the huge, warm pool and relaxing environment. The beach was incredibly beautiful and the kids loved climbing on the rocks.
At the end of each day, we loved  the makeshift bar on the lawn with complimentary drinks and crisps at 5pm, just in time for sunset. Such a nice way of bringing everyone together.

Another highlight was the BBQ night we had - where the chef prepared a huge variety of delicious food for us (including ensuring we were happy with the menu in advance and adding/changing it to our request).

We stayed at 5 teardrop hotels (they are all fantastic) and did a Teardrop Journey - which I REALLY recommend.
Our journey included many activities. At Kumu Beach we enjoyed great massages, a visit to a local turtle hatchery and a visit to the Southern puppet museum.

These were all carefully curated for families in mind and our kids were incredibly sad to leave.

The food was fantastic, they catered for the vegetarians in our group very well, adapting the menu and offering to cook different meals if wanted. 

In summary, this was one of the best places we have ever been and we would return tomorrow if we could. Book it!
title: Beautiful beachside stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear William,

Thank you for your thoughtful review! We’re thrilled you loved the tranquility, design, and warm hospitality at Kumu Beach—especially the attentive service. 

It’s great to hear you enjoyed the food, with the beef curry and egg hoppers being highlights. We appreciate your feedback on shade and sunbeds and will take it into account. As for the beach, its untouched beauty does come with a few quirks, and your tip on repellent is a good one!

We’d love to welcome you back—perhaps next time when you can enjoy a seaside cocktail. Safe travels!

Sincerely,

Sakuni Wisanperuma
placeInfo/address: 670/5 Galle Road, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text:
Kumu Beach setting is beautiful with a contemporary design right on an almost deserted beach. If you’re after peace, relaxation, and a boutique feel, this is the perfect spot.

The staff were incredibly attentive, friendly, professional, and always on hand without being intrusive. Special mention must go to Richira, our principal hotel butler during the stay. He was an absolute credit to the Teardrop Hotels group—warm, thoughtful, and always anticipating our needs without us having to ask. We stayed at two Teardrop properties during our trip, and the consistently high standard of service makes me highly recommend them as a hotel group. 

The food was fantastic, with plenty of fresh, flavorful options. We highly recommend trying the beef curry, which was sublime. Equally, breakfasts were a highlight, especially the egg hoppers. 

That said, there are a few small points to note. There is limited shade, particularly at lunchtime, and a canopy or shaded area for dining outdoors would be a welcome addition.

Another minor downside was that on some days, there didn’t appear to be enough sunbeds, which led to the inevitable towel reservation behavior. While this isn’t a direct reflection on the hotel, it’s frustrating when guests claim beds early. Given that Kumu Beach only has ten rooms, ensuring there are enough sunbeds and parasols for everyone would help prevent this.

The beach itself is stunning but surprisingly empty. This could be due to the rough sea conditions or the sand flies—something to be aware of. I ended up with 12 bites, so I’d definitely recommend bringing insect repellent if you plan to enjoy the sand.

One final note: we stayed during the monthly full moon (Poya Day), when no alcohol is served at the hotel
title: A great coastal escape

text: This is our first time at Kumu beach , we frequent Saman villas and could not get a reservation and decided to try out Kumu beach and was very pleasantly surpised to find that it is actually a smaller version of Saman villas . We have travelled widely and the service is exceptional and really the best we have ever experianced,  it is truly what Sri Lankan hospitality should be ! it is lovely to see every member working together as a team and doing their utmost to ensuring that the guests have a truly remarkable stay, my hoppers were a few minutes late and they apologised and gave me extra hoppers ! Absolutely everyone we encountered went out of their way to make our stay special so it is not possible to mention one person in particular.  We stayed in an oceaview room but it was downstairs and the view is  of the swimming pool and you can see the ocean but it is not as great as you would experiance from upstairs which was just breathtaking. The two suites were on the upper floors and it makes sense to stay in those rooms. The room was lovely and the bedding was very comfortable . Food was very good and we felt we were overfed and we were struggling to eat all that we were given. The pool is lovely and given that there are only 10 rooms there was ample space to lounge around with a view of the ocean.  There is cake and coffe at 3pm, Happy hour at 5pm and you can use the drinks in the fridge once a day. However there was no life guard but given that the sea is rough and unpredictable unlike in Bentota , it would be good to have one for those who would like to spend some time in the Ocaen. Beach is very clean and its good to go for walks . Despite being attentive and trying their best to accomodate my diatary needs as I am allergic to dairy and I felt food options were limited, I hope there will be better options for such people in the future.
title: A slice of Paradise

roomTip: This hotel should be seen as a little Oasis, it's remote, chilled and relaxing.
text: This place will forever hold a special place in my heart as my fiancé chose Kumu Beach Hotel to surprise me with a proposal during our stay here! We stayed for 3 nights and honestly didn't want to leave. Of course the engagement made the hotel extra sentimental for us but I have to say the hospitality and hotel itself were outstanding! The staff were incredible - super warm and attentive. (I later found out just how helpful they had been with accommodating and organizing the proposal with my partner too). Kumu Beach did not disappoint with their Menu either, personally felt it was the best food we had across our tour of Sri Lanka, I'm still dreaming about the prawn tikka wrap I ate for lunch! The breakfast and dinner were incredible too throughly enjoyed being able to try different dishes during our stay, which served a selection of local Sri Lankan food and western cuisine which were all exquisite. They were also very understanding of my partners coeliac disease and were able to easily make changes to the menu for him. To top all of this, let's talk about its location and landscape: JUST WOW! it was a blessing to be surrounded by its diversity, the sound of waves crashing every morning/throughout the night and birds singing. We stayed in room 5 with an incredible view over the private beach, which felt very remote, there was often only my finance and I on the beach which made it feel extremely private indeed. Everything about the Hotel, from its location, food and interior design were picture worthy! Thank you to the staff who made the stay just PERFECT!
title: Exquisite Stay + Surprise Engagement proposal!  THANK YOU KUMU BEACH HOTEL!

roomTip: If you like the hubub of a local area don't go here as it is a bit far out from the local towns.
text: This is a fantastic exclusive hotel. Only 10 rooms with excellent service from all the staff who spoke good English but not intrusive. The rooms all have sea views and feel private as at slightly different angles. Ours had a 4 poster bed. The room had a huge bathroom. Also a selection of teas and a proper coffee machine with fresh milk in the fridge. The food is fantastic, starting with a 4 course breakfast, any manner of light snacks for lunch and a good evening selection. The chef came round personally most evenings to check everybody was happy. Outside there is a small lawned area and a lovely infinity pool overlooking the beach. Unfortunately when the tide is coming or going the sea is a bit dangerous to swim in because of the undercurrent, but relatively OK for a good swimmer and at other times. The beach has lovely white sand and there was nobody on it even at height of season, perfect for a morning or evening stroll when the temperature a bit lower. We really appreciated the 5-6 pm cocktail hour watching the sun set and all drinks free. Also afternoon tea is free if requested. There is a spa and the massage I had was excellent. The hotel is an hours drive from Galle which for us was a little far for more sightseeing. There is really no village or town to wander around so it is a bit isolated. The hotel does organise various trips if desired. We felt rested and pampered at this hotel at the end of our holiday.
title: Fantastic hotel, the best we stayed in over a 3 week touring hol

roomTip: Room 7 has an incredible view!
text: My husband and I spent 6 nights at Kumu Beach and loved it so much we didn’t want to leave! This small boutique hotel has only 10 rooms, we stayed in room 7 with an ocean view. The room was spacious, comfortable, well equipped with a large bathroom, the view from the bed was just fabulous! All of the staff here are so friendly and helpful, as were all of the staff at the Teardrop Hotels that we had the pleasure of staying at, nothing is too much trouble for anyone. The chef, Indika, is a credit to the hotel, he interacts with guests daily and is clearly proud and passionate about the food that is served. One evening he cooked us a Kottu Roti as a special request (off menu) and it was delicious. All of the food including breakfast, lunch and dinner is plentiful, tasty and well presented. The only criticism is that there are sometimes not enough shaded areas for outside eating during breakfast and lunchtime, a few more parasols are required. The hotel is located on a wonderful, almost deserted beach and is close to other restaurants etc should you wish to venture out.  Afternoon tea and cake/cookies are served daily as are complimentary G&T’s, wine, beer etc during social hour which brings guests together in the gardens. This hotel is truly exceptional and if you like small hotels I cannot recommend it enough!
title: Fantastic Small Boutique Hotel in a Fabulous Location!

text: This is an amazing hotel. We stayed in Kumbuk suite for 2 nights. The villa is beautifully designed with a wonderful garden and small pool with stunning views. The dining area and other common parts are also very attractive. Staff are friendly and very willing. We also spent a day at the KK Beach with a lovely pool and amazing non swimming beach. We had a few tiny issues, limited breakfast choices, overpriced medium quality seafood barbecue at KK Beach and a couple of staff training issues (sent to wrong villa initially and mistakenly overcharged which was sorted but without apology). But, to be clear, this would not stop us coming back or enthusiastically recommending the KK. The owner is both charming and a talented hotelier.

placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
roomTip: Don’t worry about adding the full board package - paying as you go is not massively expensive
text:
We absolutely loved our stay at Kahanda Kanda. We stayed in Kumbuk villa, and it was stunning - incredibly spacious, so comfortable and everything so thoughtfully designed (eg two sets of loungers to catch the morning and afternoon sun). I honestly think that sitting on its terrace, looking in to its private garden, early on a sunny morning with the sound of wildlife in your ears is actually paradise.

All of the staff were great - super friendly as well as fantastic at their jobs… the pool attendant who called every morning to clean our pool and bring fresh towels, the guys who cleaned our room, the restaurant staff, the team in the bar (great cocktails Amith, thank you!), everyone basically!

I would say don’t bother paying for the full board upgrade - not because the food isn’t delicious (it is, and so fresh tasting) but because everything on the menu is good value. While we ate every meal at the hotel, we think we would probably have spent less by just paying for what we ate. A lesson for when we go back, and we will definitely be going back.
title: A little slice of paradise

text: I don’t think I can tell you enough how amazing this place is.  Our beautiful bungalow (we had a sneaky look of some of the others, they’re all beautiful) was huge with an infinity pool over looking the pristine Sri Lankan jungle. We started our day with coffee sitting by our pool listening to the bird song and staring in wonder at the jungle wildlife around us, peacocks, parrots, monkeys, iguanas, mongoose, and tiny squirrels to mention a few.  Every member of staff (there’s a lot) are so lovely; welcoming and genuinely proud of the hotel and of their island. The food is sublime and is either grown on the plantation or sourced locally. Breakfasts are huge (home made granola with buffalo curd & palm syrup, breads and cakes, jams and marmalades any type of eggs, fruit and even a traditional Sri Lankan curry breakfast). The  3 course dinners are so spectacular my husband is still going on about them. Honestly, don’t bother going off the plantation for dinner anywhere else. Owner George took the time, every morning to say hello & have a little chat. What a fantastic place you’ve made George, we’re home now and already trying to work out when we can come back.
title: Genuinely Amazing Hotel on a Tea Plantation

ownerResponse/text:

Best wishes,
George Cooper

text: Kahanda Kanda. Just a short distance from the Fort and city of Galle, Kahanda Kanda is one of those exquisite boutique hotels that are starting to pop up around Sri Lanka. The greeting by management on our arrival was swift and efficient and after a cooling welcome drink we were escorted to our beautiful suite where everything about the room and the hotel was explained. The food was divine, the pool extremely welcoming and cool after a long day on the tourist trail and the well equipped gym assisted in ridding some of those unwelcome calories off our hips. If you are looking for a place that screams out Sri Lankan hospitality, this is it.
title: Serenity amongst the Paddies

placeInfo/address: Habaraduwa Dikkumbura Road, Thittagalla West 80122 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
text:
Kahanda Kanda (KK Collection) in Galle is a stunning boutique hotel nestled on a 12-acre tea plantation. Surrounded by lush forest, swaying palms, and with a distant view of Koggala Lake, it's a serene and unique escape. The beautifully designed villas offer spacious accommodation, each with its own distinctive interior.
The rooms were impeccably clean, and the service was exceptional. I was truly impressed by the extraordinary care the room service staff provided, even going above and beyond to look after our vehicle. It was a delightful surprise to find it safely sheltered until our departure.
The food was outstanding, with generous portions. A special thanks to Chef Prasad for the culinary delights. From the management to the staff, everyone was incredibly friendly and accommodating, making our stay exceptionally comfortable. It was a luxurious experience with five-star amenities.
I wholeheartedly recommend Kahanda Kanda to anyone seeking a perfect, relaxing getaway.
title: Absolutely perfect relaxing getaway.

placeInfo/address: Habaraduwa Dikkumbura Road, Thittagalla West 80122 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
text: I’ve been fortunate enough to have stayed in some exceptional properties over the last 3 decades. The Kahanda Kanda has 12 distinctively designed villas, each on their own grounds in a tea plantation in the hills over Galle. Our villa was built in Bali and reassembled on a private hillside.  It is an architectural manifestation of harmony and symmetry that puts your mind at ease. It is in a class all its own. Designer and owner George Cooper has created something just this side of miraculous.
title: In a class all its own.

Thank you so much for your heartfelt and detailed review. We are truly honored that you chose our Ayurvedic resort for your very first visit to Sri Lanka and your first Ayurvedic experience. It’s wonderful to hear that your six-night stay was relaxing and fulfilling in so many ways.

We’re delighted that you enjoyed the peaceful surroundings, the treatments, and the warmth of our staff. Your kind words about our therapists and their care mean a lot to us. We believe healing the mind is just as important as healing the body, and we’re so glad you felt that during your stay.

We also appreciate your feedback on the meals. Our kitchen team is happy to know you enjoyed the flavors, and it’s great to hear that you found the personalized service during the off-season to be a pleasant experience. It’s also lovely that you joined our cooking activity and took interest in learning about traditional Sri Lankan cuisine!

We're pleased that even the rainy season added a unique charm to your stay. The way you described being soothed by the sound of the rain perfectly captures the tranquil atmosphere we aim to provide.

It brings us great joy to know that our Japanese language support helped make your solo international travel more comfortable. Your comments will certainly reassure other first-time travelers.

Thank you once again for choosing us. We hope to welcome you back in the future for another healing and memorable stay.

Ayubowan (Wishing you a long and prosperous life).
placeInfo/address: Jesu Nasarenu Mawatha Thoppu Thota, Waikkal 61110 Sri Lanka
roomTip: 緑が多く、蚊がいるので虫除けスプレーを持ってくるといいです。
text:
日本語対応のアーユルヴェーダリゾート。初めてのスリランカ、初めてのアーユルヴェーダで6泊、コテージを利用しました。
コテージは緑に囲まれていて、鳥の声や木々のざわめきに癒されます。虫除けは必須です。
コテージはバスタブはありませんが、毎日朝晩じっくりトリートメントがあるので、シャワーで十分でした。

施設の整備、アメニティなども申し分ないですが、とにかくスタッフの方が、皆んな気さくでニコニコしていて優しいです。
質問やリクエストにもとても温かく笑顔で対応してくださいます。

セラピストさんも、どの方も素晴らしく親切で、技術もとても高いと思います。
毎回、とにかく優しく丁寧にケアをしてくださったので、身体だけでなく心もとても癒されました。
基本的に毎日同じセラピストさんが担当してくださるので、お互いに顔を覚えられて良いです。

食事も、日本人の口に合う、マイルドなスパイスで、美味しかったです。
閑散期のためビュッフェではなくプレートでの提供でしたが、量のリクエストもできますし、ゆったりと食べられて満足でした。
無料のアクティビティで、シェフにスリランカの伝統料理を習いましたが、とても本格的で、勉強になりました。

雨季でしたが、土砂降りの雨が降ってもすぐに上がって晴れ間が出たり、ずっと雨が降っているわけではないので、特に問題ありませんでした。
むしろ、暑さが和らいで、雨音にも癒され、落ち着いて過ごせてよかったと思います。

1人で海外旅行が初めての方や、英語が喋れない方でも安心して滞在できると思います。
title: 素晴らしいアーユルヴェーダリゾート

ownerResponse/text:
Dear esteemed guest,

Thank you so much for visiting us again and for taking the time to share your feedback. We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed the treatment and that our staff made your stay comfortable and pleasant.

We truly appreciate your comments regarding the meals. We do try to adjust the spice levels to suit a wide range of preferences, especially for our Japanese guests and families with children. However, we understand that some guests may prefer a spicier option, and we take your suggestion seriously.

Please rest assured that we will review the menu and explore ways to offer a slightly spicier alternative for those who would like it. We're grateful for your honest feedback and are always looking for ways to improve.

We would be thrilled to welcome you again in the future. Thank you once again for your support!

Ayubowan (Wishing you a long and prosperous life).

text:

強いて言うなら、食事かなと
おそらく日本人に合わせて薄味にしているのだと思いますが、辛いと感じる食事がほぼなく、薄味でした

また行きたいので、是非改善をお願いします

roomTip: Immer einen Mückenschutz dabei haben.
text:
Die Mitarbeiter des Karunakarala Resorts sind alle unglaublich freundlich und hilfsbereit, das Essen sehr lecker, die Holzbungalows super gemütlich  (bequemes Bett, Japanisches WC,  Fernseher, 2 ! Klimaanlagen, Kühlschrank, Safe und Balkon) und sowohl die Ärztinnen als auch die Therapeuten sehr fürsorglich, kompetent und angenehm. Ich hab mich während meines fast 4-wöchigen Aufenthaltes wirklich super erholen können - trotz gelegentlichem Eisenbahn- und Fluglärm, der die ortsüblichen Tierlaute (Gezwitscher der Vögel, Rara der Raben, Quaken der Frösche etc.) kurzfristig übertönte - 
und würde jederzeit wieder in diesem Resort Kur-Urlaub machen.
title: Wunderbare Ayurveda-Kur in gepflegtem, freundlichen und gemütlichen Resort

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Maniumpathy was where my fiancé and I chose to have our registration ceremony. I was in contact with Koshita to organise the event from the start. The space is so perfect for a mini event, and the vibe/ architecture reflect Sri Lankan culture quite well. The food and the service was excellent at the event. The staff was very nice. Everything from planning to the special day was done well with help from Koshita. Definitely will recommend.
title: Event hosted at Maniumpathy

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: You could not go wrong choosing Maniumpathy to stay in in Colombo. Pure indulgent tranquility.
text: The staff and the hotel were exceptional. Exceeded our expectations. Very professional staff, always on hand to assist and provide useful local tips and information. Great food and the accommodation was colonial and beautifully styled,, very comfortable and in a fantastic location. It is a special place and we will return.
title: it was a beautiful experience

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: We had an amazing time at this hotel. This is our third time in Sri Lanka and by far the best hospitality and food!! For context we stayed at many five star hotels including notable Sri Lankan chains and the food was exquisite and staff so friendly and really went the extra mile! Couldn't recommend more!! Shout outs to Amila and Gayan - you rock.
title: A very special experience !!!

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Busy road outside hotel We found it useful to use Uber Tuk Tuks to get around the city So cheap and plentiful
text: A gem in a busy city Charming boutique hotel in an old colonial setting  with only 7 rooms Staff welcoming ,accommodating and very friendly Food delicious  at breakfast , lunch and dinner Room very spacious and comfortable We will certainly return if we are back in Sri Lanka
title: A gem in a busy city

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: The perfect place to recuperate after 24 hours of long haul travel. Elegant and luxurious without being stuffy.  Staff are open and attentive without being overbearing. Breakfast an absolute treat. An oasis in a vibrant-but-sometime-chaotic city. We loved it.
title: An oasis of elegance and calm.

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel is small and intimate with gorgeously appointed rooms surrounding a courtyard and swimming pool. Originally a private house for 5 generations of family and now an elegant hotel. Staff are kind and friendly. Rooms are luxurious. Meals are taken in the garden and the menu is excellent. Couldn’t ask for more!
title: Small boutique hotel in Colombo!

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Such a beautiful oasis in the heart of Colombo. Understated excellence from every team member at the property. We felt at home from the moment we arrived. Beautiful food, rooms and ambience. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. Simply superb on every level!
title: Maniumpathy where magic happens!

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: What a wonderful stay! We arrived at 4am after 20 hours of flying and were so happy to arrive to this little gem of a hotel. The service was warm and friendly, the bed was cozy and a/c worked like a charm! Our rate also included a terrific breakfast. Highly recommend!
title: Maniumpathy Hotel 5 stars! ⭐️

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Superb location, lovely setting and truly lovely service. Great air conditioning, food excellent, quiet, pool warm! Spa cheap. A very welcoming place. Room spacious. tuk tuk is 2 dollars to anywhere. Great cappuchinos. Will come back again.
title: Perfect colombo stop

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: No twin rooms
text:
A delightful oasis in the middle of Colombo in a quiet street. Beautiful old merchant's house filled with antiques. Lovely courtyard with pool and charming attentive staff. Unusual menu and delicious breakfasts and best coffee in Sri Lanka.
Rohanes the masseur, was outstanding!
title: Perfect place to stay

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
Ein ruhiges kleines Stadthotel, ein Boutique Hotel in ein etwas mehr als hundertjährigen Haus, etwas ab vom Stadtzentrum ( nicht fussläufig), aber mit kleinem Pool im Innenhof. 
Das Restaurant ist exzellent. Wir haben auf unserer Rundreise hier am besten in einem Hotel gegessen. Es sind sodann auch Einheimische im Hotel Restaurant, z.B. für einen Business Lunch anzutreffen.
title: Historisches Boutique Hotel mit exzellentem Restaurant.

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: What a gorgeous boutique hotel in the heart of Colombo. You enter the stunning hotel into a beautifully furnished lobby lounge area. Stunning dining room off to one side. I'd love to have eaten there. Beautiful tranquil courtyard with small, welcoming swimming pool with loungers on one side. Lovely helpful staff and delicious food served in a dining area off the courtyard. The rooms were gorgeous and also just off the courtyard. Beautiful sumptuous beds, tastefully decorated room, thoughtfully stocked mini fridge, quality linen and mosquito net, good lighting and quirky, partially outdoor, bathroom divided into three sections (almost like a stable block with wooden separators between the shower, basin and loo). Just a great amount of detail. A perfect place to end our Sri Lanka holiday. Ended on a high note. An oasis of calm!
title: Haven in the city

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel is away from the busy centre of Colombo in a more residential district. All the rooms are immaculately fitted with furniture to match the colonial style of the house, although the bathrooms are modern and clean. Beds are very comfortable. The Ultra Suites on the upper floor have balconies. The restaurant menu is cosmopolitan and the food is excellent. Colombo does not have much for tourists, but if you go there this is the place to stay!
title: Great oasis from the city

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Zur individuellen Weiterreise unbedingt ein Auto über das Hotel buchen!
text:
Dieses Boutique Hotel kann ich wärmstens empfehlen! 

Wir haben uns hier sehr wohl gefühlt, was an der überragenden Freundlichkeit und Servicebereitschaft des gesamten Personals liegt. 

Die kleine Anlage ist sehr stilvoll gestaltet und lässt überall die reiche Geschichte des Gebäudes und seiner Bewohner erkennen. Das Hotel ist stilistisch stringent gestaltet und sehr stimmungsvoll.. 

Unser Zimmer war sehr gut geschnitten, bot ein komfortables Bett und angenehme Wäsche, gute Klimatisierung und ein großzügiges Outdoor Bad in einem nicht einsehbar Patio. 

An beiden Abenden haben wir unser Dinner im lauschigen Atrium Garten auf der Terrasse genossen.  Die Speisen, wie auch das Frühstück waren köstlich.
Wir fühlten uns rundum verwöhnt und umsorgt!
title: Glückliche Wahl! Schwer zu toppen

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Nous avons séjourné une nuit dans cet excellent hôtel situé dans le quartier des ambassades de Colombo. Ancienne bâtisse coloniale très bien conservée avec seulement 7 chambres, très spatiales et bien décorée en ce qui nous concerne. La qualité du service est remarquable, tout le staff est très serviable et agréable. Literie confortable, douche et baignoire dans la salle de bains. Petite piscine, ce n’est pas le principal atout du lieu mais c’est agréable quand même ! Petit déjeuner au top, nous n’avons pas dîné sur place.
title: Beaucoup de charme et service excellent !

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
We like small hotels because they are far from the huge conformist brands you find all over the world. This hotel, only 7 rooms was previously a residence and has been turned into the most fabulous hideaway. 
Our room, Cynthia, was on the first floor and was exactly what we wanted. It has traditional decor but with modern amenities. So often in Asia ‘traditional’ means tired - far from it at Maniumpathy, here it felt neat, contemporary and supremely comfortable whilst also being immaculate. The minibar was also free!
The food was excellent and pretty much any tastes can be accommodated. As other reviews state the Thali is a great start. Drinks are reasonably priced and the ambience is perfect. 
Levels of service beat many 5 star hotels and nothing is too much trouble. 
Because it is small and I think offers its services as a restaurant to non residents the tiny restaurant can fill up but this was never problematic to us. Our room was one of the closest to the restaurant and whilst not a problem to us as we sleep well, lighter sleepers might wish to request a different room. 
We would definitely come back!
title: Calm, peaceful and a wonderful way to start a holiday.

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
Our second time at this beautiful, tranquil haven - this time with the family to celebrate special family events. Well appointed comfortable rooms, friendly staff and wonderful food. This is an exquisite house lovingly restored with great attention to detail. It reeks of old world charm with service to match. 
Couldn’t have chosen better
title: Perfection

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Great hotel worth the price (expensive). Nice superior suite and great bathroom with both bathtub and shower and separate restrooms. Everything was perfect from the softness of the bath robe to the quality of the bed and the complementary mini-bar (beer, juice, french red wine, chips, fruit platter and cookies/chocolate). We had a small garden with a table and chairs. The breakfast is served at table no buffet but great quality of everything from curd granola to fruits and bread basket (we didn’t try the savoury choice). The small garden/patio with a small pool is perfect to relax and enjoy. Old house very well maintained and amazing friendly staff always smiling and trying to do its best to make you feel at home. The allowed us to enjoy our room until our departure time at 2 pm and they kept our fruits into their fridge. Really great stay for people who can afford. The spa is great too and the man massage professional is really good at work. I enjoyed a lot for a very reasonable price.
title: Great stay in a old house with friendly staff

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: A safe tranquil luxurious spot that was just what I needed after a long flight. Beautiful surroundings, a gorgeous suite just for me (I was upgraded), roll top bath, tasty breakfast and amazing dinner. Highly recommended. What more could you ask for?
title: Hidden gem. What a treat.

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
Wonderful peace on arrival late at night after a long long day of travel. Beautiful building and room. Wonderful food and breakfast hoppers. Saw my first ever woodpecker in the garden. We needed to relax after weeks of busy work. We were rewarded in spades. 
Best part were the wonderful staff.  Highly recommend.
title: Wonderful peaceful start to holiday

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: A wonderful stay at Clove Villa! The property and rooms are beautifully decorated and the service simply outstanding. The team caught wind that it was my birthday while we were staying and went to the extra effort of making a cake for our last breakfast :)
title: A wonderful 2 night stay in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Wonderful stay at this beautiful boutique hotel, the staff were friendly and welcoming Omesh greeted us with a smile and made our short stay memorable the food was incredible. The rooms a big and comfortable and decorated in such a lovely way. It felt like a private house great location just out of the main town with an easy tuk tuk ride into Kandy.
title: Beautiful boutique hotel amazing staff

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: The staff make this the most wonderful boutique hotel experience. Rooms are beautiful, super clean and comfortable.   Breakfasts and dinners are prepared with attention to detail  - great Sri Lankan flavours. Pool and garden offer tranquility.
title: Truly a delight

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Un accueil remarquable avec un personnel tellement serviable et gentil.

Deux chambres réservées pour la famille et les deux étaient super confortables.

Le dîner était excellent et fait à la demande.

Un vrai coup de cœur. 
Nous recommandons vivement
title: Excellente adresse !

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel only has 7 rooms. This means it's really quiet and relaxing but does somewhat limit the offering. There's no bar (but you can order drinks) and meal choices are a bit restricted (particularly breakfast). If you are OK with that then it really is fabulous. The rooms are a decent size and recently decorated to a high standard with quite a bit of character. 

Even if the food choice is a bit limited, the standard is very high - really delicious curries. The service is great too - one guy looked after us all the time (Dani I think) and he was very friendly and efficient throughout.

It's a bit out of the centre of Kandy but it's worth the journey to stay somewhere this pleasant.
title: Great option for a stay in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We have just stayed at the Clove Villa hotel Kandy for 3 nights . The room was lovely and clean and had everything you needed. The staff were all very helpful and polite. The food was exceptional, the chef prepared the meals with a lot of style and care, the flavours were delicious . 
Highly recommend this hotel .
title: Very comfortable stay with great food and staff .

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed just one night in this small boutique hotel that is slightly away from the centre of Kandy .

It is beautifully clean and stylishly designed . Our ground floor room was  spacious with a good bathroom and nice linens . 

Unfortunately because we were the only guests that evening the chef had been given the night off and so we had to go out for supper . The breakfast however was very good .

We didn’t use the pool which looked a little on the small side.

The manager was delightful and very attentive without getting in the way.

It was a great place for an overnight stop but on reflection we thought that it was a little on the expensive side .
title: A lovely overnight spot

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We recently had 2 nights at Clove Villa as part of a trip around Sri Lanka and thoroughly recommend it.  Danushka was so friendly and helpful and the food from Yohan was absolutely delicious.  There is a jackfruit tree in the garden & they made a delicious jackfruit curry for us that night after discussing it.  Certainly one of the top in our stay.  A lovely calm oasis in Kandy
title: Lovely calm oasis in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Boutiquehotel.
Ruhig gelegene Villa mit sehr ansprechendem Interieur, sehr gediegen, angenehme Atmosphäre.
Wir hatten ein sehr großes Zimmer, sehr gut ausgestattet, mit außenliegendem, privaten Whirlpool!
Halbpension: sehr gutes Frühstück und Abendessen.
sehr freundliches und stets hilfsbereites Personal.
In dem manchmal etwas chaotischen Kandy eine Insel der Ruhe und des Entspannens!
title: Viel Stil und Charme

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Lovely small hotel with very accomodating management (we were able to switch after one night to a first floor room with balcony). Rooms are very comfortable despite a surfeit of ornamonts.
Swimming pool was fine but it is shaded and the water temperature was too cool for us.
The pool table was good fun.
We stayed three nights (in retrospect I think two is enough for Kandy) and dined at the hotel each evening. Food was very good which is just as well as there are no alternative options within walking distance (there is a big hotel across the road but they only offered a buffet service) whereas Clove Villa cooked to order.
title: Recommended

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Wonderful stay in this lovely small boutique hotel. The staff go to great lengths to ensure that everything is just so for you. Food is delicious, we like spice, so the dishes were prepared with extra spice for us. Beer, gin and wine available. The pool is very refreshing and big enough to get some lengths in. Would certainly recommend and visit again if in Kandy.
title: Great stay in lovely hotel.

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Det beste med Clove Villa var den hyggelige, personlige  og uanstrengte servicen vi fikk fra alle deler av personalet. Blant de fem hotellene vi besøkte på vår Sri Lanka rundreise var dette stedet der vi følte oss mest velkomne. Det sier ikke lite for vi fikk god service på alle  hotellene vi besøkte
title: God personlig service , følte oss "hjemme"

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Eat in, the quality of the food and the care taken in preparation by the chef/patron is second to none.
text:
A small boutique villa in a quiet street, providing an oasis of calm & tranquillity in Kandy. Excellent sized room with all the facilities you could require for a three night stay. View looking over the garden & pool an added bonus.
Lots of comfortable plush sofas & seating in the public area adding to the relaxing feel.
We ate dinner on all three nights as the incredible quality of the meals was a highlight of the visit. All freshly prepared on pre-order by the chef/patron. Breakfast was also to a very high standard. All staff were competent, efficient and very friendly. A thoroughly enjoyable stay & probably our best in Sri Lanka.
title: Just Sublime!

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Was für ein Erlebnis. Das kleine, wunderschön eingerichtet Hotel ist magisch. Das Personal, vor allem Umesh, war mehr als aufmerksam und hat uns jeden Wunsch von den Lippen abgelesen. 
Ich kann dieses Hotel uneingeschränkt empfehlen. Herrlich!
title: Exzellent

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel is cozya and very clean, with quiet rooms and a very relaxing bed. The staff is incredibly friendly, making the stay even more enjoyable. The food was absolutely outstanding—one of the best we had in Sri Lanka! and definitely a highlight of the experience!
title: Great place in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Our travel plans changed and, at the last minute, we needed a place to stay in Kandy. How lucky we were to secure the last remaining room at the beautiful, small, luxurious hotel. The first thing that stood out were wonderful staff who were always available and happy to help, first class service. We slept very well in a comfortable bed in our beautifully appointed bedroom which had everything that we could possibly need provided. We thought we had eaten well on our travels in Sri Lanka, but the food here was divine, especially the butter chicken. It was great to be able to relax around the pool away from the hustle and bustle of Kandy. I would give Clove Villa six stars if I could.
title: Fabulous

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Dit is een mooi kleinschalig hotel met een zeer gastvrije en persoonlijke ontvangst. Alle ruimtes zijn sfeervol en zeer schoon. Wij hadden een mooie kamer, mooie badkamer en een fijn zwembad. En dat in de stad Kandy. Zeer attent, kundig en vriendelijk personeel. We hebben er heerlijk gegeten, zowel ontbijt als avondeten. Kortom, dit hotel is een aanrader voor iedereen die de bijzondere stad Kandy wil bezoeken.
title: Rustpunt in een drukke stad

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If by the pool as the sun goes down, insect repellent is a must.
text:
If you want somewhere peaceful on the outskirts of Kandy, Clove Villa is perfect. A warm welcome from the staff who were all very friendly and attentive throughout our stay. Our room was beautifully furnished, very clean and comfortable. There is a small pool with loungers which is a  haven after the busy city.
Special mention to the chef. Breakfast was very good but dinner, on both evenings,  was absolutely delicious. Some of the best food that we've had in Sri Lanka so far. I can highly recommend Clove Villa when in Kandy.
title: Two night stay at Clove Villa

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Die Villa ist einfach sensationell. 
Sauber und gepflegt. Sehr stilvolle Einrichtung, genau wie auf den Bildern. Umesh ist ein wuderbarer Koch und ist auch sonst um das wohlergehen der Gäste besorgt. Die Mitarbeiter sind sehr freundlich und aufmersam. Der Poolbereich ist gepflegt und abgeschirmt. Es gibt viele Aufenthaltsbereiche in der Villa. Man muss nicht im Zimmer bleiben. Der Billiardbereich bietet auch Abwechslung. Der Whirlpool ist die Spitze des Eisbergs. Es ist einfach eine wunderbare Oase im sonstigen Kandy. 
Ein super Team, glückwunsch!!!
title: Oase in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Die Villa liegt in ruhiger, aber zentraler Lage von Kandy. Unser Zimmer war hochwertig eingerichtet, sehr komfortabel und sauber. Zum Dinner gab es eine hervorragende Auswahl vegetarischer Currys. Besonders hervorzuheben ist die Freundlichkeit und Aufmerksamkeit des gesamten Teams. Wir haben den Aufenthalt sehr genossen.
title: Feines Boutiquehotel in ruhiger Lage und hervorragendem Essen.

placeInfo/address: Hemas Limited Halgranoya, Ragala, Nuwara Eliya, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring your books.  Do the tea plantation walk.  Enjoy the afternoon snacks.  Have the Sri Lanka curry for dinner at least one night.
text:
We asked our travel company for a tea plantation stay.  We wanted an elegant place, preferably isolated and with great food and service.  

The Stafford bungalow delivered all of this and more.  Our guide had a call from the hotel on the morning of our arrival to check details and make sure they were ready for us.   We were warmly welcomed and taken to our lovely room.   Each room has its own private garden as well as the extensive grounds of the hotel.   Very comfortable and had everything we needed.   We were the only guests for one night which made it all very exclusive and special.  Another couple joined us for two nights and was also nice to chat and share experiences with them.  

We had a light snack every day at 3pm.  A savoury bite and a sweet treat.  Plus coffee and tea.  This was perfect for us as we found that the breakfast filled us up and the dinners were good too.   You do have to discuss breakfast options the day before if you want things  like hoppers and they like to get your dinner choice before 4pm.   We enjoyed all our meals with the Sri Lankan curry on our middle night being a real favorite for us both.   

There is nothing immediately around the bungalow.  Just the tea plantation.  There is a village about 2km away but we didn’t leave the bungalow for 3 days other than to do the tea plantation walk with very knowledgeable guide.  
It’s a place to relax, swim, read books and pretend you own the place.   The pool was a great touch with a hot tub that needs 30 mins to heat up.  

We found the service to be great.  Staff were on hand when we needed them but not too intrusive. 

Only improvement suggestion - all of our other hotels have us a small gift on our departure, cookies or tea or some spices.  It would be nice if the bungalow also did this.  

We loved our 3 days here and would happily return when we next visit Sri Lanka.
title: A very special place.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Christine,

Thank you for sharing your experience at Stafford Bungalow. We are happy to hear that you had an enjoyable stay with us.

Best Wishes,

The Team at Stafford
placeInfo/address: Hemas Limited Halgranoya, Ragala, Nuwara Eliya, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
I can’t recommend this hotel highly enough. It’s a wonderful, peaceful, relaxing place with fabulous staff and wonderful food.
There are lots of lounge areas to relax and, as it is only has 6 rooms, it could never feel ‘busy’.
Afternoon tea is served from 3-30 - 4.30 every day with breakfast and evening meals being served on the lawn or in the bright open plan dining/lounge area.
I can’t imagine wanting to stay anywhere else, you really must go there if visiting Nuwara Eliya.
title: Superb hotel and staff

text:
The best breakfast we had in sri lanka . 

Das persönliche , wie in einer Familie und trotzdem sehr professionell, hat uns überzeugt. Wir haben es genossen in mitten der grünen Tee Plantagen und dem Vogelgezwitscher zu entspannen. 

Ein Kochkurs, Vogel Spaziergang, Morgenspaziergang durch den Tee, Teefabrikbesichtigung, Sprudel baden im freien, Spaziergang durch den Garten… sie haben ein tolles abwechslungsreiches Angebot. 

Ein Highlight - wenn es kühler wird am Abend werden die Cheminée angezündet und die Betten mit Bettflaschen vorgewärmt - Sehr liebevoll. 

Wir können einen Aufenthalt hier im Stafford sehr empfehlen. Vielen Dank für die nette Betreuung und das vorzügliche Essen.

roomTip: This is a great hotel to explore Colombo. Don’t miss the local restaurants and pubs that surround the hotel, it’s amazing
text:
Our stay at the **Cinnamon Lakeside Hotel** in Colombo was nothing short of exceptional, and we were fortunate enough to stay here twice—once when we first landed in Colombo, and later when we had a layover before our flight the following day. Both times, the experience was truly memorable, and this hotel has now become one of our favorites.

Nestled beautifully on the bank of **Beira Lake**, the hotel’s location is perfect, offering a peaceful oasis right in the heart of the city. Surrounded by the modern skyline of high-rise buildings, including other major hotels, the view from this property is simply breathtaking. It is a stunning blend of urban sophistication and natural beauty, and the moment we arrived, we felt the luxurious yet welcoming atmosphere.

The check-in process was impressively smooth and high-tech, handled entirely on an iPad, which was a refreshing experience. Special thanks to the young trainee, **Mr. Dulimina**, and his manager, **Mr. John**, who went above and beyond to offer us a lake-view room. Their hospitality was top-notch, and we were thrilled with our room.

The room itself was spacious and pristine, offering a spectacular view of the **swimming pool**, **Beira Lake**, and the majestic **Lotus Tower**, which can be seen in all its grandeur, especially at night when it lights up in dazzling colors. The nighttime view of the Lotus Tower from our room was simply enchanting, making the entire stay feel magical.

The housekeeping team did a fantastic job, keeping the room spotless throughout our stay. We were especially happy with the attentive service, as we were provided with water bottles whenever we needed them, even late into the evening.

The **breakfast and dinner** experiences were absolutely WOW! The **Sri Lankan cuisine**—both vegetarian and non-vegetarian—was superb, and the hotel’s elaborate menu of **Indian, Asian, and Italian** dishes left us spoilt for choice. Every meal was a delightful treat, and we truly enjoyed the variety and the delicious flavors.

One of the best things about this hotel is its **central location**. It’s close to local pubs, restaurants, and popular tourist spots like the **Dutch Museum**, which was one of our favorites to explore. Another highlight for us was the **live music** played at the bar, located right in the lobby. Sipping drinks while enjoying the tunes and overlooking the swimming pool made for the perfect relaxing evening.

During our stay, we also had the pleasure of experiencing some amazing events. One memorable night was the **Saturday dance and fun event** hosted by the hotel. It’s a plush event for outside guests, but for hotel guests, entry is free—though drinks are extra. It was a great way to wind down and enjoy the lively atmosphere. As a bonus, we had the chance to meet members of the **Sri Lanka and Bangladesh women’s cricket teams**, who were staying at the hotel, and we even witnessed a beautiful **Sri Lankan wedding** taking place. These unexpected extras added so much to our experience, making it all the more memorable.

Finally, we have to extend a big thank you to **Joshua**, **Tharushi**, and **Madhushikha** from the restaurant, who welcomed us with such warmth and smiles every time we dined there. Their kindness and service made our stay even more enjoyable.

Overall, our experience at Cinnamon Lakeside was absolutely wonderful, and we will **definitely return** to stay here again. The hotel’s mix of luxurious comfort, superb location, and outstanding hospitality has won us over. We can't wait to come back!
title: An unforgettable experience at Cinnamon Lakeside Hotel, Colombo

text:
We had an amazing short visit to Ayurvie Weligama during our stay at the Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa from June 23rd to 25th. Before our visit, we contacted the Resort Manager at Ayurvie Weligama and were warmly welcomed by him and the team for lunch and treatment. The Manager and the Housekeeping Supervisor were kind enough to give us a detailed tour of the property – such a beautiful and serene place!

We enjoyed a delicious lunch featuring fish fingers and sweet potato chips, which was absolutely fantastic. Following lunch, we both experienced Ayurvedic treatments. I was treated by a highly experienced senior therapist, while my husband had an excellent male therapist (a gentle giant!). The treatments were incredibly relaxing and unforgettable.

It’s hard to put into words how special the experience was. We returned to Sri Lanka after 13 years from Italy, and this visit has been a highlight of our trip.

We also had the opportunity to connect with Thema Collection’s marketing division, and as owners of a travel and ticketing agency, we are excited to promote Ayurvie Weligama and the Thema Collection to our clients. In fact, my husband has already decided to send his family to stay and enjoy this wonderful experience.

A heartfelt thank you to the Resort Manager and the entire team at Ayurvie Weligama for your exceptional hospitality.   Moksha & Suneth from Milano.
title: A Memorable Short Stay at Ayurvie Weligama

Ayurveda Drs given not only health consultation and treatment recommendations, they also explain properly what is Ayurveda and how its works and helping in our life. You may come here as solo tourist or couple, just for few days for holidays or for 2weeks treatment. text: Resort bellissimo in una posizione con vista oceano eccezionale. Io avevo una camera singola che non era vista mare ma ugualmente bella. Pulizia eccellente e prodotti per il bagno di alta qualità. Attenzione alla cura dei dettagli e all'ospite massima. Il personale è attento ad ogni esigenza e molto gentile, i terapisti e i dottori sono incantevoli. Il terapista è lo stesso per tutta la durata del soggiorno (grazie a Sujeeva) e i trattamenti sono personalizzati in base alla visita ayurvedica iniziale. Siamo stati in gruppo e a tutti è piaciuto anche il cibo sempre molto vario nonostante l'assenza di carne. Chi sceglie questo resort è per un autentico percorso di purificazione ayurvedico, mi sarebbe piaciuto usufruire del percorso completo (panchakarma) ma siamo rimasti pochi giorni, suggerisco almeno 10 notti. Non vengono serviti alcolici ma solo acqua calda ai pasti e tisane prescritte dopo la visita. Alla fine del soggiorno c'è anche un consulto finale molto apprezzato con tanti consigli utili per mantenere lo stile di vita e l'alimentazione equilibrata. Ho apprezzato che non hanno per niente proposto vendita di prodotti naturali che ci hanno fornito durante il soggiorno, al punto che siamo stati noi a richiederne l'acquisto. In genere evito di tornare negli stessi posti ma mi farebbe piacere ripetere l'esperienza in questo resort. Grazie anche ad Emile per le lezioni di yoga e meditazione, insegnante molto preparato
title: bellissima esperienza ayurvedica

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Kathy,

Thank you so much for your lovely feedback. We’re truly happy to hear that your experience at Ayurvie Weligama was so positive and healing from start to finish.

It means a lot to us that you felt cared for by our team—from the warm welcome by manager Dimuthu, the thoughtful treatments by Dr. Isuru and Sriyani, the peaceful yoga sessions with Emil, to the delicious meals prepared for your dosha. Your kind words have touched everyone here.

We’re so glad you found peace and balance during your stay, and we look forward to welcoming you back whenever you need to recharge.

Wishing you continued healing and happiness,
Ayurvie Weligama Management Team
placeInfo/address: No 212 Sangananda Mawatha Weligama, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The hotel is closing for renovations in April/May 2025 as the pool decking needs attention .
text:
My whole experience from start to finish has been absolutely amazing !
On arrival I was greeted by Dimutha with a smiling face and fruit cocktail followed by a foot massage straight away after a long flight from the UK.
My room was very clean , light and spacious overlooking the infinity pool and the beach. Hearing the waves of the sea every day was like a meditation so straight away I started to feel at one with the energy of Sri Lanka .
My consultation the next day with Dr Isura was to discuss my physical, mental and emotional concerns . He fulfilled all of these things with my programme in a warm, kind and empathic manner and took everything into consideration of my needs .
The treatments were every day for fourteen days with the most wonderful compassionate therapist Sriyani who I connected with straight away . She is a top class therapist who works on a very deep level covering all my concerns  . I can honestly say she is the best therapist I have ever come across and works so hard  as she radiates love and healing from her heart . All the therapists were always smiling as it’s such a happy place to be .
Every day at 6.30am I went to a yoga class with Emil who is a highly qualified teacher . All of his classes and meditation classes were very composed and healing overlooking the stunning views of the bay . I learnt a lot from him about yoga and his breathing techniques.
I also want to mention the wonderful food prepared every day by the chefs and for the waiters for their excellent service as nothing was too much trouble . Also credit to their manager Nipun . There were many choices of food and always varied as my dosha is Vata. The teas are wonderful so I have bought some back home . I didn’t miss coffee after 3 days which I was surprised about and also of course there is no alcohol .
All the staff were excellent so my whole experience has made me feel calm , lighter , brighter and healed . I was the only English person at the hotel but everyone was happy so I just felt the vibe so it didn’t matter as I so needed to detach anyway from the pace of life .

I have bought back some of the Sri Lankan happiness and love and I hope that I can keep in this positive bubble to continue healing in the pace of life that we all live in. 
I will definitely be coming back again to re-balance and recharge and have peace of mind .
title: Spiritual Journey of healing

text:
I have been on several ajurveda trips in Sri Lanka, but hotel Ajurvie Weligama is by far the best. We had an excellent stay, with gorgeous sea view from our room and the swimming pool. I highly appreciate the staff, they were very polite and thanks to them our rooms were always clean and with a lovely scent, especially the towels. 
Food was very good and always fresh. Massages were excellent. I highly appreciate good wifi connection since not all hotels in Sri Lanka have this opportunity. 
Special thanks goes to the Hotel manager Dimuthu - he does everything he can to make your stay special. He took excellent care of us during the last day our our stay and made our leaving much more pleasant (we had a late flight).
If I go to Sri Lanka again next year, I will definitely choose this hotel. 
Jana and Elena, Slovakia
title: Excellent ajurveda stay

Thank you so much for your heartfelt and thoughtful review. We are truly grateful for your continued trust in Ayurvie and for bringing your group back to us. It brings us great joy to know that your experience – and that of your group – was so positive and impactful.

We are especially pleased to hear your kind words about our team, from the reservation staff and therapists to Dr. Isuru and the medical professionals. placeInfo/address: No 212 Sangananda Mawatha Weligama, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
For the second time, I spent three weeks with my group in Ayurvie at the end of March and the beginning of April. As an Ayurvedic travel agent, I perceived the reactions not only of my group but also of the other guests at the resort. The service is of a very high standard, despite the fact that I was interpreting for several people, everything was very well organised. To begin with the reservations department has an amazing team who go out of their way to help with booking suitable rooms, also to give advice. The manager - Mr. Dimuthu is very helpful and checks every day to make sure the guests are happy. All the staff at Ayurvie are very professional, helpful, one feels really welcome there. The medical team is very thorough, helpful and very empathetic. Every small problem they immediately solve and help really with heart. I have seen how the health problems of the people in my group have improved significantly and they have expressed an interest in coming back again. The therapists are experienced, meticulous and can empathise beautifully with the client, which is very essential. You just mention at reception that you have a problem with something and the remedy happens straight away. 
As I have been involved in nutrition for over 10 years and Ayurvedic nutrition for several years, I follow this part of the Ayurvedic journey very closely. From repeated experience, I see great potential in Dr. Isuru's nutritional recommendations and also all my clients follow these recommendations with enthusiasm. It is nutritionally balanced and sustainable in the long term even in our European conditions. So that is really effective. And most importantly, people have success in losing weight and in improving their health. So I am very happy to continue working with him and send to Ayurvie my individual clients too.
title: Great group ayurvedic retreat

text:
My experience at Ayurvie Weligama was truly exceptional. From the moment I arrived, the service was outstanding, and the staff were incredibly warm, welcoming, and attentive. They made me feel at ease right away.

The doctor was especially lovely. She took the time to thoroughly understand my needs, tailoring my treatment to target specific areas for improvement. It felt deeply personalized and authentic. I was fortunate to have Sriyani as my therapist throughout my stay. She was not only incredibly kind and sweet but also radiated a positive energy that truly enhanced the entire experience. Having the same therapist for my entire treatment journey added an extra layer of comfort and trust. Sriyani worked closely with the doctor, ensuring that my treatments were continually adjusted to suit my preferences and needs.

The yoga sessions were another highlight. They were not only excellent but also profoundly authentic. I looked forward to each morning’s class, where the teacher dedicated time and care to explain every movement of each asana. I appreciated the attention to detail, as it helped me learn how to perform the asanas correctly to maximize their health benefits.

My only piece of feedback would be that the property could benefit from a refurbishment. Although the location is stunning, with breathtaking views and a prime setting, I felt the rooms didn’t quite match the high standard of service. That said, the exceptional service and overall experience far outweighed this small aspect.
I left Ayurvie Weligama with a warm feeling in my heart, and I will definitely be returning. It was a memorable and rejuvenating experience.
title: Amazing Experience at Ayurvie Weligama

text: Aufgrund eines Buchungsfehlers haben wir kurzfristig eine neue Unterkunft für unseren diesjährigen Sri Lanka Aufenthalt gebraucht und sind auf das Ayurvie Weligama gestoßen. Eigentlich sind wir keine „Hotel-Urlauber“, aber schon bei der Ankunft haben wir uns spontan „verliebt“. Wir wurden herzlich mit einer Begrüßungsszeremonie in Empfang genommen, bevor wir unser Zimmer beziehen konnten. Wunderschönes, super sauberes Zimmer. Großes Badezimmer mit hauseigenen Pflegeprodukten (täglich gereinigt). Super bequemes Bett. Balkon mit Blick auf Anlage u. Meer. Die täglichen Ayurveda-Anwendungen waren hervorragend (ca. 2 Std.). Vielen Dank an der Stelle an die/den wundervollen Therapeutin/en Lashan u. Sujeewa, die auf unsere Problemstellen professionell eingegangen sind. Ebenso herzlichen Dank an Dr. Isuru, der immer ein offenes Ohr für einen hatte. Herzlichen Dank auch an das gesamte Team von der Küche, Kellner, Rezeption, Pool usw.!! Die Speisen werden in Buffet-Form gereicht. Geschmacklich 10/10. Wir würden dieses Ressort auch an Alleinreisende empfehlen. Gerne wieder.
title: Wunderschöner Ort für eine Ayurveda-Auszeit

Mit herzlichen Grüßen,
Ayurvie Weligama Team
placeInfo/address: No 212 Sangananda Mawatha Weligama, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir haben eine 3-wöchige Ayurvie-Kur unter der fachkundigen Leitung des Chefarztes Dr. Herath verbracht. Dazu einige Bemerkungen: (1) Die heilmedizinische Betreuung war hervorragend.
(2) Der Therapist Vijith und die Therapistin Gayan haben durch ihre charismatische Art und ihre Professionalität vollends überzeugt. Die Behandlungen waren auf uns perfekt abgestimmt.
(3) Das Service Personal war immer sehr freundlich, zuvorkommend und um unser Wohlbefinden bemüht.
(4) Das Essen wahr lecker, wir hätten uns jedoch ein bisschen mehr Abwechslung gewünscht.

Wir haben uns rundum wohl gefühlt. Der einzige kleine Kritikpunkt: Am ersten Tag wäre eine Einführung in das Konzept betr. erster Konsultation, Essen und Ausflugsmöglichkeiten ideal.

Nochmals vielen Dank an alle, insbesondere an die beiden Therapisten, die wir sehr lieb gewonnen haben.

Daniela & Jaime
title: Erstklassige Ayurvie Erfahrung im süden Sri Lankas

Dear Valued Guest,
Ayubowan..! (May you be blessed with a long life)

Thank you for sharing your feedback and for choosing to stay with us at Wattura Resort & Spa. We’re delighted to hear you enjoyed the beauty of our resort, the cleanliness of the rooms, and the overall service provided by our team.

We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you experienced at the restaurant during the off-season. Your comments are greatly appreciated and have been shared with our culinary team to improve menu availability and enhance service speed, regardless of the season.

Your suggestion regarding pre-ordering is very helpful, and we’ll continue to encourage this as an option for a smoother dining experience. We also acknowledge the limited access to outside dining options and are working on enhancing our in-house offerings to better accommodate our guests.

Thank you once again for your valuable input. We truly hope to welcome you back during peak season for an even more seamless and enjoyable experience.

Best Regards,

Food was delicious. We enjoyed each meal.

Staff was so generous and humble and enjoyed a good service.

I would happily recommend Wattura Resort for a relaxed stay with quality service and delicious food.
title: Excellent stay with quality service and delicious food

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,
Ayubowan..! (May you be blessed with a long life)

Thank you for taking the time to share such a detailed and thoughtful review of your recent stay with us at Wattura Resort & Spa.

We are truly delighted to hear that your experience exceeded expectations — from the smooth check-in and the comfort of our private villa to the peaceful surroundings and the unique design features like the papaya leaf-inspired shower. It’s also wonderful to know that you appreciated the convenience of in-villa check-in and dining flexibility.

A special thank you for acknowledging Tharaka’s efforts. We’re thrilled that he played a key role in making your stay so memorable. He, along with the rest of our team, is dedicated to ensuring our guests receive the highest level of personalized service, and your kind words will be shared with them all.

We’ve also taken note of your feedback regarding the Carbonara pasta, and we appreciate your constructive suggestion. Guest insights like yours help us continuously improve and perfect our culinary offerings.

We’re so happy to know that your visit was one of your best stays so far and that you plan to return. We look forward to welcoming you back for another exceptional escape — perhaps an even better one!

Best Regards,
placeInfo/address: No 1271, Kammala South, Waikkala, Negombo, Waikkal 61110 Sri Lanka
text:
I must say this stay was one of the best stays so far,This place was first recommended by one of my friends and since then we have been excited to experience what the WATTURA resort had to offer and it clearly did not disappoint.
We booked a two night stay at one one of the villas,
And when we checked in it was quick and smooth,we did not have to wait as they quickly took us to our villa and the payments were done at the villa itself which was convenient.
The villa was amazing,had our own mini private pool and the room was quite spacious and I guess the highlight was the bath room with a nice tub in the middle and the shower area with a papaya leaf inspired shower which was quite interesting,
When we checked in we were introduced to THARAKA who was there to assist us at any given time,and he did not disappoint us at all,
We communicated from watsapp and he was always quick to respond and attend to our needs.
From the dinner to breakfast he gave us the option of dining at the villa or the Pappali restaurant at our own convenience.
The food was really good and the portion size was perfect too.only thing I could highlight as a minus was that the carbonara pasta was made with cream which was still tasty but could have done with  cheese and egg yolk.
The main pool was also really nice in the evenings overlooking the sea.
All in all we had an amazing time thanks to THARAKA who was always assisting us and the rest of the staff who were also very friendly.
Thank you and we would definitely come again to have even better experience than this.
title: One of the Best stays with quiet surroundings,good food and amazing staff.

text:
The resort was nothing short of spectacular. From the service to the attention to detail. We want to thank all of the staff who made our stay  absolutely phenomenal and memorable - Mr. Tharaka, Ms.Kusala, Mr. Kalpadilanjana (who, if he didn’t reach out to me so promptly, we would have ended up booking elsewhere), Mr. Thilina, the manager Mr. De Zoysa and Mr. Tishan. 
The food was above and beyond one’s best expectations and the quantity staggering. The pools were sparkling, cool and calming. The beaches were clean and mesmerizing, with its tranquil shores and beautiful breeze. The kids had a variety of things to do in the game room, and at the kids water playground. We were also able to play some pool.
If there is any suggestions we could make it would be the availability of the transportation at a more nominal price and to ensure all the arcade games are working. 
For the price we paid we went in with very high expectations and our expectations were easily met and exceeded. Thank you so much for the vacation of a lifetime.
title: Grace and Grandeur: our phenomenal stay at Wattura Resort and Spa

No wish that wasn't fulfilled immediately, empathetic conversations with the doctors who tailored the daily treatments (2x 1.5 hours each!) and, above all, wonderful therapists with golden hands. I came home very refreshed in every respect and will definitely come back!

placeInfo/address: Jesu Nasarenu Mawatha Thoppu Thota, Waikkal 61110 Sri Lanka
text:
Dieses Ayurveda Resort ist unglaublich!
Es hat all meine Erwartungen übertroffen. Eine wunderschöne Anlage direkt am Fluss gelegen. Die hochwertigen und ausgezeichnet ausgestatteten Cottages sind im Garten gelegen. Mitten in der Natur und gleich bei dem Restaurant, dem Empfang, dem Doktorhaus und dem Spa. Fabelhafte Ärztinnen, die jeden Tag am Morgen die Therapien für den Tag festlegen. Fantastische Therapeutinnnen, die einen mit Massagen und anderen Anwendung kompetent und mit Herz verwöhnen. 
Sehr leckeres und abwechslungsreiches Essen mit viel Obst und Gemüse: traditionelle Küche und westliche Gerichte. Überraschend dass es neben den nach Doshas ausgerichteten Speisen sogar Fisch oder Huhn gibt. 
Jeden Morgen eine Yogastunde, jeden Tag Konsultation mit den Ärztinnen und 2x 90 Minuten Anwendungen jeden Tag!
Es bleiben keine Wünsche unerfüllt!
Der Weg in die trubelige Stadt oder an den Strand ist nicht weit. 
Es gibt Ausflugmöglichkeiten mit dem Boot auf dem Fluss oder mit dem Tuk Tuk  oder mit dem Fahrrad. 
Am Nachmittag stehen Vorträge, Kochvorführungen oder Meditation auf dem Programm. 
Es wird sehr viel geboten für den Preis!
Und das beste sind die ausgesprochen freundlichen Menschen, die sich voller Hingabe um alles kümmern!
Ich werde auf jeden Fall wieder kommen. 14/10
title: Fantastisches Ayurveda Resort, dass alle Wünsche erfüllt!

text: Si vous voulez bénéficier d une véritable prise en charge ayurvedique, sérieuse , dans le respect le plus total de l ayurveda allez au Karunakarala ! Je souffre d arthrose dégénérative précoce très sévère ! A 50 ans j ai déjà 2 prothèses de hanches , d énormes problèmes sur la colonne vertébrale. La médecine occidentale ne pouvant plus rien faire pour mes douleurs et ma mobilité limitée j ai voulu tenté la médecine ayurvedique ! J ai pris la cure de 21 jours spéciale maladie chronique ! Un pur miracle ! La prise en charge a été exceptionnelle ! Un grand professeur en ayurveda venait me voir en dehors de son travail à l hôpital et la clinique, un homme d une gentillesse ! Tous les jours visite médicale avec les médecins du Resort ! Des femmes exceptionnelles ! La prise en charge médicale aussi bien par voie orale ( poudres, pilules ect ) que par les pâtes appliquées sur mon corps , et les mains expertes de chandrika qui a un niveau de compétence d un physiothérapeute/ kiné , plus une alimentation saine ayurvedique, perte de 5 kg en 21 j . Vous rajoutez à cela des soins du visage, du cuir chevelu et de la réflexologie plantaire. Bilan de ma cure diminution des douleurs de 80% et une mobilité retrouvée ! Tout le personnel du Resort est d une bienveillance et d une gentillesse hors du commun !!
title: Cure ayurvedique miraculeuse !
