text:
I don’t know where to begin! The photos don’t even do this property justice - the rooms, the pool, the sunsets and the peaceful vibe of this hotel are unmatched. We were lucky enough to get married here and spend 3 nights with our family and I can’t explain to you how beautiful it was. The whole team went above and beyond to make it the most special time for us - can’t thank them enough! The food was AMAZING, the sunset was the best we’ve ever seen and the private beach made this property an absolute stand out. This is somewhere you could stay for a week or more as the room, location and  food are just perfect to unwind and relax.  The rooms and bathrooms are huge and absolutely stunning, all with amazing views and we had the best sleeps here. 

We were technically here in “off season” and it was still incredible due to the awesome pool that feels like it’s floating above the ocean. The beach is also basically private due to the hotels position and it is so so beautiful. We will certainly be back - I even cried leaving Kumu Beach after having best experience and not wanting to leave. Lucky we were going to more Teardrop Group properties after - all of which are amazing! 

ALL the staff, chefs and management were so accommodating and my family cannot thank them enough for the most beautiful time.
title: Breathtaking sunsets, stunning property and incredible staff! Slice of paradise.

placeInfo/address: 670/5 Galle Road, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text:
Kumu is a beautifully appointed guest house, beach front with five star service. 
Our daughter decided to have her destination wedding at the property, which was amazing. The staff made sure the day was memorable with a dash of Sri Lankan culture, which included traditional Sri Lankan dancers and singers, concluding with a delicious Sri Lankan Feast for all the family.
Our Australian family of all ages really enjoyed the property, especially relaxing and swimming in the lovely pool. 
We had a variety of room types and all were well appointed and luxurious.
Breakfast which is included in the tariff was the best we had in Sri Lanka.
The massage was awesome and just what we all needed after travelling. 
Could not fault this property or its staff. 
The staff organised day trips to amazing Galle Fort which is only a short drive away.
We hope to return as it was such a wonderful accommodation. 
It is awesome for groups and families and also works for couples.
Social hour is a fabulous chance to enjoy a GnT with other guests. We enjoyed the company of the other guests that were from all over the world. 
If you prefer a quiet Social Hour there are plenty of locations on the property that you can enjoy a private drink or two. 
Walks on the beach are especially romantic as it is very private with hardly any people on it. 
However, if you are travelling with a group or a large family, and do not wish to rent a villa, this is the perfect location. 
The staff go above and beyond to make sure everyone has an incredible time.
title: Destination wedding at a beautifully appointed beach front guest house!

placeInfo/address: 670/5 Galle Road, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text:
Who designed and brought to fruition this garden of tranquility and beauty? I spent three perfect nights here (first night with a friend and two solo) during the off season.

A storm hit the coast on the first night and the waves of the Indian Ocean crashed against those beach rocks at Kumu like God's wrath were about to be unleashed. When morning arrived, the staff had already cleared away all evidence of the previous night's inclement weather and I enjoyed a tasty breakfast of egg hoppers and curry on the breezy deck of the hotel.

The setting has to be experienced to be fully appreciated. So postcard-perfect it was surreal: from the swaying coconut trees to the view beyond from the infinity pool.

The staff is unintrusively attentive and happy to please.  They take a stay at Kumu Beach over the top and are key to what was a memorable vacation. 

The menu is extensive. Chef Indika-- how does he manage it? There are so many items to choose from, considering there aren't more than a dozen rooms on site. He and his staff do a stellar job consistently turning out fresh, yummy, and beautifully presented dishes. 

Rooms are well-kept and thoughtfully equipped with attention-to-detail I appreciated (like a beach bag I could use while I was there).

Thank you to Ruchira, Chef Indika, Lahiru, Yugan, Nilanchana, and many others whose names I didn't catch for your hospitality and sharing the spirit of Sri Lanka with me.

If I'm lucky, I'll return next time for a longer stay!
title: If this isn't paradise, I don't know what is!

text: Another top class boutique hotel provided by Teardrop Hotels. Ideally located for those who have transport and want to do day trips to Colombo and/or Galle, and avoid the hustle and bustle of these big cities. Spotless, perfectly well equipped, spacious and airy rooms and public spaces. All the staff were terrific, unassuming and well trained. Excellent Sri Lankan and western food provided by the chef and his team. Very close proximity to the ocean and beach, which I am sure is safe for swimming during the non monsoon season. The lovely infinity pool was the perfect substitute to cool off, enjoy a drink and take in the sound of the waves. Highly recommended for the discerning traveller who wants to visit the south west of Sri Lanka.

text:
Forget BREAKFAST AT TIFFANY’S, 
Breakfast at KUMU is a far more dazzling experience.

I felt more like a ‘day scholar’ as opposed to the kids in the dorms. I know, it’s a pretty dismal analogy. There wasn’t anything remotely sour like school buildings, dour corridors and institutional food.

Simply the fact that we came for breakfast, felt enchanted, stayed put the whole day till sunset and then left (without seeing the elegant rooms shrouded behind frangipani trees draped around wooden stairways, for we had other commitments in Colombo), made me think of the ‘day scholar’ metaphor. Truly, I was envious of the other guests who had, by the time we were leaving, were ensconced in their deck chairs, clutching onto pastoral coloured, long drinks, serenely absorbed in the near-sunken sun, by the Indian Ocean looming large.

Many, I guess, were paying homage to the tantalising horizon. One couldn’t help feeling a sense of awe, staring into lawns of KUMU from the beach edge, the large expanse of verdant patches of green appearing more immaturely manicured than the quads at Christ Church, Oxford.

Sorry! All this is digression, for we came to KUMU for breakfast. 
Thanks for entertaining us, my three dear friends and I who stayed at a nearby villa, with a paralysingly breathtaking vistas, decided to come here for a splurge, in spite of us being non-house guests of KUMU.
I appreciate KUMU’s  flexibility whereas many a fancy hotel would have turned us away, And disappointed were we not, and truly a splurge it was.

No sooner did we park and were ushered through the short and somewhat uncharacteristic passage than we felt the magic of Phillip Weerarathna’s  (first time I was enjoying the subdued, yet sublimely curated space of a leading architect of the the island) eye for visual guile and trickery. One couldn’t help mesmerised by the massive metallic balls, the sculpture, the architectural motif, raising KUMU’s identity as a unique place; they elevated her from the run-of-the mill Beach Resorts of South Coast.

It was a perfect day. Cloudless skies and mildly rippled waters were in perfect harmony. All elements had a welcoming effect. We sat at the corner, at a table immaculately set, with damask serviettes. 

I must apologise for being a sucker for such little trial details. But I love my short, fat fingers nuzzling thought the thick cotton drapery, whilst waiting, in earnest, for goodies to come. It was late for breakfast, the last order; we were ravenously hungry. 

For a split second, I was wondering if I were Judy Garland impersonator , (my dear queer self identifies myself with her than  with John Peppard:) My senses weren’t inebriated; nor was Balapitiya the New York of the 40s. But I could relate to Holly’s sense of enchantment, at BREAKFAST AT TIFFANY’S . 
In my case, it was strictly, culinary experience at KUMU’s.

I didn’t have to scour  the menu for long. I ordered, with child like anticipation, one of the Sri Lankan entries, hoppers (pan cake genre with an erect circular crust) and white fish curry, accompanied with two traditional relishes, the yummy option which made my day. My friends too were truly happy their Eggs Benedict. But I must admit,  I felt sorry for them, for not having the same as mine. 

Most house guests were done with their breakfast. Many were defying the scorching sun, their pizza-dough bodies hugging sun beds peppered on the lawn or simply frolicking in the pool. Whereas I lingered, for I have always enjoyed slow food concept, filling the little space of the table, with yet another Amricano, snow- capped with steamed fleck of milk, an elongated macchiato. What bliss could I ask for! 

If KUMU’s setting that morning had the power to arrest us with its natural beauty heightened by its flesh-pampering hospitality, we happily submitted.
After an unnaturally long time at the table, the hostile sun light made us become refugees in one of the two handsome living room spaces. Its shades of blue cushions in the fat sofas made us sink into comfort.

We had to abandon our ambitious plans of going to Galle Fort for lunch. 
And lunch we had, right there. And it too was another lip-smacking experience. 
So we went on, one dish n a drink followed by dessert till we realised we have procrastinated relentlessly! 

Unapologetically I said: ‘we have to remain till that fury-riddled, scarlet splash of rays sink and disappear!’ No disapproval did I encounter from my companion. 
So we stayed yet another good half an hour, way after dusk had enveloped the horizons, and warm white pool lights flooded the the garden.

Since all good things have to come an end, I left, feeling giddy with joy, and told myself: ‘breakfast at KUMU is way better than legendary BREAKFAST AT TIFFANY’S.

For sure I prefer its array of appa (hoppers) to the much coveted jewellery. 

For me, long breakfast at KUMU was a dazzling stay
title: Breakfast at KUMU would make you think twice about BREAKFAST AT TIFFANY’S!

placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
text:
We were so lucky to spend ten perfect and extremely relaxing days at Kahanda Kanda in the beautiful Kadju villa.  The villa is so very private with a large sunny terrace and an infinity pool over looking the tea plantation and jungle.  I spent so much time watching the monkeys in the trees and listening to all the sounds below, especially the peacocks, one of whom popped in to see us most evenings in all his magnificence! 

The whole hotel is so beautifully designed, so tranquil and so efficiently and generously run.  Kadju villa itself felt just like home with it's gorgeous colour, large bathroom and french windows to the terrace.  From the moment we were picked up in Colombo until we were dropped off back at the airport, we were looked after so very well.  Breakfast was superb overlooking the trees in the dining pavilion, something we looked forward to each morning.  Lunch was often brought to our room to eat on the terrace if we hadn't ventured further in a tuktuk to KK Beach, Galle or Koggala Lake.  We enjoyed a cocktail in the living pavilion before a three course dinner each evening, which was superb every night.

Every member of the team were wonderful and we were incredibly well looked after.  It was also lovely to meet the creator and owner of KK, George Cooper who often popped in whilst we had a drink before dinner.  He has truly created a very very special place.  We also enjoyed visiting his shop in Galle which was so well curated and the gorgeous colourful elephant backpack we brought home for our young granddaughter has been exceptionally well received!  

Thank you all so much for giving us a truly special, relaxing holiday and an unforgettable experience.
title: So very special!

placeInfo/address: Habaraduwa Dikkumbura Road, Thittagalla West 80122 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
text:
I have never used the term "hidden gem" to describe any business before because the term is so overused. In the case of Kahanda Kanda I will make a one time exception.

There are several luxury hotels and resorts in Sri Lanka, but KK stands out for a number of reasons. The staff are incredibly friendly and engaging. Service is excellent. Accommodations are extremely comfortable. The rooms and the entire property are extremely well maintained, which seems to be a rarity in many places. The lounge and open air dining pavilions are comfortable and offer expansive views of the tea plantation and the countryside. The meals are of exceptional quality and very good value. It is quiet. You can go on bike rides down to the KK Beach Hotel. You can get an excellent massage, take yoga sessions in the yoga pavilion, or exercise in the weight room. Or, you can relax by one of the several swimming pools and read a book.

There is also an abundance of wildlife at KK: monkeys, wild peacocks, mongoose, parrots, kingfishers, etc. 

On my most recent visit I rode a bike with hotel staff and visited several temples located in the area. There are several things that make KK memorable, but what stands out is the staff who personify Sri Lankan culture and friendliness.
title: Luxury Accommodations and Service at Its Best

placeInfo/address: Habaraduwa Dikkumbura Road, Thittagalla West 80122 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
text:
It was a privilege to stay here. We wanted to relax in a tranquil location with access to the sea and Galle. The KK family has given us so much more.

Kahanda Kanda is beautifully designed, curated and maintained. Its environment is idyllic. Our Kadju villa was perfect. Its private infinity pool overlooks a jungle ‘amphitheatre’ of constantly appearing wildlife. Every single facility has been considered and is provided to a level of pure luxury.

The food, overseen by Prasad, Bawantha and their teams, is superb: the best Sri Lankan and western breakfasts to order, accompanied by really exotic fruit. Dinners were delicious.

We enjoyed very much our beach day at KK Beach, accessible by the hotel’s own tuk tuk; returned there for dinner; and throughout were made welcome at KK Beach by duty managers Pathum and Manaka, super enthusiastic factotum Kasun and waiter Supun.

The Koggola Lake boat trip, including crocodiles, a serene temple and artisan cinnamon production, was well led by Dinesh - informative, atmospheric and very worthwhile. KK organised for us sunset in Galle Fort (and we recommend for souvenirs going straight to the KK Boutique there) and a transfer to Colombo airport with safe, reliable drivers Sumudu and Sam respectively.

Above all, the KK Collection is made by the extremely friendly, professional and proud level of service provided by its people. George Cooper, the owner, is highly visible and provides real community leadership, if we may say so. We thank all his staff, seen and unseen, front of house and backroom support but, as well as the aforementioned, we commend the following who gave us notable service at Kahanda Kanda: duty managers Sujeewa, another Dinesh and Dushan for their warmth, attention to detail and seamless handovers to each other; barman Konara, waiter Sudeep and trainee waiter Meeru - all with bright futures.

Simply, thank you all!
title: Perfect!

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
A short drive out of Kandy city centre which makes it feel calm and peaceful.
Quite a lot of mosquitos but obviously that can't be helped in Kandy!
text:
We stayed for 2 nights whilst exploring Kandy for the New Year. From the moment we arrived Umesh made us feel welcome. He arranged traditional Sri Lankan meals for us, catering to our vegetarian requirements on both nights.
For both breakfast and dinner we were looked after by Danushka who was incredibly attentive. All meals were cooked fresh to order and incredibly delicious.
All the staff are friendly and helpful. We would recommend this boutique hotel to anyone staying in Kandy.
title: Fantastic boutique hotel, feels like you are a welcome guest in their home

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Small, comfortable and friendly hotel in a quieter area of Kandy. The food was delicious, we had different vegetarian Sri Lankan meals for two evenings sitting in comfort on the balcony. The staff were excellent in looking after us, would highly recommend.
title: Comfortable stay in Kandy with delicious food

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Charmantes Ambiente, super tolle Küche und zuvorkommendes freundliches Personal. Man fühlt sich wie zu Hause. Wir haben 2 Nächste verbracht und fühlten uns sehr wohl und willkommen. Keine Mühe war dem Personal sowie dem Chef zu viel um es uns gemütlich zu machen. Auch auf die Intoleranz gegen Gluten wurde Rücksicht genommen und das Menü angebpasst. Einfach super !!
title: Tolles Hotel mit gemütlicher Ambience

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Heartwarming welcome, extremely friendly personnel, a lovely room, outstanding food. Everything very neacly.
............................................................................................................
title: To become zen

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful hotel in Kandy. The lounge & dining area were lovely and so were the bedrooms. The team there were very friendly and helpful, and the food was delicious. The swimming pool was small but looked lovely although we didn’t use it as it rained the whole time we were in Kandy!
title: Beautiful hotel to stay at in Kandy, with helpful friendly staff & delicious food.

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
This Guesthouse is such a Gem in Kandy.
Beautiful rooms, outstanding breakfast, spotless clean. 
The staff is so fantastic. You can not find better staff than at Clove Villa. 
If you want to go to Kandy, choose this beautiful guesthouse. You will not regret it, I promise.
title: What a gem in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir waren in der Clove Villa für 2 Nächte. Was wir dort erlebten war absolute Spitze. Ein sehr schönes Zimmer mit Whirlpool war wirklich top. Die Behandlung seitens der Mitarbeiter war einzigartig. Wir konnten das Abendessen frei auswählen, jeder Wunsch wurde uns seitens des Kochs erfüllt. Auch das Service allen voran Danu ließen keine Wünsche offen. Ich kann die Clove Villa uneingeschränkt empfehlen und würde jederzeit wieder kommen.
Claudia K.
title: Traumhaftes Hotel mit persönlicher Note.

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
We arrived not knowing what to expect... but want a lovely warm welcome...
We ordered a home meal...
One of my best meals I have been here for 3 weeks...
Oder the sri lanka vegetarian meal... the aubergine was the chef Umesh granny's recipe .
I can honestly recommend this beautiful home stay place...

Thank you
title: Romantic meal

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Beautiful boutique hotel,absolute opulent,nothing was too much trouble and the food was fantastic 
We were also given a free upgrade as the room was vacant which is a nice touch
In a quiet area on the outskirts of Kandy.Tuk tuk around £2-3 to get into the center but as we had a private driver we did not use that
We would highly recommend
title: 2 nights in clove villa

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: This is a boutique hotel with only 9 rooms. It’s beautifully presented, the rooms are big and clean and the staff are awesome. Mukesh the manager is so obliging & will do anything for you. The staff are also very helpful. Cant fault this place. It’s situated in a quiet road of the main street. The gardens are clean & charming and it also has a pool. I wish we had of stayed more nights, one night  is not enough.
title: Boutique villa with great service

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Lankans are a very gentle people and add to that upper crust experience, too good.
text:
Absolutely courteous staff. 
Felt like my own Villa. 
Ambience, privacy, aroma, rich decor. Uber Luxury. 
Lounge is what I was looking forward to spending my time also inviting my local friends who were impressed too. I am coming back soon with my family and friends taking over all 7 rooms....
title: Uber Luxury

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
What an amazing find! A calm stylish oasis to return to after a hectic day of sightseeing. 

Rooms are beautifully designed and the staff are simply amazing and cannot do enough to make your stay as relaxing and easy as possible. 

Danushka from the moment we walked in was a joy. Making sure we had everything we needed.

We had so far in our trip been staying at large hotels and this was our first villa experience and it surpassed our expectation. 

When asked what the kids thought they loved the  pool table, said they had the best night sleep ever and prefer Clove Villa to all the hotels we had stayed at ! They wished we could have stayed another night. 

Thank you Danushka and team
title: A calm stylish oasis!

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Everything was perfect
text:
We had a lovely time at this gorgeous villa! On arrival, We were  welcomed with a cold mixed fruit drink and a cold face towel. The villa was beautifully decorated, and everything was meticulously clean!
We highly recommend the Sri Lankan chicken curry, cooked for us by a wonderfully talented and attentive chef! The waiter was also incredibly friendly and attentive!
I cannot recommend this lovely villa enough, We really felt that we were guests at someone’s  house, such was the service!
Thank you so much Clover Villa!
title: An excellent hotel

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: An excellent address, having only 7 rooms. Dinner was super good. We ended up here after change of hotels, super friendly and helpful staff. Room are clean and very big. I would absolutely recommend this hotel, given its very quiet location and exceptional staff.
title: Exceptional staff and location

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Het hotel ligt in een rustiger deel van Kandy op 20 minuten vanaf het centrum, tuc tuc kost 1.000-1.500 roepies. Fraai hotel met zwembad. Het ontbijt bestaat uit fruit, toast en ei of Sri Lankees. Personeel zeer gastvrij en behulpzaam. Waarom dan maar vier sterren? De aankleding van het zwembad blijft wat achter bij de inrichting van het hotel en de gordijnen verduisteren niet waardoor het al vroeg (te) licht is in de kamer. De kamers zijn ruim, schoon en rustig.
title: Pareltje in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Clove Villa is een prachtig ingerichte villa en van alle gemakken voorzien. Het personeel is zo ontzettend lief en gastvrij dat zij het verblijf voor ons compleet hebben gemaakt. De chef heeft de meest lekkere gerechten klaargemaakt, dus het is een aanrader om er ook te dineren. Danushka en andere personeelsleden, bij deze nogmaals hartelijk dank voor jullie gastvrijheid!
title: Clove villa, een prachtige villa

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Beautifully and elegantly decorated with incredible attention to detail. Piano music playing daintily in the background. The owner, who is an absolute delight, should be a Michelin star chef as the food was outstanding. The staff are extremely attentive without being intrusive. The location is around 4km from Kandy city centre/market/Temple of the Tooth which is easy to reach by tuktuk costing 800-1000 LKR. The hotel staff will call a tuktuk for you. The beds are comfortable with all mod cons/toiletries. Such a classy property. HIGHLY recommended. Stayed 16/17 July 2024
title: Classy Property with Outstanding Food & Service

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Wonderful staff giving a  personal service, nothing too much trouble
Great food which was very well presented 
Immaculate home which was very well decorated
Great place to stay to visit the Buddhas Tooth Temple and botanical gardens
Highly recommend if you want a small comfortable stay
title: Personal and nothing too much trouble

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.

We’re glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay, especially our traditional Sri Lankan breakfast and the prompt poolside service. It’s also great to know that our location made it convenient for you to explore the city, beach, and nearby temples.

We appreciate your comments about the security checks on arrival — your safety and peace of mind are our top priorities. These measures are in place to ensure a secure environment for all our guests, especially during large-scale events like the Military Sports Conference.

We're sorry to hear that the pizza didn't meet your expectations, and we’ve shared your feedback with our culinary team to improve on this. Your suggestion is valuable and helps us raise our standards.

We look forward to welcoming you back should your travels bring you to Sri Lanka again.

Warm Regards,
The Management
placeInfo/address: 115 Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Pool was very quiet however it would be mega busy during tourist season.
text:
After arriving before midnight and an hours trip from the airport, we arrived here where I was staying for the next 2 nights. Funny, explosive vapour detector at the gate followed by a baggage screen prior to getting into the hotel. Not sure if that was to do with the Military Sports conference or a thing from when terrorists bomb the Marriott.
Up after a few hours sleep and a nice welcome to traditional Sri Lankan buffett breakfast. 
The hotel itself was pretty good, I didn't have any issues. Any poolside service was pretty quick. Need to learn how to make a good pizza, the only letdown. It is close to  the Centre of town, the beach and the main temples that are there. I would definately stay here again if I was return.
title: Located near everything

text:
A truly beautiful hotel in a beautiful location. When we arrived we felt we arrived to a lavish home that has been lavishly decorated for Xmas. The vibe is elegant and homely. Everything is clean and well maintained.  
The staff attentive and did their best to make us as comfortable as can be. In particular, Chanu was extremely attentive and often did things for us in advance of us asking him. Chanu also took us on a bird watching tour in the local area. I would recommend it, if you love nature and like to see the variety of birds. 
The outdoor jacuzzi was lovely. The pool was not heated, but that did not bother us. In the heat of the day you want a nice cooling dip.

The gardens were very pleasant and well manicured. Kids also enjoyed the mini golf and croquet.

The whole family enjoyed the tea plantation walk and the bird watching, mentioned above. We would have liked to have done the cooking course with the head chef, but we ran out of time.

The food was very tasty, high quality and well presented.
title: A truly beautiful hotel

placeInfo/address: Hemas Limited Halgranoya, Ragala, Nuwara Eliya, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: We had a fantastic four days at the Stafford Bungalow. The photos and videos don't do this place justice - the accommodation is beautifully appointed, spacious and comfortable with a lovely, large conservatory looking out to the garden and pool where we ate our meals. Multiple sitting areas are serviced by wood burning fireplaces and cosy couches, and we've enjoyed afternoon tea in the outdoor pavilion, watching the rain fall over the infinity pool while the fire crackles next to us. The kids love running and playing hide and seek in the gardens and splashing in the heated jacuzzi. We also enjoyed a walk through the tea estate and vegetable farms, guided by Chanuka the head butler, who has been a fantastic host. The food also deserves a special mention - every meal has been delicious. But the highlight really is the incredible service - from hot chocolates on arrival to the daily turn down service (which includes placing hot water bottles into the sheets for extra cosiness!) the staff here really go above and beyond to make your stay special. We can't wait to come back next time! Highly recommend for families, couples and solo travellers alike.
title: Peace, luxury and perfect hospitality in the hill country

placeInfo/address: No 212 Sangananda Mawatha Weligama, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Hotel Ayurvie Weligama offers the perfect harmony for both body and soul. During my stay, I especially appreciated the friendly and attentive staff, who were always ready to assist with any request—whether it was advice on excursions, organizing transportation, or handling minor needs. The Ayurvedic cuisine, prepared according to traditional principles, was not only authentic but also surprisingly creative and delicious. The cleanliness of both the rooms and common areas met high standards, with regular housekeeping and attention to detail. This stay was the perfect combination of relaxation and health-focused care for me.

Accommodation Experience

Staying at Ayurvie Weligama blends simple charm with functional design. My room was spacious, furnished with wooden furniture and natural materials, reinforcing the Ayurvedic philosophy. The windows opened to a garden full of tropical plants, creating an atmosphere of privacy and tranquility. Every morning, I woke up to the sounds of nature, free from the disturbances of urban life.

The Staff: The Heart of the Hotel

The employees are undoubtedly the greatest asset of this place. The reception team, fluent in English and the local language, was always eager to help with trip planning

Ayurvedic Cuisine: A Culinary Journey

The menu, curated by a chef in Ayurvedic gastronomy, exceeded my expectations. Each of  daily meals (including snacks) was tailored to reflect the guest’s dosha type. 

Cleanliness and Wellness Facilities

The housekeeping team worked discreetly and efficiently. Towels were changed daily, eco-friendly toiletries were replenished, and surfaces were regularly disinfected.  The Ayurvedic medical team also ensured the cleanliness of massage rooms and the preparation of herbs for treatments.

This hotel is an ideal choice for travelers seeking an authentic Ayurvedic experience with a personal touch. I am already planning my return for the next season!
title: An Amazing Ayurveda-Inspired Experience with Outstanding Staff

text:
Ayurvie exceeded all my expectations. 
The location is superb - overlooking the ocean and with a lovely little surfers beach less than 20 paces from the back gate. 
It is more a clinic than a hotel, but is neither sterile nor a spa. Expect yoga sessions at sunrise and sunset and 90-120 minutes of pummelling in between.
From the doctors (who are always on hand) to the pool attendant, the genuine care for the guests’ wellbeing was extraordinary. 
The building and bedrooms are modern but the treatment area has been made to feel more traditional and in keeping with the Ayurvedic treatments. 
The other guests were predominantly German, Russian and Dutch. 
The food is good, but tempered for more bland palates so don’t come expecting fiery curries!
title: Highly recommended

placeInfo/address: Jesu Nasarenu Mawatha Thoppu Thota, Waikkal 61110 Sri Lanka
text:
This was my first time in an Ayurvedic centre, recommended by my cousin who has been here twice before. I wouldn't hesitate to go again, it was so relaxing and I felt completely different when I left. 

It was very restorative, my blood pressure dropped by 20 points even though I was only there for 8 days; it was calm, quiet, with an excellent selection of food, and when I left I felt I had been there for a month.

I had a beautifully decorated and comfortable cottage which was a pleasure to stay in and I slept really well. All the cottages are separate from each other and you don't hear anything from anyone else.

The grounds are lovely, so peaceful and very well taken care of. I sat by the river sometimes and was lucky enough to see some beautiful birds and other wildlife.

I had two massages a day given by Madhu who was fantastic, really in tune with what I needed and very experienced. She gave me a massage for my body specifically, not like other massages I have had elsewhere which sometimes are just the ones they give everyone.

The medical staff are fantastic and lovely. I really recommend staying here, you won't be disappointed.
title: A wonderful experience

2泊3日でトリートメントを体験しました。
初アーユルヴェーダでドキドキでしたが、気持ち良すぎて何度か寝てしまいました。午前と午後で合計3時間も施術してくださいます。
ヨガやアクティビティ、1日2回のトリートメント、3食とっても美味しい食事、どれも素晴らしくてとても幸せな滞在でした。　
でも、何より1番良かったのはホテルのスタッフの方々のホスピタリティの高さです。
細かいところまで気にかけてくれるし優しいし、素敵なスタッフさんばかりでした。
（チェックアウト後にも関わらず、迷子になったところを助けてくださり本当に感謝しています！）　

次は１週間くらいゆっくり滞在したいと思います！
title: とても幸せな滞在時間でした

ownerResponse/text:
Dear esteemed guest,

Thank you so much for your kind words! We’re thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Karunakarla Ayuveda Resort and noticed the improvements we’ve made. It’s wonderful to know that our team, including Dr. Riythma and the rest of our team, made your experience feel like a home away from home.

We’re also glad you appreciated the efforts of our restaurant staff and chefs—your compliments will certainly be shared with Hasan, Neragika, Palitha, Sarahe, Charith, Ilham, Vishimi, Amandika, and Fernando. They all work hard to ensure our guests have a joyful experience.

We can’t wait to welcome you back for another stay! Your satisfaction is our priority, and we’ll always strive to provide that same warm welcome. 

Ayubowan (May you have a ling life)
placeInfo/address: Jesu Nasarenu Mawatha Thoppu Thota, Waikkal 61110 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Go for it don’t Hesitate its really a good deal
text: I enjoyed my time in Karunakarla spa and resort, and i saw lot improvement since last time i visited it, all for the benefit of the guest it was wonderful familiar faces thank you all you made home away home vacation thanky Dr Riythma and all doctors  i appreciate al the help you gave me, thank you to restaurant staff the chef, and others who made our journey easy and full of hoy thanks to your smile( Hasan, Naragika, Palitha, Sarahe, Charathi, Ilham ) thank you Vishimi Amandika and Frnando and you pick me thank you definitely see you soon i ll comeback if there's same warm welcome
title: Definitely coming back

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: This place was exceptional; the room was lovely and the service was wonderful and attentive. Great meals too. Both breakfast and a la carte dinner options were top notch. I highly recommend this as an option in Kandy- best place we have stayed in Sri Lanka
title: Great place to stay in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
From the moment we arrived Danushka gave us the biggest welcome and encouraged us to treat this beautiful boutique hotel as our own home. We settled in incredibly quickly relaxing in the jacuzzi  and enjoying a few games on the pool table before heading into Kandy for some sightseeing etc.

We were spoilt by the chef Yohan who cooked up more delicious food than we could possibly ask for at both breakfast and dinner. They were incredibly flexible to our schedule and even managed to accommodate our breakfast despite an early start.

I can’t recommend this hidden gem enough, not only is it a beautiful boutique hotel with incredible hospitality but it’s slightly out of town from the chaos of Kandy whilst being easy enough to get into town when needed. Thank you so much Danushka for making our stay in Kandy a wonderful experience.
title: A must stay beautiful boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Tolles Hotel zum Wohlfühlen. Das Essen war auch sehr gut. Auf dem Balkon gab es sogar einen Jakusi welcher genutzt werden durfte. Sehr nette und aufmerksame Bedienung. Wir können das Hotel gerne weiterempfehlen und kommen gerne Wieder. Die Zimmer waren wunderschön und sehr sauber.
title: Superschönes Hotel

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Wer eine grosse Weinauswahl erwartet, wird hier enttäuscht. Das Hotel ist klein und darum ist das auch verständlich.
text: Ein unglaublich schönes, sehr individuelles Haus mit lediglich 7 Zimmern. Die Ausstattung ist überaus hochwertig, ein wenig im britischen Stil, alles ist sehr sauber, die Atmosphäre besonders. Da es nicht viele Gäste hatte, fühlten wir uns fast ein bisschen wie die Hausherren und wurden auch rundum verwöhnt. Das Abendessen konnten wir auf einem kleinen Balkon mit Sicht in die Umgebung einnehmen. Man kann von einer à la carte Karte vorher individuell auswählen. Es gibt asiatische und auch europäische Gerichte, aber auch Spezialitäten aus Sri Lanka. Sehr fein!
title: Äusserst stilvolles Hotel an sehr ruhiger, aber zentraler Lage im lebhaften Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: This is a gorgeous boutique hotel on the outskirts of Kandy. The room was large and comfortable, with one of the best bathrooms we have ever seen - double washbasins and a superb shower. The reception area and dining room are very attractive, and you can also opt to eat on the balconies. We had an absolutely superb Sri Lankan dinner, and the breakfast was also delicious. There's a small pool with sun loungers which was very welcome after a day's travelling. The hotel team are extremely friendly and couldn't do enough for us.
title: Tranquil haven on the outskirts of bustling Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Excellent service and delicious food at this establishment.  It’s quietly located but only a 10 minute tuktuk ride from the centre of Kandy.  We found the room and bedding a little too hot for us even with the A/C operating although this is probably related to our age! .If we had stayed for more than one night I would have asked for a sheet instead of the duvet for the bed.  It was also the only property out of six that we stayed in during our Sri Lanka tour that provided  single use plastic bottled water rather than hotel filtered water in the rooms.
title: Excellent food and service

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: A wonderful place to stay. Food was wonderful.  We had butter chicken. And BLT and Tuna sandwiches for snacks. Food is of a great standard and huge portion.  Breakfast fruit is great. And we had omelette and English breakfast. Plus toast and jam. You don't leave the table still hungry.
title: A lovely little place to stay with great food

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: What a lovely way to end our trip to Sri Lanka. This hotel is a converted house and retains a cosy, homely feel. Danushka was really welcoming and couldn’t have done more to help us. We had a delicious evening meal, which was one of the best of our entire trip. We only stayed one night but were very happy that we chose to stay at Clove Villa.
title: Oasis in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Expensive boitique hotel, but worth every cent!
text: One of the best hotel experiences ever. The management is just great and wants you to really feel at home. Gorgeous tetrest from the bustling noise of the city. Grest food prepsred especially for you with passion and dedication. Very small but very intimate. A great place to stay, when visiting Kandy.
title: Great retreat in Kandy, Sri Lanks

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Die Clove Villa in Kandy ist eine ausgezeichnete Adresse in welchem wir 2 Nächte verbracht haben! Das kleine Hotel liegt am ruhigen Ortsrand der quirligen Stadt. Das Haus ist modern ausgestattet, die Zimmer sind geräumig und zweckmäßig eingerichtet. Das gesamte Personal ist sehr freundlich, hilfsbereit und zuvorkommend. Aber der absolute Höhepunkt ist die ausgezeichnete Küche! Der Chef selbst bereitet die köstlichen Gerichte zu. Wir hatten am Abend immer Currys mit vielen Beilagen - einfach köstlich. Auch das Frühstück war immer ein wahrer Genuß! Es war nicht leicht, von hier wieder weiter zu ziehen. Alles in allem ein super Haus mit tollem Personal.
title: Ausgezeichnete Adresse in Kandy wo keine Wünsche offen bleiben

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Lovely boutique hotel made even more special by the people who work here! A warm greeting when we arrived, with towels and juice before being shown to our room. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable, an excellent en-suite shower room and a balcony with a view over the pool. The downstairs lounge and breakfast area were also spacious and lovely. Dinner was served outside on a balcony overlooking the front. Dinners were lovely Sri Lankan curries, and Umesh’ grandma’s aubergine curry was particularly wonderful. The portions were very big, too big for us if I am honest, but delicious. Breakfasts were also lovely, fresh fruit and honey curd followed by choice of eggs with bacon and sausage if wanted. Clove Villa is very peaceful, and it was lovely to wake up to the sounds of birds. It is well-placed to visit the relic of the tooth temple, Kandy market, and the Royal Botanical Gardens. Special thanks to Danushka and Umesh who were so friendly,  helpful and really made our short stay very special.
title: 2 night stay as part of a 10 day holiday in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here last week and found it to be extremely comfortable-lovely room , great shower ,amazing service from all the staff and excellent food into the bargain.We had a very busy schedule while in Kandy with so much to see so I was sorry not to be able to spend more time relaxing here but we really enjoyed our stay
title: Lovely small hotel

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text:
Only one night here which is a shame as it’s a wonderful oasis in Kandy. Delightful swimming pool. Top class service. 
The room was beautifully furnished and reall comfortable. Clean, modern , spacious bathroom 
Many thanks for a great experience
David and Ann UK
title: Lovely, comfortable small hotel

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We can't hesitate to recommend this charming hotel with its lovely staff, cute pool and tasty cuisine. Dinner on the terrace is very pleasant. All very clean. Not so far to the center by tuktuk. The bed is so comfortable that it's hard to get out of bed. Go for it!
title: Just a perfect place

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Good location not far from city centre. A haven of peace and quiet after the hurly burly and heat of Kandy, with a very welcome pool.  Light and airy with elegant furnishings and very comfortable and spacious bedrooms.  Excellent food and most attentive service.  Roof terrace great for dinner. Ideal for couples or small groups.
title: Cool & calm in Kandy

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Forget the large hotels
text: From the moment we arrived we were very well looked after by Umesh and his team. Clove Villa is a haven of tranquility in a bustling city. Our large room was very comfortable and the cleaning and turn down services were impeccable. Umesh tailored our menus to all the things we like best both at dinner and breakfast. After 4 nights of pampering we were sad to leave.
title: The very best of Kandy hospitality

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Perfektes Hotel
text:
Sehr schönes Kleines Stadthotel.
Sehr freundliches, zuvorkommendes Personal.
Super leckeres Essen.
Wird immer frisch gekocht.
Tolles Frühstück 
Sehr zu empfehlen
Wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt 
Zimmer waren sehr geräumig und sehr sauber.
Gutes WIFI
title: Sehr zu empfehlen

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We spent a lovely night at Clove Villa whilst travelling through Kandy. We had a a very large room beautifully presented with very chic décor and a lovely bathroom overlooking the pool.  We were provided with excellent service by Umesh assisted by Yohan. We had wonderful food sitting on the balcony listening to the frogs in the pond below and were delighted to be presented with a surprise birthday cake for my special celebration which was a delightful touch and delicious too.
title: Great overnight stay

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: Lovely stay at Clove Villa, super room with jacuzzi, stayed for 2 nights, service was impeccable from our waiter Danushka.   The fresh fruit and curd followed by bacon and eggs for breakfast was delicious and our evening meal was also excellent.  The pool was also lovely for a morning swim.
title: Great Stay at Clove Villa

placeInfo/address: 48 P.B.A. Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at Clove Villas for 2 nights during a 3 week tour of Sri Lanka.  The quirky decor and furniture were unusual, but still classy.  The food was great, with the chef catering to individual preferences & tastes, and offering a choice of local dishes and more Western options. But the standout was the staff - expertly attentive without intruding, helpful with suggestions and information about the area, incredibly flexible fitting in with us with pleasure, and charming and polite and interested in us. If you get the chance to go, do it!
title: Clove Villas - a quirky boutique with wonderful staff

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful, characterful hotel with quirky openair bathroom. Slept very well in comfortable bed. During lovely breakfast staff celebrated Hindu festival and we were invited to light candles with them. If in Columbo would definitely return.
title: Full of character.

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: A gem of a hotel providing a calm oasis away from the hustle and bustle. The staff are a delightful team who cater for your every need. They are all charming and very customer focused. The rooms are beautifully furnished and the complementary drinks and snacks are a much appreciated touch. We had lunch at the hotel and the food was beautifully presented as well as being delicious.  Excellent  breakfast . Pool much appreciated,
title: A  charming period property as a great base from which to explore Colombo

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: I would suggest eating at the hotel in the evening - we didn't and went out and regretted it. We should have sampled their evening meal.
text: This hotel is gorgeous. We stayed just one night and the staff are terrific. Very hospitable. You feel you are staying in their home. Delicious food and beautiful setting with a lovely pool. The rooms are gorgeous! Definitely recommend. Its also in a very good area of Colombo.
title: One night in Colombo

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: This beautiful building is a wonderful example of British Colonial architecture. We had the Cynthia suite which was delightful. Tastefully renovated with enthusiastic and welcoming staff, a lovely restaurant and convenient location, this is a great place to base yourself in Colombo.
title: Excellent boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Highly recommend! Went for 1 night during our honeymoon and the staff was great. They gave us the suite and decorated our room for the honeymoon. They also coordinating with our friends from home to gift us a bottle of wine. They went above and beyond! The food at the restaurant is also amazing local Sri Lankan cuisine.
title: Highly recommend!

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Beautiful, traditional Sri Lankan manor house with lots of charm. The rooms are very comfortable, with a lot of character, and the staff was warm and lovely. We  also had a traditional local breakfast.  Much prefer to a big chain hotel! It was a great stay.
title: Beautiful, charming hotel with a lot of character

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel is not perfect but definitely 5 star , Location is good but not amazing the rooms are very traditional but for us a little chlostraphobic.The staff and the food were absolutely amazing .Can recommend particularly to those who like boutique character hotels they will love it it, it just wasn’t quite our scene .
title: Wonderful food

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: We had an amazing evening at this beautiful, calm, and quiet place in the heart of Colombo. Maniumpathy is a luxurious boutique villa with seven bedrooms, making it a wonderful venue for an evening gathering. The food was excellent, and the hospitality was outstanding. Thank you to the General Manager and the team for making our visit so enjoyable
title: A Perfect Evening at Maniumpathy: Where Luxury Meets Peace in Colombo

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Absolutely loved Maniumpathy. I was staying nearby but ended up coming here for three meals within my two nights in Colombo. Beautiful building, excellent service, welcoming and kind staff, and great food. A relaxing escape. Highly recommend!
title: Adored Maniumpathy!

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
An amazing boutique hotel. The hotel is centrally located yet very peaceful. The room more than exceeded our expectations - spacious and spotless with a very comfortable bed. The food was delicious with a range of choices. Most of all the staff were outstanding!
We will definitely return.
title: Outstanding

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Un boutique hôtel authentique et hors du temps au milieu de la ville de Colombo. Qualité exceptionnelle du service et des prestations, personnel attentionné et toujours prêt à aider / conseiller. Accueil personnalisé. L’expérience High tea, un vrai plus.
title: Qualité des prestations et amabilité du personnel

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
Maniumpathy was recommended to me as a nice place to go for lunch and I wasn't disappointed. 
The venue is a large beautiful mansion which is beautifully furnished. The staff were engaging and very accommodating. The dining area on this occasion was located in the rear outdoor area. We were undercover and had a great view over the centre courtyard/garde/pool area. 
The menu options were varied and the meal tasty. Desert was also delicious. 
I only wish I was staying there two as it is an entirely charming place!
title: Charming historic looking mansion

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
I spent a number of years in hospitality working, teaching and managing.

I cannot commend this guest house oasis highly enough.

After a 13 hour flight, being met at 145am by the House Mgr with a smile and “Welcome home” set the tone for every experience that followed.
title: Unrivalled experience

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
Una struttura magnifica e ricca di storia retaggio dell’architettura coloniale dello Sri Lanka, situata in un quartiere di pregio di Colombo.
La villa ha ospitato cinque generazioni di una famiglia originaria di Manipay ed è piena di foto e di oggetti che ne tengono vivo il ricordo.
Vi abbiamo soggiornato due volte nel corso della nostra vacanza in Sri Lanka e siamo rimasti favorevolmente colpiti dalla gentilezza e disponibilità di tutte le persone che lavorano nella struttura.
Sicuramente una validissima alternativa ad alberghi di catena che difficilmente ti fanno sentire la sensazione di stare a casa.
Nel porgere un caloroso saluto a tutto il personale che ci ha assistito,  speriamo vivamente di potervi ancora soggiornare.
Francesco e famiglia
title: Un viaggio nel tempo a Colombo

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Algo lejos de las zonas a visitar, pero se puede llegar a pie.
text: Pequeño hotel situado cerca de una de las zonas medievales de la ciudad. Buen trato por parte del personal, habitaciones espaciosas y un cuarto de baño enorme con cuatro ambientes distintos. Las camas son muy cómodas. El restaurante, donde se sirven  desayuno y comidas, es a la carta, y está bastante bien. De hecho, la sopa de setas y las costillas de cerdo están muy buenas. También tiene una pequeña piscina que sirve para refrescarse un poco después de explorar la ciudad.
title: Ideal para quien huya de las grandes cadenas.

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Maniumpathy is set out in a well preserved mansion. It gave us a wonderful ambiance that added to a great time spent together with family. The food was scrumptious and enjoyed by all. The staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful and service oriented.
title: Memorable family gathering

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: A big thank you to Warren and his team for organising a fabulous dinner and celebration for my mother's 80th Birthday despite the short notice. Maniumpathy has one of the most soothing atmospheres for dining amid the rush in Colombo. The staff is well trained and is thoroughly customer orienteered. I highly recommend their Jaffna cuisine. I Can safely say that Maniumpathy is a fabulous vintage  mansion where perfection and calm meet.
title: Excellent food & service

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
Brilliant location for fine dining in Colombo. The staff is very customer-oriented and ablidging. Would definitely recommend their Jaffna cuisine. 
I can vouch that Maniumpathy Colombo is an Oasis of tranquility amid the hustle and bustle of the robust city.
title: Excellent experience

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
I am a Sri Lankan expat from US, fairly well travelled in this segment of Sri Lankan boutique hotels. This was however my first time staying at Maniumpathy,  as I typically  stay with family when I'm in Colombo. 

This heritage boutique hotel is everything it's touted to be and more.  I stayed for 4 nights with my dad who is 92 yrs and we had the most peaceful stay with customer service of the highest caliber, second to none. 

We also took this opportunity to host friends and family for dinner on all 4 nights anywhere up to 12 people. The staff who was extremely friendly, yet very professional in every sense, helped us plan these dinners so that my dad & I had a novel experience with each dinner. 

Front desk receptionist Ms. Arjumath, our house keeper Arjana & our butler Sanath Kuruppu deserve special mention. They truly are great ambassadors for Maniumpathy.  I should also mention Shannon & Koshitha, the on site mangement team who worked with me from before our arrival to make our stay extra special and accomadated a few special requests of ours. 

We definitely look forward to staying at Maniumpathy during my future visits back home.
title: Excellent Heritage Boutique Hotel in heart of Colombo, Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Get a massage!!  Be prepared to be treated with great kindness!
text:
Maniumpathy is a lovely hotel and I highly recommend staying here. During breakfast I was trying to think of the best word to describe it - paradise (the earthly and ancient definition) seems most fitting. 

From the moment I arrived, after midnight, I was taken care of like a special guest, or a family member who had recently returned from a long stay away. 

I am thankful to Kuruppu who welcomed me and anticipated my every need and to Upul who took over and helped me learn more about the family and the property. Arjumath was so helpful, answering all of my (many) questions and arranging a tour of the city with a local tuk tuk driver. 

Kositha, the manager, is dedicated to making sure that every guest has the most pleasurable and comfortable experience.  And Isuru helped make sure I felt welcome and cared for. 

I highly recommend a massage!  Highly!!  I have had many great massages but this massage from Rohana was probably the best!!  The deep tissue massage was my selection and worth each of the 90 minutes!!  Afterwards, I sat glowing as I sipped my herbal tea. 

Thank you to everyone.
title: A delightful place!

ownerResponse/text:
I am delighted that you enjoyed your honeymoon stay with us, and thank you for the very kind comments about the hotel.

We wish you both every happiness in your newly married life together.

Thank you for taking the time to write a review.

Best wishes,

George Cooper
placeInfo/address: Habaraduwa Dikkumbura Road, Thittagalla West 80122 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
text:
We stayed here for our honeymoon and it was a wonderful experience.

The food was delicious and the service provided by the staff was superb. 

This is a gorgeous hotel with beautiful architecture and gardens.

Suggest to have a walk around in the morning.
title: A superb stay for a couple

placeInfo/address: Habaraduwa Dikkumbura Road, Thittagalla West 80122 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
text:
We stayed 2 nights here after a lovely tour of Sri Lanka to wind down before going back home.
We had a very warm and friendly welcome and stayed in the hibiscus villa with private pool.
The villa is beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The bed is wonderful and the bathroom really large with a double shower.
The garden area is real pretty overlooking tea plantations . You can even see pluckers at work ,
The pool is large and water warm .Nice sunbeds.
Tea and coffee making facilities with luxury tea bags .
The food is wonderful! Compliments to the chef. Lunch was delicious with nice healthy choices as well . Diner is a 3 course menu with Thai influences.
The only criticism is that the portions are too large so shame to waste.Bread is fresh .They use products from their garden.
Breakfast was really nice too .
The large reception/ bar area is very inviting and nice cocktails to be enjoyed.
The gardens are lovely and lots of birds around and monkeys eating all the mangoes !
The staff were lovely and and very attentive in all areas .
It’s about 40 minutes drive from Galle and 2h30 to the airport.
A perfect way to end our stay .
Also a few dogs and the lovely Ginger the cat who loves lots of attention!
title: Wonderful place to relax near Galle

placeInfo/address: Habaraduwa Dikkumbura Road, Thittagalla West 80122 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
roomTip: This place is perfect
text: After 3 years of cancellations due to Covid, we finally made it to Sri Lanka with a group of great friends for 2.5 weeks exploring the whole country which was amazing. The highlight was without doubt our 5 nights at the KK Collection Kahanda Kanda and the close by KK Beach Hotel-ohh wow what a find. George Cooper set the hotel up about 15 years ago and its a true hidden gem, coupled with the KK Beach club hotel about ten minutes away set on a true paradise beach, I cant reccomend both hotels strongly enough-and we are very fussy travellers who love 5 star hotels and service and couldnt find a single fault here. Sri Lanka is sadly still lacking tourists this year which is such a shame as the country  is totally safe, the people are some of the nicest ive ever met and the food is incredible. We lived in Asia for many years and got used to amazing 5 star hotels and service at a reasonable price point.The KK Collection certainly ticks all those boxes and more.Attention to every detail, staff service and friendlyness,accomodation,food and overall experience are out of this world. George Cooper is onsight most nights minging for pre dinner drinks and making sure everything is perfect,his a great host and I urge everyone to visit both hotels as you will not be disappointed-we will be back.Steven
title: True gem in Sri Lanka-You wont find better

placeInfo/address: Habaraduwa Dikkumbura Road, Thittagalla West 80122 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
roomTip: Ample parking is available. Get a villa with a private pool.
text:
Stayed in Hellaconia villa for two nights and was one of the most relaxing times I have ever had.
The food and the service of the staff were excellent. They had an al-carte menu during our stay and had different varieties for every meal and the meals and dessert were excellent.
Mr. George Cooper who is the owner of the premise visits every guest and make sure that everything is as they expected, which was nice to see.
Hellaconia suite contains a private pool and is ideal for a couple to have a relaxing time. The villa doesn't have a TV however, it has a small library which can keep you occupied during your stay. 
You might be able to see some wildlife during your stay here as well such as Monkeys and Pea Cocks, and if you are a dog lover there are few dogs within the hotel as well whom you can pet.
Even though the hotel is located near several attractions, you can spend the whole stay within the premises without any boredom.
Highly recommended for a calm relaxing stay in the down south area.
title: Exceptional Hellaconia

placeInfo/address: Habaraduwa Dikkumbura Road, Thittagalla West 80122 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
roomTip: Call/text for direct booking.
text:
Wonderful property surrounded by lush greenery and tea plantation. Lovely bed. Wide swimming pool - it needs regular cleaning as the leaves from the surrounding palms trees shade off and fall inside the water - they clean it regularly which is perfect. Tranquility is what we were looking for and got it here. The owner was around when we were at the property and he came one breakfast morning to say hello and check if everything was going on well (thanks for that George). Breakfast was so healthy and filling thanks to all the people involved and Niro for making it even better with the smooth service.

Our room had a lovely balcony but we didn't use it as much because of the nature species(all small wonderful animals) that are endlessly enjoying their space around - we even had a bird that came to say good morning all the time with its colourful beak. 

I'd recommend making sure to carry mosquito repellent and cover the bed with the net before late evening because a few insects still get a chance to penetrate around. Also use the odourless mosquito spray whenever you go out or if you forget tell the duty manager incharge and they will happily assist.
title: "Surrounded by Nature!"

text:
Returning to KK was our main reason for returning to Sri Lanka, our last visit being just prior to covid in 2020,  and at last we have just spent the last week of a 4 week SL trip at KK. Before travelling we were concerned that following the recent political problems in SL things may be different,  but I am happy to say everything for the tourist is as good as ever. 

We stayed in Kadju this time which was easier for my husband to access but still very private with a beautiful view over the tea plantation.  Spotted many birds and regularly saw the monkey family in a nearby tree. All villas are beautiful,  privately located, spotlessly clean and benefit from the owner's attention to detail. 

KK is ideal for relaxing, as we did, but staff can easily arrange local visits, and a trip to sister Hotel KK Beach is a must, even if just for lunch or dinner, and a good chance to see local life enroute. The early morning outdoor yoga sessions are also a good way to start another lazy day.  All  staff are excellent,  very caring and helpful. 

Food is excellent quality,  with a varied choice from a changing daily dinner menu,  only comment would be the portions are large!  Breakfast equally as good. Both taken on the scenic terrace. Also a good choice of cocktails and wine at reasonable prices.

George Cooper has perfected the art of understated luxury hospitality, can't wait to return.
title: Relaxation at it's best

placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
text:
This is the third time I have stayed at Kahanda Kanda and that in itself should be an indication of how nice the experience is. That said, if you are looking for a nonstop disco or busy nightlife KK is not for you. It is for guests who want to be out of the tourist hubbub and who want to immerse themselves in quiet village life. For those guests who are looking for a balance, you can stay at KK and take a tuk tuk into Galle Fort to experience throngs of fellow tourists shopping in jewelry and trinket shops, and return to KK in the evening.

At KK, you can go for bike rides to the beach and KK sister property KK Beach Hotel. I’ve borrowed a bike and wandered down roads discovering what you’ll never find in Galle. I’ve also walked down the village road and been offered to share a fresh coconut off of a homeowners tree, and then invited to meet the family and given a tour of the farm, including rice fields, fruit trees, farm animals and pets. I’ve also been invited into homes to sit and the be shown lotus flowers, vegetable gardens, and family members. The hospitality and kindness of the Sri Lankans here is incredible - and sincere. That kindness, friendliness and hospitality is indicative of Kahanda Kanda and its staff. I felt like a friend or family member.

The staff at Kahanda Kanda are incredibly friendly. That is not an exageration. They enjoy having to stay there as a guest. There is always a warm smile to greet you. At no time did I feel like an anonymous customer, but always as a friend or a member of an extended family. There is a warmth here you’d be lucky to find elsewhere. There are employees who have worked here for several years, so that tells me about the work environment.

KK is a working and fully functioning tea plantation. As you wander the property or enjoy a meal on the raised terrace overlooking the tea fields below, you’ll see people picking the tea or landscapers tending the gardens. If you have questions about what you see, you can easily engage the staff.

The accommodations at KK are wonderful. The villas are well maintained. The beds extremely comfortable. The outdoor showers, which supplement the indoor bathroom, a real treat. When is the last time you showered outdoors listening to tropical birds, peacocks and monkeys? Almost daily we would watch the monkeys foraging in the trees a short distance from our room, or watch mongooses forage in the yard, or see giant fruit bats at night.

Meals at KK are excellent and will match or beat the quality of many upscale restaurants, and at a reasonable price. There are spa facilities, an exercise room, and the ability to participate in a cooking demonstration by one of the chefs. If you enjoy a relaxing massage, this is your place. If you enjoy a relaxing Sri Lankan or western breakfast or dinner, this is your place. If you want to experience Sri Lankan hospitality, this is your place. If you are open to meeting other guests who share your interest in this sort of experience, this is your place. I have had some wonderful conversations with other guests at KK.

Things to do: 

Bike ride to adjacent villages and KK Beach.
Take a tuk tuk into Galle for a few hours.
Take an early morning boat trip to Lake Koggala.
Walk along the village roads and meet people.
Take day trips to nearby nature preserves.

What you should do:

Donate money or classroom materials to a nearby village school to support needy children and families. This was one of my trip’s highlights, in that I was able to visit a school and see the excitement in student’s eyes. Do it. It is a worthwhile experience you will treasure.
Treat the staff with the respect they deserve and the friendliness they are sharing with you.
Leave a generous gratuity in the tip box.
Ask the staff or Mr. Cooper for suggestions on what to do for activities.
title: Wow. Simply Wow.

Staff so warm, kind, attentive to your every need, fantastic food at each meal, delightful fellow guests with whom to chat, and a host who visits with each of his residents, making them feel welcome and part of the family.

Take the free tuk-tuk through charming villages with warm locals, down to the sister property KK Beach, where you will receive the same level of service and meals, while on a stunning, nearly empty and pristine beach.

text:
Kahanda Kanda was recommended to us as a good place at the end of our Sri Lanka trip.  As it turned out it was an excellent choice as my wife arrived with a severe bout of food poisoning from a previous hotel and this was the perfect place to recuperate.  The staff are extremely friendly and very considerate to my wife who was mortified at being so ill. 

The hotel is owned and created by an English interior designer, its villas are set among the working tea plantations are gorgeous; beautifully decorated and very comfortable.  The pool area and restaurant also have amazing views over the valley.

We were in Kumbuk, a plantation pool villa set in its own walled garden, it was spacious, private with its own large plunge pool and a place we could have happily stayed for a lot longer. 

In the restaurant the food is of a high standard, the chef has recently been sent to Thailand for a course on Thai cooking and this is reflected in the menu.  The menu changes daily and if there no Sri Lankan dishes on a particular day they can be ordered by request in advance.

The hotel is a 30 minute drive from Galle and we did visit the city on one day but really this hotel is a place to relax in.

As a final point, compared to some of the hotels on this trip Kahanda Kanda represented incredible value for money.
title: The perfect last stop

placeInfo/locationString: Thittagalla West, Galle District, Southern Province
text:
I have delayed writing this review as we stayed in April of this year and felt it
would be far more beneficial to write once the political situation was more 
settled and people had more confidence to travel to this beautiful island.
I now feel the time is right.

Kahanda Kanda is a truly beautiful and unique property bursting with George's
style and attention to detail.

George as you probably already know is the amazingly charming owner who directs the whole operation with real flair and aplomb.  A true English Gent.

The staff are excellently trained and are so willing to carry out all of you wishes.
The individual villas all different have a wonderful aura to them - attention to 
detail for all of the facilities is outstanding.

Food is excellent be it on the set daily menu or the ala carte and it is most pleasant
to have a pre dinner aperitif in the lounge area or indeed after dinner - the view is
stunning.

Should you wish to wander the estate there is always a member of staff wishing to
offer their knowledge and affection for Kahanda Kanda - a true learning experience.

If you just wish to relax by the pool (or indeed your own private one if that type of
villa is your wish) it is most pleasant to while away the hours with the lovely view 
whilst watching the wildlife that visit the pool area.  Alternatively, there are a wide
choice of alternative activities from boating to cycling - tea and cinnamon plantation visits or a tuk tuk to Galle.  The ride is exciting as it is enjoyable and well
worth doing to experience a smattering of village life on the journey.

I really do hope that now that the political situation has calmed that Sri Lanka will
once again thrive and that Kahanda Kanda - George and his team of excellent staff thrive with it.  They most certainly deserve to.

If you require a small, quiet relaxing place to stay to recharge your batteries before either returning home or commencing a busy tour Kahanda Kanda would be an excellent choice - highly recommended.
title: AN OASIS OF TRANQUILITY ON A BEAUTIFUL ISLAND

placeInfo/address: 670/5 Galle Road, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text: We had read many reviews praising the location and hospitality of the staff, and it certainly did not disappoint.  We had arrived here after about 10 days in the hill country, and so we had to acclimatise to the increased temperature, but it was lovely to have meals served on the verandah overlooking the ocean.  There is little to do in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, although walks to nearby villages are interesting. However, the hotel is just off the Galle Road, with a constant stream of buses to all locations up and down the coast, including Galle, Ambalangoda and Bentota.  This makes it easy to explore other parts of the coast.  A particularly enjoyable trip, arranged by the hotel, was to Lunuganga, the weekend retreat of the late architect Geoffrey Bawa, who designed the house (now a hotel in the same group as Kumu Beach) and the extensive gardens.  We mainly ate Sri Lankan food, which was excellent, and the chef was very willing to meet requests for off-menu items, such as prawns and calamari.  Thanks to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable.
title: A very enjoyable stay

roomTip: Talk to prabath he will always make sure you will be taken care of.
text:
After a challenging and hectic day dealing with the GM of Glenross Living Kalutara, we reached out to Kumu beach for a last-minute booking. They were incredibly kind and accommodating, assuring us not to worry and placing the booking on our behalf . Upon leaving Glenross Living, Kalutara property, we arrived at Kumu Beach around 7:15 pm. The staff was ready for us, promptly taking our bags and offering beverages while assuring our safety and comfort.

What followed was an overwhelming display of hospitality. Upon entering our rooms, we found the air conditioning already on, accompanied by a handwritten welcome note. They inquired about our dinner preferences, and after placing our order, we freshened up for a much-needed meal. Remarkably, one waiter named Ruchira noticed my strained voice and promptly brought honey and ginger, suggesting their consumption and even arranging a soothing jug of hot water with crushed ginger—a perfect antidote to the challenges faced earlier at Glenross Living, Kalutara.

We stayed for two nights, experiencing the best of everything—from delectable food to exceptional service. Prabath warmly welcomed us each morning at breakfast, ensuring our well-being and promising a memorable holiday. The care extended by Prabath and the team was outstanding, making us feel truly valued. The rooms were immaculate, the bathrooms spotless, and the food spectacular and spicy for us Sri Lankan food lovers. The standout moments were the exceptional hospitality provided by Prabath and Ruchindra. Our entire stay at Kumu Beach was nothing short of amazing, and we were grateful for the warm and welcoming atmosphere created by everyone at the establishment.
title: Embraced by warmth and exceptional hospitality at Kumu Beach after a challenging day.

text: Wir können das kleine und sehr feine Hotel uneingeschränkt empfehlen. Alles ist top in Ordnung. Alle Mitarbeiter sind rund um die Uhr bemüht, uns den Aufenthalt hier so angenehm wie möglich zu machen, ohne aufdringlich zu wirken. Das Essen ist sehr gut. Frühstück ist reichhaltig und vielfältig. Abendessen ist zwar hochpreisig, aber auch sehr zu empfehlen. Wir haben ein Zimmer im ersten Stock mit Meerblick. Es ist super schön ausgestattet. Einzig die undichten Fenster sind ein Minuspunkt. Dadurch ist das Meeresrauschen Tag und Nacht sehr laut zu hören. Der Infinity Pool ist gepflegt und an einer Ecke mit Massagedüsen ausgerüstet. Der Strand ist ordentlich und angenehm leer. Man kann vom Hotel aus einige interessante Ausflüge machen und sich in der Anlage sehr gut erholen. Es gibt ein breites Massageangebot, zu angemessenen Preisen. Wir fühlen uns sehr wohl hier und sind dankbar für die schöne Zeit.
title: Ein schöner Ort, für eine besondere Zeit

placeInfo/address: 670/5 Galle Road, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text:
Kumu beach is a lovely property to relax at after a busy tour. 

The location of the hotel is very quiet but has views of a beautiful beach and the infinity pool overlooks it. Worth nothing that the sea can be rough so you can't always swim in it. We also had some of the best sunsets I've ever seen here.

The service was faultless and staff very friendly. The food is of a really high standard with a nice mix of Sri Lankan and Western dishes. If you stayed more than 4 nights the menu might get a bit samey as it isn't huge. On our last night the team organised a romantic private dining experience which was lovely and the chef made us a delicious dinner that wasn't on the menu.

We had an ocean view room on the ground floor which had the most incredible bathroom and a private patio that looked out onto the beach. Ocean view rooms on the first floor don't get the special bathrooms so request a ground floor!

It is 2 hours from Colombo airport so ideal if you don't want a really long transfer on the day you fly home.

Overall I loved my time here and it allowed my boyfriend and I to properly relax before flying home after a busy itinerary.
title: Kumu beach is a lovely property to relax at after a busy tour.

text:
Stunning spot on the beach, feels cut off completely from the chaos of Negombo. 

Beautiful layout, feeling of space and very peaceful. 

Had a villa with private plunge pool on the beach- gorgeous setting, very private and huge space. Bathroom itself felt like a spa! 

Had our own butler- Koshan for our stay, he was brilliant and couldn’t do enough to help, jumped on every request quickly
and very attentive. 

Huge pool over looking the sea (couldn’t swim in the sea on our visit, too rough). 

Catered well for kids with food etc and the children’s water park (whilst small) was a massive plus and our little boy loved it. Turned the water park on when we asked and pretty much had it to ourselves for 2 days. 

Food in restaurant very good- a bit too much bread and portions large but maybe that is just us. Good wine and drinks list- all reasonable.

Made use of the spa, 2 massages both excellent. 

Only minor negative would be some of the pool loungers need new cushions and our plunge pool went cloudy after the first day (maybe down to our sunscreen!).
title: Stunning spot 45 minutes from airport
