placeInfo/address: No 212 Sangananda Mawatha Weligama, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text: I have just got back from a two week Ayurvedic holiday at Ayurview Weligama, and cannot recommend it highly enough.   The panchakarma is the most thorough detox that I have ever done.  All the Doctors and Therapists were professional and absolute experts in their field.  The resort is set on a picturesque beach and all the staff were so welcoming and friendly.  They make  sure everything is perfect, and nothing is too much trouble.  The Sri Lankan hospitality is genuine and you feel you are being looked after.  The food is sensational and the special meal on your last day is absolutely of five star establishment standard.   The ayurvedic food is also delicious.  Even if just relaxing and detoxing as I was, the entertainment, where some of the staff sing, cooking demonstrations and ayurvedic talks keep the stay interesting.  The pool overlooking the beach is also wonderful for relaxing.  I will definitely return.
title: Amazing Ayurvedic Detox

text: As an Ayurvedic travel agent, I came to Ayurveda with a group of 11 people. I was very impressed by the meticulous medical care and the organization of the consultations and therapies. Despite the fact that I had to interpret for 10 people each consultation, no one waited and everything was precisely planned. Therapies are carried out at a high level. The ayurvedic centre is beautiful and unique. The entire medical team and the entire therapy team as well as the hotel staff were very accommodating and met our expectations. They constantly checked to make sure we were happy. The rooms and the whole environment of the hotel is beautiful, clean and fragrant. Since I am in the nutrition business and my clients had a goal to lose weight, I very much appreciated Dr. Isuru's meticulous preparation of diet plans and nutrition knowledge. The entire group was very happy and I must say it was the best group retreat I have attended so far. I highly recommend the resort.
title: Best ayurvedic resort so far

text:
Um conceito diferente que está centrado no bem estar e harmonia.
As instalações são confortáveis, bonitas e muito limpas. A piscina virada para a praia é excelente para o pôr do sol.

O espaço de spa/ massagens e bem estar é o ponto central deste hotel. Uma primeira consulta abre um leque de opções de alimentação e tratamentos adequados a cada cliente que se traduzem em alimentos e chás específicos, e um programa de massagens / tratamentos para cada problema/ queixa. O que pode incluir massagens específicas, banhos e outros cuidados de bem estar.
Existem aulas de ioga bi diárias e a praia fica mesmo em frente ao hotel.

Sem dúvida um local ideal para desligar do mundo stressante e mergulhar no bem estar físico e mental.
title: Bem estar e harmonia com charme

text:
I really enjoyed my stay in this resort. If you are looking for a place for real peace, rest and recovery, this is the right place.
Ayurvedic medical and therapeutic care at the highest level, with a great emphasis on individual approach.
The wonderful environment and equipment of the entire hotel, as well as the rooms and excellent restaurant. The food is very specific, as it is prepared  individualy for each guest and with a healing effect.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your kind review! We’re thrilled to hear you enjoyed your Panchakarma retreat, treatments, and our serene atmosphere. We're also glad your room and the yoga sessions with Emil met your expectations, and that you left feeling relaxed and rejuvenated.

We appreciate your constructive feedback regarding orientation and the pool area. We'll work on improving these aspects to ensure a smoother experience for future guests. Your suggestion to split time between our properties is also a great idea!

We hope to welcome you back soon.

Warm regards,
The Ayurvie Team
placeInfo/address: No 212 Sangananda Mawatha Weligama, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
I enjoyed my 2 week Panchakarma retreat here. The treatments were wonderful and the treatment centre is really beautiful, calm and very well organised. Both my Dr and therapist were caring and excellent. I left feeling well and relaxed. The food is mostly good - especially the salads, soups and desserts.

It was very quiet during my stay and I was lucky there were some other friendly guests. Nearly all their guests are  from Europe and they cater very much for that market (especially German). I booked directly with the hotel but other guests booked through travel agents and got a much better deal. If you’re considering Ayurvie you may be better off splitting your time into a week here and a week at their property in Sigiriya. 

My room (205) was lovely (with extremely comfortable bed, very good linen and towels) and housekeeping was outstanding. Yoga with Emil was very good.

Room for improvement 
- need to have a better orientation. I felt a bit ‘lost’ when I arrived and there was no outline of how the program would work and what to do, where to go, ordering juices/teas etc. It was a case of figuring it out as I went. I booked for the requisite  14 days but really it could’ve been12 days. 
- the pool area is very worn and needs to be repaired - is bordering on dangerous. Lacking in shade. (I would have loved a tranquil garden to relax in!)
title: Great treatments

ownerResponse/text: Vielen Dank für Ihr herzliches und ausführliches Feedback! Wir freuen uns sehr, dass Ihre Erwartungen bei Ihrem zweiten Aufenthalt im Ayurvie Weligama sogar noch übertroffen wurden. Es ist schön zu hören, dass Ihr Mann dank unserer Behandlung nach seiner Corona-Erkrankung und seinem Burnout wieder voll leistungsfähig ist. Ihre lobenden Worte über unser engagiertes Team, die kompetenten Ärzte und Therapeuten sowie die liebevolle Betreuung durch das gesamte Personal bestärken uns in unserem Anspruch, unseren Gästen das Beste zu bieten. Wir freuen uns, dass Ihnen die kleinen Zusatzleistungen und das Essen vom Küchenchef so gut gefallen haben. Es wäre uns eine große Freude, Sie beide wieder bei uns begrüßen zu dürfen. Bis zum nächsten Mal!
placeInfo/address: No 212 Sangananda Mawatha Weligama, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
text:
Unsere insgesamt siebte Ayurvedakur und die zweite im Ayurvie Weligama hat alle Erwartungen übertroffen. Bereits im letzten Jahr war ich von der Kompetenz der Ärzte und Therapeuten sowie dem unfassbar lieben Personal so begeistert, dass klar war, ich würde wiederkommen.
Mein Mann hatte als Folge einer Coronainfektion einen Burnout erlitten und wir hatten große Hoffnungen, dass das Ärzteteam um Dr. Herath Hilfe leisten kann. Und es hat funktioniert: Er hat seine volle Leistungsfähigkeit wieder zurückgewonnen.

Alle Mitarbeiter waren hochmotiviert und sehr lieb und besorgt. Es beginnt mit den Rezeptionisten, geht über die Kellner und den Roomservice bis hin zur Hotelleitung.

Die Anwendungen sind sehr professionell und die Ausstattungen des Hotels sind ausgesprochen schön. Bemerkenswert sind die hellen Zimmer mit den schönen Balkonen. Wir hatten in diesem Jahr die große Suite, die keine Wünsche offengelassen hat.

Zum Erfolg der Kur tragen auch die vielen kleinen Zusatzleistungen bei, die wir in anderen Resorts so nicht erlebt haben:
Der Kräutertee wird jederzeit frisch aufgebrüht. Den ganzen Tag über gibt es verschiedene frisch gepresste Obstsäfte nach Wunsch. Wer zwischen den Mahlzeiten Hunger verspürt, erhält eine Obstplatte, die nach dem eigenen Geschmack zusammengestellt werden kann (natürlich unter Beachtung der ärztlichen Behandlungsvorgaben).

Wie bereits im letzten Jahr habe ich das leckere Essen von Chefkoch Kamal Nilanda sehr genossen. Als es meinem Mann anfangs nicht gut ging, bekam er eine "Wunschdiät"; ein Service, mit dem wir nie gerechnet hätten.

Auch der höchst kompetente Yogalehrer Emil hat die Kur mit den zweimal täglich stattfindenen Yogastunden unterstützt. Noch nie zuvor haben wir einen Yogalehrer erlebt, der die Wirkung der Übungen und deren korrekte Ausführung mit einem solchen Wissen und gut nachvollziehbaren Erklärungen begleiten konnte. Emil ist wirklich einzigartig!

Das Ärzteteam wird von Dr. Herath geleitet, den wir bereits 2011 in einem anderen Ressort kennen- und schätzen gelernt haben und der - zu Recht - als einer der besten Ayurvedaärzte auf Sri Lanka gilt. Aber auch die jüngeren Ärzte strahlen Kompetenz und Sicherheit aus und haben uns voll überzeugt.

Die Therapeuten sind nicht nur lieb, motiviert und engagiert, sondern auch sehr kompetent und konzentriert bei den Massagen. Wenn kleinere zusätzliche "Wehwehchen" auftraten, wurden diese sofort in Absprache mit den Ärzten mitbehandelt.

Für uns ist definitiv klar, auch die nächste Ayurvedakur wird wieder im Ayurvie Weligama stattfinden. Wir freuen uns schon auf das Wiedersehen.
title: Mit hohen Erwartungen gekommen und diese wurden noch deutlich übertroffen !

Die Ayurveda-Kur war sehr gut für Wellness und Erholung. Das Essen ist unglaublich gut, überwiegend vegetarisch. Gewürze und Zutaten sind großartig; die Köche geben sich enorm viel Mühe.
Man stellt sich auf die Bedürfnisse jedes Gastes ein, muss nur nach besonderen Speisen fragen, wenn man sie wünscht.
Das Personal ist unglaublich nett; die Leute haben immer ein Lächeln auf dem Gesicht und erfüllt jeden Wunsch.

placeInfo/address: Hemas Limited Halgranoya, Ragala, Nuwara Eliya, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: The bungalow is in a secluded corner down from the town of Regala, a tranquil setting among tea plantations with beautiful gardens and a stunning pool. It’s the perfect place to switch off but there are also beautiful hikes nearby which the tea plantation manager Hashra can take you to. The old bungalow is still in tact but the modern extension and the owners cottage rooms are stylishly done, bringing lots of light into the rooms. The hospitality and food were excellent too, Chanu and his team couldn’t do enough. Nb. The two owner cottages rooms are part of the same separate building, just a few steps from the main bungalow, attached by a small joining living space with coffee and tea. Many thanks for a wonderful stay!
title: Tranquil setting and excellent hospitality

text:
Staying at the Stafford Bungalow has truly been an absolute delight! From the moment  we arrived, we were greeted with exceptional hospitality which made us feel welcomed and at home. Chanu, the Head Butler, was in particular extremely helpful and worked hard to help us at every opportunity ensuring our family (especially Henry) had a wonderfully relaxing break! 

The dining here was fabulous, as well as the lovely afternoon tea. The fresh ingredients from the garden and the chef's attention to personal requests and detail made every meal a treat, especially in front of the open fire! We also loved the traditional Sri Lankan dinner one night. 

The location is also perfect – a tranquil haven nestled in the tea hills. Thank you for an unforgettable experience and we wound highly recommend staying at the Stafford! 

 Kindest regards, Alex, Adam and Henry.

text: The  calmness & serenity that defines the Stafford bungalow is noted as soon as you arrive. The accommodation, as with all aspects of this small hotel is top quality. The infinity pool sits in the most perfectly manicured gardens that are a pleasure to be in. The location is amazing in the middle of the tea plantation with truly breathtaking surrounding views. But it is the staff that will make your trip extra special. Chanu, the head butler was the epitome of professionalism, calm, gentle, always looking to see if any little thing can be done to make you stay more enjoyable. His fellow staff members, always ready with a smile & a hello, including the gardeners, definitely make you feel very special. Sanjeewa, the chef, spoke to us about every meal & our multiple food allergies & intolerances were never a problem. His food was AMAZING & like every staff member in this little taste of heaven he went above & beyond to make our stay enjoyable. As my title suggests if you get the chance to stay here, don’t hesitate’
title: If you get the chance to come here don’t hesitate!

placeInfo/address: Hemas Limited Halgranoya, Ragala, Nuwara Eliya, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Ons verblijf van 2 nachten in Stafford Bungalow was veel meer waard dan 5 sterren. Het is een prachtig onderhouden 'oude' bungalow uit 1884 op een geweldige plek.  De inrichting is adembenemend, veel authentieke details, prachtig meubilair, veel mogelijkheden in het huis om  lekker te loungen. Elke zitkamer heeft een open haard die ook elke dag wordt aangestoken. 
Prachtige tuinen, mooi zwembad, jacuzzi en een loungeplek met openhaard. 
Oorspronkelijk beschikte de accommodatie over 4 plekken. Recent is er een stuk aangebouwd waardoor er twee fantastische kamers bij zijn gekomen evenals een mooie eet-/relaxruimte. Complimenten voor de architect hoe hij/zij oud en nieuw heeft weten te combineren. 
Wij hadden een van die twee nieuwe kamers. Prachtig, ruim, eigen tuin met zitje. Prettige badkamer. Ook een zitgedeelte in de kamer. Turnoverservice. Aan alles is gedacht, zelfs aan een kruik!
Vanaf de grote grasvelden waarop het 's morgens goed ontbijten is heb je een fantastisch uitzicht over de theeplantages.
Het eten - van ontbijt, lunch, afternoon-tea en diner - was geweldig. Elke dag kwam de chef langs om met je te overleggen wat hij voor je kon bereiden. Alle groentes en kruiden vers uit eigen tuin. Elke maaltijd was een feestje.
Voeg daarbij de enorm attente, vriendelijke staff en je begrijpt dat we ons twee dagen in de wolken voelden. 
En dan ook nog een prachtige ochtendwandeling in het gebied rondom de bungalow onder leiding van de manager van de theeplantage. Een belevenis. 
Kortom: meer dan 5 sterren. Dank jullie wel StaffordStaff!
title: Meer dan 5 sterren

placeInfo/address: Hemas Limited Halgranoya, Ragala, Nuwara Eliya, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Absolutely first class establishment, lovely rooms, awesome grounds and pol area. It had food to die for from typical Sri Lankan food to more westernised. Everything is grown by them and it is a real soil to table place. The chef discussed the evening menu everyday do that you have a choice. The breakfast served in the garden is delightful and choices are again discussed. Christy and his staff cannot do enough for you and although it is very rural is a charming oasis to relax and unwind - we will definitely return
title: Absolute luxury

placeInfo/address: Hemas Limited Halgranoya, Ragala, Nuwara Eliya, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
This place is a beautiful old building complimented by a fabulous, well thought out modern extension.  The owner clearly  has an eye for style and the decor is both interesting and luxurious.  We a room in the newer part with a private garden.  The bedroom and bathroom were luxurious, stylish and comfortable  and a lot of thought had got into it.  Loved that as it wasn't hugely warm at night the turn down service had left us little hot water bottles that kept us snug!

The staff were really helpful and are rightly proud of what they have qt the bungalow.  The chef was great with the best meal i have had in Sri Lanka to date.   Tea and cake on the beautifully kept lawn was a nice touch as was making us dinner in the outside "snug' by the  candle lit pool on our last night which was really special.  I don't think this is the type of place you would stay for ages...but it has good location for tea factories,  is set in the beautiful tea hills which are completely stunning and is a real joy to stay in where you leave feeling very spoiled.  Would definitely recommend for a slice of tranquility,  history and great service in Sri Lanka.
title: Stunning location, fabulous service and beautiful accommodation

placeInfo/address: Hemas Limited Halgranoya, Ragala, Nuwara Eliya, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Didn't try the pool but there is a hot spa pool which others enjoyed.
text: Very attractive colonial-era bungalow, originally built by a Scottish tea planter and still with that atmosphere.  Beautiful garden full of flowers with a lovely view over the the hotel's own tea bushes.  Breakfast is served out here.  Excellent food.  Our room was large and extremely comfortable.  The hotel thoughtfully placed hot water bottles in the bed (the tea country can be chilly), and kept offering to light a fire in the several fire places, which we eventually agreed to.  Very interesting walk of about an hour from the hotel with a local guide to learn about growing tea.  All staff extremely helpful and charming.
title: Charming small hotel

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you enjoy spicy food, order the traditional Sri Lankan breakfast, it’s an exotic feast.
text: This suites-only gracious heritage boutique hotel is centrally located in the affluent Cinnamon Gardens area of Colombo. Originally an early 1800s traditional home for a wealthy family it is designed around a beautiful courtyard. Maniumpathy is immaculate in every sense; a heritage delight and architecturally rich,  the professional friendly staff always on hand to assist, beautifully appointed luxurious rooms, and a very talented chef who offers amazing local cuisine (our traditional breakfast of hoppers with Seer fish curry was a ‘flavour bomb’ according to our daughter). I highly recommend staying at the glorious Maniumpathy Hotel it surpassed every expectation.
title: Luxurious oasis in Colombo

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: A luxurious and authentic oasis in the centre of Colombo. Beautiful rooms arranged around a traditional courtyard setting. Outdoor dining on the veranda and an indoor dining room and lounge setting. Incredibly attentive, friendly and professional staff. The traditional Sri Lankan breakfast alone is worth the stay. Many thanks to Maniumpathy for a memorable and hospitable stay.
title: Luxury boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
We enjoyed an incredible dinner at Maniumpathy Hotel! The serene and charming atmosphere made it a perfect retreat. The highlight of our meal was undoubtedly the Great Jaffna Thali – the flavors were authentic and absolutely delicious.
The Duty Manager was extremely helpful, particularly with our parking needs. The staff's attentiveness and the hotel's overall ambiance truly enhanced our experience. We highly recommend this place to anyone seeking a peaceful getaway with excellent food and service!
title: Wonderful Dinner with Authentic Jaffna Thali and Outstanding Service!

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: On my first day in Sri Lanka, I came to Maniumpathy and instantly fell in love with the historic charm and appeal of the entire property! Not only is it located in a great locality of Colombo, it offers so much inside the hotel that it will be quite difficult for you to leave and go explore the city! I absolutely loved everything here from the interiors, laidback vibe and friendly staff! I’d like to make a special mention for the entire staff as they were all so friendly and upbeat throughout the day and their energy really transfers onto the guests! Upul really looked after me during my time at Maniumpathy and he was just so attentive and friendly and patient! Very accommodating staff as well as polite. They have 7 rooms available which are each differently furnished and I really didn’t expect the level of luxury that I saw in each room! Super beautiful and aesthetic corners dotted around the property as well as some active squirrels which you can spot! The bathrooms were regal and the entire feel of the rooms can instantly relax you and put you in a vacation mood! If you’re coming from the Middle East or in a group/with family, this is a great place to base yourself out of since it’s a locally owned property and they can offer you a true Sri Lankan experience through their hospitality, food and entertainment! I tried so many items from their menu as well and thoroughly enjoyed everything! It was my first time trying Sri Lankan food and the Thaali they served me (A platter consisting of different dishes in small quantities which allow you to eat several things at once) just blew me away and I can really see how different it is to regional cuisines of South Asia while still bearing a few similarities. The Jaffna curry and the Payasam was my favourite! Their pool area is so serene and you can even enjoy at their spa! I think it’s wonderful to stay at several hotels whenever visiting a new country or city as you can check out the area as well and learn more through the locals so a visit to Maniumpathy is definitely a must for the ultimate Sri Lankan experience!
title: A true example of Sri Lankan opulence and comfort in the heart of Colombo! A great place to stay in Sri Lanka!

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: This is my 2nd time here and  it was nice to have visit it again. We went for a high tea buffet just for a change and OMG it was the best. So much worth for the price and the selections were amazing, the environment, the food were just a perfect match and so much fulfilling. And again thankyou so much for the wonderful experience and the service. Hoping to visit again.
title: High tea experience

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
OMG! What a gorgeous boutique hotel! We enjoyed their verandah cafe and the food was superb. In fact it was so good that after visiting for lunch the first time, we returned the next day for breakfast! 

We didn't experience their rooms but the overall service was so good that we would recommend Maniumpathy for a stay too. The decor is elegant and tasteful, and the house has so much history, which is lovingly celebrated.
title: Amazing food in an elegant home

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: I can’t comment on value as this was booked as part of a package, but it was as a very comfortable stay, in a good area.
text: We had a warm welcome from the staff after a long flight. Our room was quiet, clean and very comfortable. The food and service were very good. I would recommend this lovely hotel.
title: A lovely short stay

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text:
We came to this hotel with high expectations from the reviews, glad to say was not disappointed in any way. The room are stunning beautiful, we stay in one of there best rooms and detail to finish was  fantastic, when you been out most of the day in the city it was so relaxing to come back to.
The staff were so helpful accomadated all your needs,  the breakfast and dinner were superb, we enjoyed dinner twice in this hotel and it was worth staying in for.  Reception Manager Arjumath was so good at her job so helpful, the staff who cleaned the room were fantastic, also the massage man was excellent in this hotel.
 The general manager was wonderful man so helpful and made our stay truly wonderful, I wish we had longer here would defiantly come back it worth every moment, thank you for stunning stay.

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Great small hotel for stay in Colombo.  Friendly helpful staff, cute pool, fab rooms with great pillows & easy to get around by Uber Tuk!  Delicious breakfasts with lots of choice & freshly squeezed juices.  I would recommend for a few nights in Colombo

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel is beautiful and well taken care off. It’s an old colonial home that has been tastefully converted into a boutique hotel. I stayed there twice and the second time all the staff recognized me and made me feel at home.

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka

title: Great Stay in Colombo

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We enjoyed a walking tour for a couple of hours one morning and had a food tour in the evening - both were really interesting

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: We spent just a day in this lovely heritage property - a bungalow that has been lived in for 4 generations. This is a boutique property, just the kind we like. placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: We had a 2 night stay at this beautiful place and it was the most satisfying experience we've ever had. The rooms were a wonder,consisting with an exotic view. However we were informed about an event that was supposed to take place at the evening, it was very thoughtful and organizing of them to inform us about it prior to our dinner. And the staff offered us to have our dinner in the balcony arranging a fantastic dinner night with the best view we could ever imagined in the city of Colombo. placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try the Jaffna crab thali if you enjoy Sri Lankan food
text: This is a beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of Colombo. Just walking into the lobby made you feel calm and serene. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The rooms are wonderfully comfortable but also have personality with heritage pieces from the family that owned the property. When we had a problem in our original room, the staff upgraded us to suite and moved all our luggage for us. The food is excellent - we loved our crab and fish thalis and the Sri Lankan breakfast complete with hoppers was delicious. Cannot recommend highly enough!
title: Beautiful boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: 129 Kynsey Road, Colombo 00700 Sri Lanka
text: Wonderful. A luxury boutique hotel tucked away in Colombo with antiques and other carefully curated furnishings that reflect the style and sophistication of the family who once lived there. The food and service are excellent and there is a pool to cool down in.
title: Wonderful

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Clarke,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave such a detailed and thoughtful review following your recent 10-day stay with us at The Fortress.

It’s always a pleasure to know that our guests appreciate the peaceful atmosphere, comfort, and beautiful surroundings we strive to provide.

Your comments about our breakfast offerings, diverse menu, and the overall quality of food are greatly appreciated. 
We are especially happy that you enjoyed the range of both local and international dishes. 

We do take note of your observations regarding restaurant service during busy periods and are actively working on enhancing team training and scheduling to ensure a consistently smooth experience.

Thank you also for highlighting the warmth and hospitality of our team, your kind words mean a great deal to us and will be shared with the entire staff.

We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back to The Fortress in the future for another memorable stay by the sea.

With best wishes!
placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Koggala 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent 10 days here rounding off our tour of Sri Lanka. This beachside hotel featured an extensive pool area (50 m pool for serious swimmers) and smaller pools for children. The hotel's grounds are quite large, allowing guests to find private spots if desired. The hotel grounds give access to a sandy beach but sea swimming is not the main theme due to surf and currents.
The rooms are spacious and well-equipped with comfortable beds and pillows. We chose the bed and breakfast option but noted there are not many dining options nearby without taking a taxi. A Tuk Tuk ride to Galle, approximately 15 km away, costs about £8 each way, with drivers willing to wait a couple of hours for you in the price.
Breakfast at the hotel offers a wide variety, including pastries, fresh fruit, smoothies, cooked breakfast options, and continental bread basket selections. Many might find a midday meal unnecessary after a substantial breakfast.
The main menu is extensive, featuring Sri Lankan curries, prawn and fish options, as well as chicken, lamb, and vegetarian dishes. There are also burger, chicken  and fish and chips options for those who prefer less spicy food. Most main courses are priced around $15 USD, with starters ranging from $5 to $15 USD. We found a main course sufficient though. however a couple of glasses of wine and beer can double the price of a meal.
The staff were consistently excellent throughout the hotel. While service in the restaurant occasionally suffered when busy, this appeared to be a management or training issue rather than a reflection on the staff, who were always responsive and helpful.
Overall, the country is very welcoming, with friendly locals who value tourism. The accommodation, food quality, and service were all commendable.
.
title: 10 days Fortress Hotel Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Koggala 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Wonderful hotel set in old buildings, we loved our 8 night stay there.   
Breakfast was exceptional with endless options and our Ocean view room was beautiful, so spacious with stunning views of the pool, beach and sunsets.

All the staff are wonderful with very good training and always smiling.  Particular thanks to Nuwan the pool guy and we loved seeing the baby turtles which are hatching in an area to the side of the pool, such a great initiative by the hotel.  

The beach by the hotel is lovely for walking, very empty and under developed so you can walk for miles.   Mostly the sea is too rough for swimming but there is a little lagoon by the hotel for a dip at low tide.

We did many trips out from the hotel to Galle for cricket & history tour and Aghangama where there are lovely bars & restaurants. 

Only slight issue is the tuk tuk drivers who run like a mafia opposite the hotel, constantly trying to over charge which gets annoying & tiring every time you go out.   
If you check the Pick Me app which is the Uber for transport in Sri Lanka you can see the true price you should be paying but the Pick Me drivers were not  able to come near the hotel!

Our favourite  places in Ahangama were Kai, Hotel de Uncles & Ceylon Sliders for more modern food & cocktails and watching the surfers at sunset.   1000 LKR each way is generous for the 10 min tuk tuk ride.  It’s a lovely local town.

Best beach for swimming & snorkelling is Wijaya, often turtles there but you need to go early and leave by 10am as it gets far too busy.  Beautiful for an hour first thing.
title: Beautiful Hotel with brilliant service, stunning views and peaceful

text:
The Fortress is a simply magnificent Resort. This beach front Resort has all the facilities you can ever want for a relaxing and truly enjoyable experience. (pools, spa, gym, great restaurants and Bar, delicious and an array of foods just to name a few.) 

The staff are amazing, very hospitable and always welcoming and friendly. We travelled from Australia and stayed two nights in the Beach room (courtesy of a generous double upgrade) which was an awesome luxurious beach front room, very spacious and clean with all the facilities you need. 

We had our Wedding Ceremony at the Fortress and there is simply no words to describe the wonderful experience we had. Every aspect of our wedding ceremony was professionally and meticulously arranged by the staff at the Fortress. From organising the necessary marriage documents to the floral arrangements, wedding bouquets and bower, decorations, cake, celebrant, music, photography, special celebratory dinner, and the list goes on., we couldn’t have been happier with all of these things and the very best service we received at the Fortress. 

A special mention to our wedding coordinator ‘GAYANI’ who went above and beyond to make sure that our wedding ceremony was successful and memorable. Her attention to detail and dedication to make sure we were happy with all the arrangements is something we will always remember and be grateful for. 

From the time we arrived until we checked out the service was exceptional. All the staff never fail to smile and greet us. The food was delicious & the atmosphere was refreshing.

Thank you for the wonderful and memorable experience!

We are sure to visit again on our next trip to Sri Lanka.
title: Friendly and professional staff, luxurious rooms and facilities, relaxing and refreshing atmosphere, exceptional service

text:
The Fortress was our final hotel on our Sri Lanka holiday and we could not have chosen a better place to spend our last week, it is simply a stunning resort.
We were in the Fortress rooms which we knew in advance didn’t have a beach view and that didn’t affect us at all. The room was lovely and spacious. There was a proper size fridge, daily water provided and excellent house keeping.
The food at the White restaurant was superb, we would end up having a 3 course breakfast and ate dinner at the hotel every evening. Mr Sam was always around to answer and questions on the menu and the service staff were great.
There are plenty of sun loungers, even when coming back to the hotel in the afternoon and the pool is stunning. Turtles can be seen just off the beach and Laksiri and all the pool guys are really good.
The little tuk tuk stand opposite was handy and the staff on the hotel gate were super helpful by always agreeing the price for us with the drivers in advance.
It’s the best hotel we have stayed in and we will certainly come back again.
title: Stunning hotel

Our room was exceptionally clean, although certain parts were a little bit tired, but we had a first class service from both Namal and Lakmar, who made sure we had everything we needed and it was a delight to see the creative displays on a few occasions on our bed when we returned. We were so surprised to see Laksiri after so many years who was now the supervisor of pool boys, we were so looked after by both Laksiri and Upul, we always had our sun loungers, towels and umbrella prepared. We thoroughly enjoyed our 8 nights, we  booked half board basis for first time, in hindsight I would not do that again as we prefer flexibility and a la carte, the set menu which comes with half board was ok, but for not a lot more the a la carte was far better. Next time we will book just  bed and breakfast.  The hotel is stunning visually and staff were so helpful and accommodating. I also enjoyed having a manicure and pedicure. We hope to be back again,

roomTip: Looking for the ultimate Destination Wedding hotel... it's here!
text:
Where do I start? Firstly, a massive apology for taking too long to write my 5 star review.

Our secret destination elopement wedding took two years to plan, but it only took a few moments to realise that, after touring Sri Lanka for a week, we wanted to not only relax at the Fortress for 5 days, but also to get married here as well. 

The good reviews are all you need to read. From the moment we arrived everyone knew who we were and we were treated like the king & queen of the hotel for the duration of our stay.

The huge wooden doors greet you and the moment you step through them you just know you’re in a real land of luxury and that your stay here is going to be truly memorable. 

Our Wedding Planner Gayani was there to meet us and give us a grand tour of the hotel. Our room was ready on arrival – a complimentary upgrade to a ground floor plunge pool room (WOW!) which opened up directly on to the amazing garden area with the pool & beach just several meters away. Once we were settled we met up with Gayani once again to plan our wedding day which turned out to be extremely straightforward – mainly because, once we’d chosen flowers, locations, timings, etc. Gayani simply wouldn’t let us lift a finger and she arranged absolutely everything!

After a busy week touring Sri Lanka it was finally time to relax. The pool area is stunning, the gardens are exceptionally well maintained, the beach is glorious (right hand side you can walk for miles, left hand side is a safe swimming area), the whole hotel is spotlessly clean, the bar is relaxing, the comfy sunbeds moved to where ever you’d like them, the service is quick, professional and super-friendly… I could go on and on! Every single member of staff had a smile on their face.

We were all inclusive and to our surprise some evenings in White were buffet and some a la carte, there was also a seafood BBQ buffet. We didn’t see the point of eating at the Salty Snapper but we did eat at Duo on our wedding night which was one of the best meals we’ve ever had. Some reviews said it was a little pricey but as it was our wedding night we decided to treat ourselves.  The restaurant staff were all amazing and the food the best we had in all of our trip, so much variety and everything so tasty. We ate so much at breakfast we didn’t need lunch and in the evenings we still struggled to fit in more food. 

We had planned to go outside of the hotel and explore but we were so comfy, happy and relaxed after our week touring that we decided to just enjoy the hotel, the weather, the turtles swimming just off shore, the lizards and crabs running about, and the bats flying around at night. Oh and there was a massive grass snake on day 1, plus some noisy crows. 

We did have to venture to the local Registry Office to apply for our wedding licence. Again, Gayani arranged all of this for us. Her driver picked us up and Gayani met us there… on her day off.  This was quite an exciting & interesting part of the experience of getting married overseas.

Our wedding day involved a lovely breakfast and a couples massage in the spa. My wife-to-be said it was one of the best massages she’s ever had. I’ll be honest I think the wedding nerves were kicking in and I struggled to relax. My partner was then treated to two hours of hair & make-up whilst I was given a spare room to relax & get ready in. Some of the minibar may have been consumed to calm the nerves. At a very reasonable extra cost we paid for dancers & drummers who collected me at reception and paraded me through the hotel and on to the beach.  It was then my partners turn.  The sun was shining, it was just about bearable in the heat, the whole hotel had a wedding show just for them and everything was simply amazing. Maybe we should have googled Sri Lankan weddings a bit more before the day, but I think the surprise of everything made it 10x betting, especially when two young girls appeared out of nowhere and started singing – we both had to hold back some tears. After the ceremony on the beach we signed the wedding certificates, shared out some cake and popped some champagne. We headed to the bar and then to the Duo restaurant which was the perfect end to an unforgettable day! 

Thank you, especially to Gayani, for the wedding of a lifetime. Not only would I highly recommend staying at the Fortress Resort & Spa but I would highly recommend getting married here as well.
title: Thank you for the wedding of a lifetime.

text:
What sets apart one hotel to another in the same category is the service standards and this hotel exceeded expectations. 
I came here with a severe liver condition where had only limited food choices, cooked with strict guidelines. Most hotels wouldn't accommodate to the T, but Chef Manjula and his team went out of the way to ensure that everything was available and with perfection so that my health could be maintained during the stay. Trust me it wasn't easy. 
The hotel rooms were spec and span , which blended with the jungle theme. The setting was perfect not just to set the tone for the safari but to unwind amidst nature. 
The entire staff was attentive and friendly. 
Coming from India, settled in Dubai and used to Taj, Marriot, Shertan, Raddison hospitality which is already class apart, Sri Lankan service standards and specifically Cinnamon Wild, set new benchmarks for me. 
Thank you to the Chef and the entire team for making it a smooth and comfortable experience given my precarious heath condition.
title: Par Excellence Service Standard

Thank you very much for taking the time to share your detailed and thoughtful feedback about your recent stay with us at Cinnamon Wild Yala. We’re truly delighted to know you enjoyed the unique setting of our resort, nestled between the wilderness of Yala National Park, the serene lake, and the dramatic Indian Ocean.

I’m also glad to know that the safari allowed you to witness some of Sri Lanka’s most iconic animals. While we understand the comparison with African safaris, we hope the intimacy and diversity of our local experiences—paired with the comfort and care of Cinnamon hospitality—provided you with a memorable adventure in its own right.

Your kind words about our bungalows, rooftop bar, and breakfast variety are much appreciated. I’ll also personally convey your compliments to Danushka—he will be thrilled to know that his service and effort to engage with you in German added warmth to your stay.

We do acknowledge your comment regarding pricing, and we thank you for the honest feedback. Our culinary team works hard to source quality ingredients and offer diverse menus, and we continuously evaluate how to best align value with guest expectations.

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82614 Sri Lanka
text:
Das Hotel befindet sich direkt neben bzw. im Yala Nationalpark. Direkt daneben befindet sich ein See an dem immer wieder Tiere (Büffel, Kraniche, Krokodile) beobachten werden können. Außerdem ist direkt neben dem Hotel das Meer mit einem weitläufigen Strand. Leider kann dort nicht gebadet werden, jedoch können tolle Wellen während einem Spaziergang beobachtet werden.
Das Hotel bietet einen schönen Pool mit Liegen.
Die Zimmer sind über die Anlage in kleinen Bungalows verteilt und nett eingerichtet.
Während unserer Safari konnten wir Elefanten, Affen, Wasserbüffel, Pfauen und Krokodile sehen. Die Safari war sehr schön, kann allerdings leider nicht mit einer Safari in Afrika mithalten.
Das Hotel hat zwei Restaurants und eine Rooftopbar. Das Abendessen war sehr gut, allerdings mit stolzen Preisen für Sri Lanka (ca. 10€ für ein Hauptgericht oder Buffet ca. 30€).
Das Frühstück war dafür inklusive und es gab eine riesen Auswahl an leckeren Speisen (Eierspeisen, Müsli, Obst, Curry, Toast, Pancakes, Waffeln, Säfte,....). Durch den Kellner Danushka hatten wir einen tollen Service. Er war ausgesprochen freundlich, hilfsbereit und bemühte sich paar deutsche Wörter zu lernen.
title: Nice Hotel in the Yala Nationalpark

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Carina,

Warmest greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala!

I was truly moved reading your beautifully detailed review—thank you for taking the time to share your experience in such depth and sincerity. It’s always a privilege to host well-traveled guests like yourself, and to know we stood out among your global journeys means the world to us.

You captured the essence of Cinnamon Wild in a way few do—the balance between comfort and wilderness, the sound of the ocean threading through the trees, the quiet adventure of moving through our property at night. We put our hearts into curating this blend of nature, peace, and responsible luxury, and your words reaffirm that effort in the most meaningful way.

I’m especially grateful for your kind words about our team, and most notably, about Saman. He is, indeed, a remarkable part of our Cinnamon Wild family. Your recognition of his heartfelt service, generosity of spirit, and thoughtful gestures—like arranging that candlelit dinner—will mean a great deal to him. I will personally ensure your praise is shared with him and with our team, who take great pride in creating memorable stays.

Your safari feedback was equally heartening. We deeply believe that wildlife experiences should be approached with reverence and insight—not just as a checklist—and our naturalists and drivers are passionate about showcasing Yala in exactly that way. I’m thrilled you had such a powerful, intimate moment with the young leopard—what a privilege.

Please know that you will always have a home here with us. Should your travels bring you back to Sri Lanka, we’d be honoured to welcome you once again—to reconnect with nature, unwind in wild luxury, and be embraced by the same warmth that made this stay special.

Until then, from all of us—thank you, truly. And yes, we agree: Cinnamon Wild is incredibly lucky to have people like Saman.

With warm regards and heartfelt appreciation,

Lashanthan Gopalan
Resort Manager
Cinnamon Wild Yala

roomTip:
Book your safari through the hotel — it’s absolutely worth it.

Get to the pool early if you want a chair —‘great for total relaxation
text:
Cinnamon Wild Yala is, without question, one of the most extraordinary places I’ve ever stayed—and I’ve traveled the world extensively. Tucked on the edge of Yala National Park, it offers a truly immersive nature lodge experience with an unmatched combination of comfort, adventure, and deeply heartfelt hospitality.

The grounds are stunning. I stayed in one of the beachside huts, slightly elevated with the ocean just visible through the lush foliage. Even when you can’t see it clearly, you can hear the waves—soothing and constant. Walking through the property at any time of day or night feels like part of the adventure: peaceful, a little wild, and deeply restorative. The rooms are lovely, spotlessly clean, with powerful air conditioning (a must in the Sri Lankan heat), and the overall environment is carefully maintained without ever feeling sterile. The entire property radiates a respect for nature and quiet luxury.

But the heart of Cinnamon Wild is its people. Every member of the team—from the staff helping guests move safely at night to the restaurant crew and naturalists—was professional, kind, and incredibly competent. I was traveling solo, and never once felt out of place, uncomfortable, or overlooked. Quite the opposite.

One man, in particular, made an unforgettable impression: Saman, who works in the restaurant and bar area near the lobby (not the rooftop). Saman is a gem of a human being—warm, genuine, and generous in a way that can’t be taught. He spoke to me about his children and his life with such honesty and kindness, making me feel completely at home without ever crossing a boundary. It’s rare to find someone so naturally gifted in service and connection. One night, he arranged a private, candlelit dinner for me by the pool—even suggesting I invite my delayed friends—and when I dined alone instead, he made sure I felt relaxed, welcome, and totally cared for. It’s hard to express how much that meant. Cinnamon Wild is incredibly lucky to have him. He embodies what true hospitality is meant to be.

As for the safari experience—this is the real reason to come to Yala, and booking through Cinnamon Wild is absolutely worth it. I paid $200 USD and felt it was a bargain. My experience was private—just me, an expert naturalist, and an incredibly skilled driver, both arranged through the lodge. Their knowledge of the park and its rhythms was astounding. Thanks to them, I had a once-in-a-lifetime encounter with a young female leopard—less than two years old, not yet named. She emerged gracefully and stayed near our vehicle long enough that we shared a real moment. I saw every kind of wildlife I could have hoped for. My friends, who booked outside the hotel for a cheaper rate, were deeply disappointed by comparison.

The Cinnamon Wild safari team doesn’t just “do the drive”—they read the land. Their guide knew exactly where to go, and the driver was not only skilled on Yala’s notoriously rough roads (I was totally comfortable the entire ride), but also respectful of the animals and other guests. This wasn’t tourism—it was reverence.

In short, Cinnamon Wild is a place I would return to in a heartbeat—and send my family and closest friends to without hesitation. It’s rare to find a property that combines this level of natural beauty, comfort, and truly exceptional human care. If you’re considering Yala, don’t think twice. Book Cinnamon Wild—and if you’re lucky, Saman will be there to greet you.
title: Glowing Review: Cinnamon Wild, YALA — A Once-in-a-Lifetime Safari Retreat

text:
This was my first time staying here and I loved every minute of it. From the second I walked in, the staff at the front office were super welcoming and check-in was quick and easy — exactly what I needed after a long trip from Colombo.
I stayed in a Jungle Chalet and it was really spacious, clean, and cozy. You feel so close to nature, it’s honestly such a peaceful vibe.
The safari organized by the hotel was AMAZING — I actually got to see a few leopards which was a huge highlight for me! The Nature Trails team did a great job and made it such a fun experience.
The food was also sooo good — totally worth it. But my favourite part of the whole stay was stargazing at the rooftop restaurant. It was magical! ✨
If you’re thinking of visiting, I’d say go for at least 2 nights — one night is just not enough to take it all in. I just can’t wait to go back!
A special shoutout to Lasanthan, Sandushi, Sudath and Sahan from the Cinnamon team for making my stay extra special with their warm hospitality!
title: I can't wait to come back!

text:
Wattura resort is one of the best hotels for any holiday maker who is in need of a break from the hustle and the bustle of the everyday life..
 Apart from its excellent location with serenity and tranqulity which is enhanced by the sea view in its front and the lagoon by its side, the hospitality of the staff is the most notable.
Mr. Sujeewa, the manager was very flexible and he did his fullest to make our stay enjoyable by allowing late checkout for us. Our daughter was so thrilled as she could dabble in water for many hours and she could enjoy herself with the facilities available for recreation. We stayed their on 15th of March, 2025. 
The welcome drink made served there is the best drink I ever had. It was made of tamarind. I asked for more and the staff was really generous to offer another glass for me. 
All in the reception were really friendly and receptive to our ideas. The restaurant staff were very hospitable and they did their fullest to make our stay extremely enjoyable with their mouth-watering food items.  The excellence in the cuisine of the hotel should be noted and our thanks should go to the waiters for their patience with us as they all responded positively to our requests always with a smile on their faces.. the culinary experts at the kitchen should be given a special mention here..
Our stay was really enjoyable and worth more than the money we paid. 
This is a must-visit hotel to enjoy the hospitality of Sri Lankans. Its beauty is enhanced by the superb service of the staff.
title: Wattura Resort Review

text:
This beautiful resort is on the Waikkala Beach l, Negombo, facing fabulous Indian Ocean. Visited this resort with 2 families. It is extremely peaceful and calm establishment surrounding nicely maintained and clean outdoors. 

The check-in process was super fast and they allowed early check-in as well. The tamarind drink served as a welcome drink was superb. 

The rooms were spacious and luxurious. Equipped with all A-Z amenities. Bathroom was fabulous. We stayed river front suits. 

They serve ala-carte at the restaurant. The portiins were considerably larger. Tastes is awesome. The restaurant staff is very attentive and fulfilled every aspect. 

The large swimming pool is nice and clean, facing the beach. You could enjoy a lovely sunset from the pool on a clear day. There is a kids play area with a water park and gaming arena. Something I see very rarely in resorts in Sri Lanka. Extremely kids friendly and kiddos enjoyed it to the max. 

Overall 5 star stay with full of peace and clamness. Special thanks to the manager Mr. Sujeewa for the excellent service rendered and allowing late chaeckout as well. I must mention Mr. Sanjeewa and the crew from restaurant, Ms. Sakuni and Piyumika at the front office, Mr. Wishwa and Mr. Hiruna for their remarkable service. Kudos for that !
title: Perfect Calmness !

text:
«Мама, я не хочу уезжать из этого отеля», «мама, когда мы сюда приедем снова» это мне говорили дети в последние дни.

Му путешествуем часто, останавливаемся в лучших отелях, поэтому отзыв претендует на объективное впечатление искушенного туриста. Были компанией 4х детей 11, 9, 6 лет, младенца и 3х взрослых.

Мы останавливались в вилле. Всего в отеле, кажется, 10 вилл и 19 сьютов.
 Сказать хочется много, но в отличии от остальных отелей здесь персонал делает свою работу не формально, а С ДУШОЙ!

Как только я написала вопрос про трансфер из Москвы через букинг, со мной по ватсап связался Кальпа, он же с водителем приехал встречать в аэропорт. Он же решал все наши запросы. 

По приезду нас познакомили с нашим батлером Чамиду, он же был официантом, когда мы ходили в рест.

Для понимания уровня заботы о гостях. Когда мы разбили детскую бутылочку Кальпа сам предложил поехать купить новую.
Так же нам нашли по запросу прекрасного педагога по английскому для детей, которая ежедневно приходила к детям на 3 часа. У нее не было местного акцента и они прекрасно друг друга понимали. 

Так же по запросу нам нашли инструктора по кайтсерфингу. Минутах в 10. Занятия проходили в реке. В первый раз было противно🙈

Удаленность от аэропорта. Перелопатив кучу информации по пляжам Шри на финальное решение повлияло большое кол-во детей и младенец. Несколько часов в пути были бы сложноваты, поэтому 40 мин до Wattura на Viano были очень комфортны.

Волны. Это было прекрасно! Они были невысокие, даже 6 летка в жилете с удовольствием плескался сам. До обеда можно было плавать по-настоящему, так сказать за волнами, которые поднимаются ближе к берегу, а чуть дальше(по грудь) их нет. Море ооочень теплое.
Наши дети, как и многие обычно любят сидеть в басике. Поэтому и берем виллы со своим бассейном. Но тут они просились на море! 

Цены в отеле: как в хороших ресторанах Москвы, впрочем как и во всех отелях по Миру.

Ресторан: там ресторан один. Многие заказывают в номер. А мы ходили каждый раз, чтобы не провоцировать муравьишек. Мы минут за 30 делали заказ по ватсап нашему Батлеру и к приходу было все готово. Все всегда очень вкусно! Я была на кухне- там идеальный порядок! Ежедневно работает порядка 10 поваров! Все делают из под ножа, даже всю выпечку выпекают сами.
За 14 дней ни разу ни у кого не было никаких проблем с пищеварением! 
Остроту адаптировали под нас, реагировали всегда на все просьбы. 

Детям: Есть аквапарк и детский клуб, приходили иногда, но больше нравилось резвиться на волнах. 
На территории видели бурундуков, птиц, под деревом у виллы жило семейство, кажется, мангустов. Видели их перебежки несколько раз. 
Мы спросили о возможности организовать детям кулинарный МК. Сказали, что детям еще не проводили, но сделают. И нам любезно организовал Шеф приготовление нудлс и крамблс кукис. Шеф- красавчик!

Менеджмент. MR. Sujeewa каждый раз подходил, спрашивал все ли у нас хорошо, есть ли комментарии. На 29 «номеров» 62 человека персонала!!! Из них 10 человек, которые постоянно проводят тренинги для персонала. Ну какие же все улыбчивые любезные! Везде открывают двери, помогают с коляской.

Что нужно знать. Если что-то не по вашему убрано или что-то нужно, говорите! Устраняют МГНОВЕННО. Постоянно радовали комплиментарными бонусами. 

Вот сюда по-настоящему хочется вернуться!
Спасибо всем персоналу, менеджменту и собственнику за высокие душевный отпуск, облаченный в высокие стандарты❤️
title: «Мама, я не хочу у��зжать из этого отеля!»

When you come to Sri Lanka it is usually late, so you can either do a long drive south or go to Colombo or Negumbo. On this occasion we chose Negumbo. There is a strip of hotels in the main road of the town which houses some very nice hotels.
This time I chose Wattura, a little bit further and so worth it.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your fantastic review! We're thrilled to hear that our team provided such exceptional service and made your dining experience memorable. We're also glad you enjoyed the comfort of your room and the Bungalow history. We appreciate your feedback about the location Hope to welcome you back soon
Warm regards Scottish Planter Glendevon Bungalow
placeInfo/address: Kandapola Road, Sooriyakanda 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We were planning for a stay in this bungalow for long time and finally got a chance to go there. Our crew consisted of 6 adults and 4 kids. The booking process was smooth, and I did it online. They have a functional web site and are very responsive with the phone.

Location
It's located inside a tea state in Ragala area closer to Sooriyakanda surrounded by misty hills and cold weather enclosed in a beautiful garden. Getting there is relatively easy and there is only a few hundred meters of road which is unpaved so most of the vehicles can negotiate it. Only large vehicles with very low ground clearance will have problems. We got through with a Mitsubishi Delica and a Suzuki WagonR (For ground clearance reference). The hotel offers transport from the main road in needed and parking is also available in such situation.

The Bungalow 
It's an old tea plantation bungalow converted to a boutique hotel. Originally built in 1880s by Scottish planters who came here. The bungalow remains most of its original glory including raised wooden floor, old furniture, working fireplaces etc… The surroundings are very quiet. The sitting area had a small library with various types of books and magazines. Some of the books are from the colonial era. And everything seems to be maintained very nicely and very cleanly.

Welcome
We received a warm welcome by the manger and the crew and were greeted with fresh flower bouquets. Afterwards we received tea which is produced in the surrounding tea plantation. Tea was infused with natural ginger and served with tasty kithul jaggery. It was nice welcome drink for the cold weather.

Accommodation
We booked three rooms which are Steuart-Suite (Family room with queen size bed and two single beds), Crawford (Tripple room with queen size bed and a single bed) and Macnaugton (Double room with two single beds). The family room and the triple room were extremely spacious. The double room was on the smaller side but adequately spacious. All rooms were nicely furnished and beds had canopies too. All of them had electric heaters. Tea making facility was not available in the room, but the staff attended to all of our tea & coffee requests promptly. Bathrooms were clean & spacious, and all the toiletries were available. Most of the rooms had quick access to the garden which was nice. Beds were very comfy and slept like logs in the night. 

Food
We made our booking on full board basis, so we stayed for all three meals. All meals had three courses. Primarily they offered a western menu, but they were ready to prepare any day-to-day foods within their ability. All foods were made to order. During the dinner we had an excellent garden salad which had lots of ingredients from the chef’s garden. The cream of mushroom soup was tasty and rich. I had a chicken dish as the main which was great. The sauce used was unique one by the chef which uses local oranges from a tree next to the bungalow. I loved it. Some of our group got pasta and fried rice which had unique flavors. For dessert I had coconut cake with ice cream. The coconut cake was unique, and it wasn’t the one I am familiar with but tasted nice. For breakfast most of us had western cuisine. It was fine. For lunch we all had biriyani. The soup was pumpkin with cumin garnished with chili oil. It was the first time I had it, and it was very nice. There was a strong cumin taste on top of the roasted pumpkin. Loved it. Biriyani was very nice too. Usually, I don’t like Biriyani much, but this was good. The fried chicken came with it was also tasty. The sauce they used on top of the chicken tasted nice too. For dessert we got orange curd cake. We all loved it. Even though it’s made of curd it looked like a cheesecake. 

Service
We received excellent service from the hotel staff. The staff were extremely friendly and quite happy to respond to our requests. The two families joined for this had their anniversary, so we thought of having two cakes at the dinner as a surprise for them. The hotel staff fulfilled it in very short notice, resulting in a truly memorable occasion. All the aspects of the service included a personnel touch which conveyed a homely feeling. Even though we stayed for one night we were so familiar with the staff by the dinner. We all loved the great service from the friendly staff.

Experience
Apart from the nice service of the friendly staff, freshly cooked tasty food, comfy rooms and the nice library there are a few other things to experience. The garden is very nice and there are many places to sit and relax to have fresh air. It’s large enough to play with you kids, which we did. We also had a stroll in the tea plantation which was nice. There are few excursions available, but we didn’t have time or plan for them. There is also a game room in the bungalow which has a mini pool table. We had a good time with it. Apart from that carrom, checkers were also available. The chef who cooked us very nice meals offered a tour to his garden which consisted of leafy greens, lots of western herbs, some local herbs and veggies. Almost all the foods had something from this garden. We also got the glimpse of the orange tree which he made a sauce out of its fruits the night before.

Overall, we loved the stay at the bungalow. It's an excellent place for families or a small group of friends to have a relaxing time experiencing great hospitality with homely touch.
title: Comfy stay and great hospitality with homely touch...

Dear Guest,
Thank you so much for taking the time to share your positive review of your stay at The Scottish planter Glendevon Bungalow. We are thrilled to hear that you had such a wonderful time, and we truly appreciate your kind words. placeInfo/address: Kandapola Road, Sooriyakanda 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Scottish Planter – Glendevon Bungalow from April 22–24, 2025, and it was truly one of a kind. Nestled in the tranquil hills of Ragala, this heritage bungalow dating back to 1880 welcomed us with warmth, serenity, and unmatched hospitality.

After a long 16-hour journey with my infant son, wife, and mother, we arrived at 10:30 PM — yet everything was perfectly arranged for us, thanks to Manusanka, the ever-gracious property manager. From coordinating a pick-up van for the 1.2 km off-road trail to ensuring we had everything we needed upon arrival, his care made us feel right at home.

The bungalow itself is a living piece of history — impeccably maintained, tastefully appointed, and surrounded by lush greenery, landscaped gardens, and the peaceful sounds of nature. The set-course meals were absolutely delicious — every dish was prepared with love and left us wanting more.

A special thank you to Kapila, who attended to us throughout our stay with kindness and attentiveness. Whether it was adjusting breakfast to suit our preferences or ensuring we had everything we needed, he truly made a difference.

This is a remote getaway, and that’s exactly its charm. Birdsong by day, starry skies by night, and the pure stillness of nature all around — it’s a place to disconnect and truly rejuvenate.

We’re grateful for the experience and look forward to returning again.
Thank you, Manusanka, for your incredible hospitality — and for the lovely conversations we’ll always remember.
Wishing you and the entire Scottish Planter Bungalow team all the very best!
title: A Timeless Retreat in the Hills of Ragala - Where Heritage Meets Heartfelt Hospitality

text: Charming historical house with exceptional staff and haute cuisine meals. We just had one night here but we really enjoyed our stay. The manor only has 4 rooms, ours was huge. The house is 125 years old and drafty. We wore our sweatshirts and the staff had fires in the dining hall and sitting room to keep things cozy. Wifi is only available in that one room and it is spotty.  There is no television. When the staff is cooking,  the power frequently goes out and it is totally dark in the rooms at that point.  But they quickly reset the breakers. We considered the quirks part of the charm. Our dinner and breakfast were the best meals we had in Sri Lanka. The only negative for us was the location.  It was an hour drive from Nurwala eliya and after a very long day we didn't want an additional hour drive time. Once we saw the place, we were glad that we had chosen this B&B. The staff was incredibly attentive and clearly took pride in the manor and in providing the best guest experience.
title: Charming historical manor with incredible staff.

First of all, manager, Manusanka and crew at Scottish Planter Glendevon Bungalow are amazing. We stayed 3 nights. My mom and dad were not feeling well when we got to the bungalow. I was so worried and nervous about the situation. Team was very supportive and they went above and beyond making us feel home and prepared meals according to our requests and it helped my parents to feel better quickly. Mr. Manusanka reassured me that if there is any emergency let them know even if its late night they will be there to help us. Luckily my parents were feeling better the next day and we had a relaxing time there. Team is very kind and compassionate. 

The location is best to relax and unwind. They have a well maintained vegetable garden. Some juices and meals were prepared from freshly plucked vegetables and fruits from the garden. Chef Bandula prepares incredible dishes. There's a unique taste and variety in the dishes. The taste of the food ignite burst of flavors yet well balanced. One of my favorites is a garden salad he prepares. 

I am thankful for their great hospitality. We highly recommend the Scottish Planter Buglalow. Also, we will definitely visit the place again.
title: Wonderful time at Scottish Planter Bungalow!

text:
Our experience at Scottish planters was incredible.. we stayed there for 2 nights and it was never enough.. it's a lovely bungalow situated in the middle of a tea estate with marvellous views. On top of it we also got a free upgrade to the steuart suite..we were staying on a half board basis and the food was really amazing, Bandula the chef was at his best in the taste and the presentation of the food..my 3 and 8 year olds really loved it..we had western dishes most of the time and requested for a proper Sri Lanka breakfast on the last day and it was truly delicious.. Manusanka and his team were really helpful from the beginning, even before we arrived at the bungalow and made sure that we were comfortable during our stay there and did everything they could to keep the kids occupied and happy.. the best thing about the staff there is they are really taking efforts to make their guests happy..

If you want to take a break from the busy life and stay in a quieter place I would strongly recommend Scottish planters..it's really good for family getaways where you can book the whole bungalow and relax..will definitely come again..
title: Incredible experience at Scottish planters..

Incredible experience and stay at this hotel - great rooms and overall ambience.

title: Fantastic Hotel with Lots of Charm

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82614 Sri Lanka
text:
My friend and I had the absolute pleasure of staying at Cinnamon Wild Yala from June 16th to 18th, and from the moment we arrived, it was an unforgettable experience.

Check-in was a breeze—smooth, welcoming, and full of warm smiles that instantly made us feel at home. Throughout our stay, the staff were consistently friendly, professional, and genuinely helpful. A heartfelt thank you to Devin, Shashika, Pubudu, Sandaruwan, Divya, Ishani, Roshani, and Sandushi – your hospitality was truly exceptional and made our stay so memorable. Keep up the amazing work!

Our room was spacious, spotless, and very comfortable. The housekeeping team was fantastic—always cheerful and ready to help with anything we needed. We especially loved the cozy beds, the reliable hot and cold water, the well-stocked minibar, and all the little thoughtful touches that made a big difference.

One of the best parts of our trip was just being surrounded by nature. Waking up to birdsong and spotting animals like squirrels, rabbits, crocodiles, deer, and even buffalo right around the property was magical. It really felt like we were part of the wild, in the best way possible.

A highlight for us was definitely the “Crocodile Day” event organized by the Nature Trails team. It was such a well-run and engaging session—complete with snacks, drinks, and fascinating info. Huge thanks to Rohan and the entire Nature Trails crew for making it such a fun and educational experience. We learned so much and really appreciated the effort that went into it.

The food at Cinnamon Wild deserves its own shoutout. Every meal was a treat, thanks to Chef Nandana Perera, Sachini, and the entire kitchen team. Everything was so delicious—we were seriously spoiled!

Special thanks to Sahan, the F&B Manager, and the amazing restaurant team: Himanshi, Champika, Heshan, Ishan, Danushka, and Umesh. And a big thank you to Himal, the Chief Steward, for being so kind and supportive.

All in all, we couldn’t have asked for a better getaway. I’d highly recommend Cinnamon Wild Yala to anyone heading to Yala. It’s a truly special place, and we’d absolutely love to come back again in near future.
title: Hospitality That Went Above and Beyond!

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82614 Sri Lanka
text: We had an amazing time at Cinnamon Wild Yala and would highly recommend staying here if you are visiting the national park! This was our first experience of a safari and staying in this hotel really feels as though you are at one with nature! The staff were delightful and so helpful. The food in the buffet restaurant was delicious and the small rooftop bar was a great place to see the sunset over the park. The hotel celebrated World Crocodile Day whilst we were there and the team put on a fabulous celebration to educate us and celebrate with crocodile themed refreshments. The room that we stayed in was rustic and felt authentic to the surroundings- perfect for what we were after. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and it was a brilliant end to our Sri Lanka trip!
title: Authentic stay in Yala National Park

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Avinath,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

Thank you so much for your kind and detailed review. We’re absolutely thrilled to hear that your stay in our Beach Suite was such a memorable and relaxing experience, and that you enjoyed the seamless check-in and checkout process. I’ll be sure to pass along your appreciation to Mr. Akash and Mr. Bandula for their excellent service.

It’s especially heartening to hear your compliments about our restaurant team – Sameera, Omesha, and the entire team will be delighted to know they made you feel so well looked after. And of course, Mr. Amar will be very proud to hear how much his cocktails added to your evenings – I’ll make sure he takes that well-deserved bow!

At the same time, I sincerely regret the discomfort caused by the unexpected presence of cockroaches in your room. Please accept our heartfelt apologies, especially knowing of your wife’s katsaridaphobia. While we maintain a rigorous pest control program, your feedback highlights the need for further enhancement in this area, and we are already taking immediate steps to address it more effectively.

Thank you again for choosing Cinnamon Wild Yala. It was a pleasure to have you with us, and we’re truly honored to know you plan on returning. We look forward to welcoming you back for another exceptional experience—this time, even better in every way.

Yours sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan
Resort Manager
Cinnamon Wild Yala

roomTip:
1 Sea too rough for a dip during off-season check before planning to swim

3 Follow safety protocols strictly
text:
We had a truly memorable stay! The Beach Suite was beautiful and well-appointed, offering a relaxing and luxurious experience. Check-in and checkout were smooth and efficient special thanks to Mr. Akash and Mr. Bandula for making everything seamless.

The restaurant was absolutely fabulous. The food was delicious, and the service was outstanding. Sameera, Omesha, and the rest of the restaurant staff attended to every detail and made us feel so well cared for.

And last but not least ; take a bow, Mr. Amar! The cocktails were simply fantastic and added something extra special to our evenings.

The only downside was that we encountered a few cockroaches in the room during our stay. My wife has katsaridaphobia (a strong fear of cockroaches), so this did cause some distress. We hope this can be improved with enhanced pest control, as everything else was truly wonderful.

We’ll definitely be coming back, it was a great experience from start to finish.
title: A Perfect Blend of Wilderness and Indulgence

placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82614 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take a full day safari and stay half board basis
text: Gorgeous hotel location and staff. Spent 2 nights in order to go for safari in yalla national park. The hotel is first rate and the cabana very luxurious with rain forest showers huge beds great mini bar etc, the main complex consists of a open air but with roof bar where you can get every drink you can imagine and some lunch type snacks along with a more robust bar dinner all reasonably priced. The pool is large and pool towels provided. The roof top restaurant is buffet style for breakfast and dinner. I would state there’s something for everyone be aware there is no where else to go so we opted for half board which was perfect for us as breakfast and dinner. The staff are amazing and it all feels very special. While we were there an elephant roamed into the lake right next to the pool and bar area and seemed to enjoy the vegetation and the attention.  We went for a full day safari in yalla national park and we booked through the yalla national park web site page but the hotel runs trips also we would recommend a full day safari if you can we saw leopard’s elephant crocodile almost everything on the list plus lots of other animals it’s literally dripping in animals and really good fun.
title: World class stay beautiful location wonderful staff

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
I travelled to Sri Lanka on a small group tour with Intrepid and this was my first real introduction to Sri Lankan and their wonderful hospitality.

The hotel is big but it manages to keep a very personal approach to the clientele and, as with most of Sri Lanka, you are greeted by friendly staff with huge smiles!!  Our group were accommodated in rooms away from the main building which are spacious and well equipped.  Because some of them are quite a walk from the main building there is a fabulous service where you are taken to and collected from your room.  The walk  to the rooms is a pleasant one past the lake and through the trees where you will see many birds and small animals but after a long day sightseeing the lift to your room is very welcome!!

I was  unwell one day and stayed at the hotel and was visited 4 times (!!!) by 2 different doctors.  The attention I had was amazing.  After leaving the hotel I had messages from the female doctor, Iranga, asking if I was better and enjoying my holiday.  The Reception Manager, Imalka, who always came to the room to see me with the doctor, also text me during the rest of my trip to ask if I was ok and enjoying the trip.  Amazing and thank you to them both!!!!  Your kindness will never be forgotten.

Rooms were serviced well, the food was good, the location was stunning and very convenient for visiting all the various sights in the area and all the staff were truly exceptional.  

Thank you Jetwing Lake for a great stay.
title: Great place to stay with amazing staff!!

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Koggala 80000 Sri Lanka
text: After staying in the hill country for a couple, of weeks, we spent the final week of our holiday at the Fortress Resort & Spa on the coast at Koggala.  This is an excellent resort, where the friendly staff provide exceptional service.  Although the hotel advertises that it has three restaurants, most guests had dinner in Whites, the main restaurant, which has an extensive a la carte menu, as well as a daily menu with a smaller number of dishes for those like us who were on half board.  The food was of the highest quality, and as always when we are in Sri Lanka, we mostly ate the local dishes.  Although we have visited the country many times, and enjoyed countless rice and curry dinners, we were delighted to be served some vegetable curries here that we had not previously encountered.  The open sided bar is a good place to have a drink while watching the sun set.  In the day, time can be spent relaxing on a sun lounger, keeping an eye open for the turtles that come at high tide, but there are also many interesting things to do in the vicinity.   Just across the road is an interesting cultural museum dedicated to the work of the writer Martin Wickramasinghe, that includes exhibits related to rural life in Sri Lanka, and a very restful Buddhist temple within walking distance on an island in the nearby Koggala lake. We like using local transport and took the train or bus to both Galle and Weligama, both within half an hour of the hotel.  The excellent service and the beautiful surroundings make this an ideal resort to spend time enjoying Sri Lankan hospitality at its best.
title: A beautiful resort near Galle
