placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Koggala 80000 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at the Fortress for a week after a week exploring Sri Lanka and what a bit of paradise it was. Our room was a beach room and it opened up onto the pool with the beach just beyond. I loved being able to open the patio doors and having sun loungers just there. The pool staff were phenomenal, they saw you before you even had a chance to look for them and arranged the loungers exactly how and where you prefer. The restaurant was brilliant, Samantha and the team really made us feel welcome and greeted us everyday by our names. We ate in White most days but tried out the teppanyaki (brilliant) as well as the restaurant in the wine cellar - Duo. All the food was superb and there’s a wide choice, the Sri Lankan food was super tasty. There is a buffet on Saturdays which guests, not in the hotel, come to so that should show how good it is but they’re willing to cook you anything should you not want the buffet. My husband and I both had spa treatments which we enjoyed, the spa itself is a little dated and it backs onto the main road so you can hear horns beeping whilst having your treatment which was, sadly, not very relaxing. The only other odd and slightly negative thing was in the afternoon whilst by the pool a large number of crows always appeared trying to drink from the pool. The team did attempt to get rid of them but used a sonar detector which omitted a very high pitched noise and didn’t deter the crows - again not very relaxing. That wouldn’t stop us going back, it was one of the most relaxing hotels I’ve been to in a long time. Galle is about 30mins away and the hotel can arrange transport for you. If you like to go in the sea then be warned it’s very rough outside the hotel, we attempted a couple of times but the current is very strong. There were a large number of trainees either serving by the pool, in the bar or in the restaurant - all of them excellent. As well as Samantha, I would like to mention Sashan who looked after our drinks orders night and day! We will definitely be back
title: Fabulous hotel and brilliant staff

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Koggala 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
This was one of the first hotels we stayed in on our two week visit to beautiful Sri Lanka.  Everything suited us perfectly.  We had a suite on the ground floor (room 06) which was a few metres from the most fantastic pool.  The rooms were clean, large and well thought out.  The shower was superb as were the shampoos and body products.  We loved the easiness of being able to access the room from the pool.  This hotel only being 50 rooms, there were enough people to create a nice atmosphere but everything (spa, gym and restaurant were within such close proximity.  

It’s extremely well maintained and so very friendly and personable.  Every single member of staff, from chefs (yes we were given a tour of the kitchens of which they are rightly proud!) to the pool staff were just amazing, although I have to say that all Sri Lankans both inside and outside the hotel are delightful and obliging people.  This hotel has 450 full time staff….yes thats a ratio of 4.5 members of staff to every guest so that gives you a clue as to the attention you receive at The Fortress.  At this point I need to highlight ‘Sam’ one of the restaurant managers and ‘Weena’, one of the spa therapists who both went above and beyond, but in all honestly they were all fantastic.

The food was exceptional, both breakfast and dinner (the buffet on a Saturday night is not to be missed)!!  Again service was second to none.

On a very small negative note, the spa could definately upgrade their products (they don’t do gel nails, which may sound minor to any men reading this, but as I’d broken two nails on second day into my holiday it was a right nuisance)!!  I also think they are missing. a trick not having lovely ayuredivic products for sale despite them having a wall of glass display cabinets in the spa with nothing in!  People love to take a few presents and momentos back home with them  and myself and my cousin would love to have purchased gifts  but apart from the little boutique shop which was unfortunately not particularly exciting with nothing desiresble in there (personally I’d close it or completely start again and make it more upmarket ) there was nothing I wanted to bring back home.  As I said these are very minor points and the massages far outweighed the fact they didn’t sell products.

During the course of our two weeks we stayed in four different five star establishments and all very different in their own unique style (the KK Beach, The Galle Face and the kahanda kanda) but for overall  quality, service, food, pool, beach and value for money it is The Fortress hotel and spa that we will be booking for this time next year.  Thank you for making our holiday a truly memorable one….in spite of the copious amounts of rain!!!
title: Great start to our holiday at The Fortress

placeInfo/address: Polkanda Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tabula Rasa Resort & Spa, A Slh Hotel
text: Few places are as beautiful in person as in their photos, fewer still surpass the majesty of their public images. Tabula Rasa takes your breath away from the moment you arrive and take in the sweeping view. I could hardly speak above a whisper I was in such awe. And then the views from the private villas, and every little detail in the rooms themselves. I felt like I’d arrived home, at the home of my dreams and also in a good friend’s living room. I felt filled with gratitude to be a guest. I came to be nestled in nature, with a higher view for perspective, and to turn my phone completely off to access something within beyond the outer din. I’ve lived half-time in Sri Lanka for nearly 7 years and have traveled all over to nature-inspired boutique luxury hotels on the island seeking peaceful connection with place and self. Tabula Rasa has been on my list since 2021, and while it’s only 20 minutes from home, it took a few years to visit. And I’m so glad I did, and perfect serendipitous timing. The view from here is so unique, a perspective I have not experienced in Sri Lanka before where the main road and all houses in between disappear, and there are only sloping treetops, as if nothing else exists except you, nature, your private view, and luxurious little villa. And if you’ve been waiting to write a book…the writer’s desk has the most inspiring vantage point. I could go in about how well maintained the property is, even in green season, or the views, the delicious and creative food…and the caring staff. A team that you know from interacting with them that they are well cared for, and care well for you the guest in turn. Everything was exceptional. A special thanks to Thilina, Dilshan, and Nuwan for making my stay exquisite.
title: Agape in wonder and delight, surprise and awe

ownerResponse/text:

It was so lovely having you at our nature retreat. We are glad to learn that you enjoyed all the quiet luxuries. Our team would be delighted to hear about it too. 

Until we meet again!

Sunny regards.

Dilin Peiris.

placeInfo/name: Tabula Rasa Resort & Spa, A Slh Hotel
roomTip: Bed is hard (as all beds in SL -- as they dont usually use spring beds).  Make sure you have transportation or use PickMe app,
text: Beautiful resort a few km's away from Galle.   The resort is up a narrow road which comes with a few advantages -- including an incredible setting to watch the sunsets from your private plunge pool.  The hotel rooms provide high end binoculars -- so you can watch the monkeys in the forest & the birds.  Rooms are well appointed with everything you need (fridge, coffee tea, sofa, lounging bed, desk, cupboard etc) bathroom is huge with all the necessities. The plunge rooms are small individual cabanas, ours was not far from the main lobby.    We loved the breakfast & dinners, course be ready for limited wine choice (Sri Lanka problem), though we were able to find good wine in Galle (restaurant owners of Aqua -- Italian guys -- with welcome list of great wines).   We also had a massage (by Nawan) who was fantastic.  I had a foot & leg massage and Shell had a full body.  We loved it, he was professional and am amazing masseur.   Note, if you want to go to the beach or beach restaurants, just order up a tuk tuk if you dont have a driver. its not far, but you cant really walk.  The plunge pool itself was deep (and cold) and beautiful.  Lots of room around the pool too to lay around or sit.   The hotel's main pool is also lovely with an amazing view of the forest and beaches.
title: Tabula Rasa - welcome luxury

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Karel S,

Dilin Peiris.
placeInfo/address: Polkanda Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tabula Rasa Resort & Spa, A Slh Hotel
text:
With only 24 rooms this is really a place you must visit.

A steep drive brings you to the gate of this hotel, nestled in the jungle of Sri Lanka with a jaw dropping view at the infinity pool. 

We were upgraded from a Villa to a Pool Villa, thanks to our HH Gold status. Do reach out to the hotel to receive very good rates and deals! Our room was spacious and could sleep all of our 3 kids. The bathroom was modern and fully equipped with amenities. The master bed was foreseen of a mosquito net, aswell as a mosquite spray (keep windows closed, especially after rain to avoid them).

The patio had 2 sunloungers, a table and a small plungepool. This was ideal to spot the monkey family in the trees, not far from the room.  During our 2 nights we encountered heavy rain and thunder, but skies cleared up in the morning.

Awakened by monkey's on the roof we headed out for breakfast, which was a la carte. Choices and portions were great and service was quick. Small note: paper napkins gives the hotel a cheap look, i would replace them with linnen, as they do for dinner.

We used the main pool once as most of the day we were out exploring.

Dinner is also available and nicely presented, altough staff should refrain to clear plates whenever others are still eating (etiquette). 

Overall, a good choice whenever you are close to Galle and the hotel and room has all you need.
title: Nestled on a jungle hill with an endless view

placeInfo/address: Polkanda Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tabula Rasa Resort & Spa, A Slh Hotel
roomTip: There are 2 routes to the hotel, one a tight twisting track and the other a wider road. If you’ve struggle via one route try the other.
text:
Room:
We had booked a standard room but we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a beautiful villa with a balcony and plunge pool. 

The room was immaculate and very tastefully decorated. The views down to the coast was very impressive and we spent many hours on the balcony listening to the sounds of the jungle and watching passing troops of monkeys. 

Activities and excursions:
On our first day we took a Tuk Tuk to Galle Fort. The journey took around about 25 minutes (priced at 5000 rupees return, with the driver waiting for us whilst we wondered around the fort.

We spent a day in Weligama having travelled there by train from Habaraduwa station. The trip took around about 20 minutes (cost 40 rupees). The main reason for this particular activity was that we wanted to experience a Sri Lankan train journey and this fitted the bill perfect (for a couple who are a bit too long in the tooth for lengthy backpacking style train journeys).

During the rest of our time we visited a local tea plantation and went Whale watching both of which we would recommend.

Facilities at hotel:
At the hotel itself we made use of the pool, spa and yoga master. 

Though the Spa is a little more expensive than a local spa, the hotel’s services were excellent and well worth the money (I should say that the price was considerably cheaper than UK equivalents).

Restaurant:
The restaurant (‘The Dutch’) was excellent and served a range of Sri Lankan inspired high end European dishes. There was an extensive cocktail menu with most drink priced at around $6.

Location:
Though I had been a little worried that the location of the hotel may be a little remote, it transpired that the hotel was perfectly situated to allow for rest and relaxation in a jungle setting whilst only being 15 minutes walk to the local town. 

In our 5 days here we found plenty of activities and it was a great base for exploring this beautiful section of the Sri Lankan coast.

Summary:
All in all we had a wonderful time and would return in a heartbeat. The setting is beautiful and the staff could not be more helpful or accommodating.
title: Fantastic jungle retreat

text: A magical stay at Tabula Rasa to relax and reset. The setting overlooking the coast and yet in the jungle is very unique. You are tucked away yet 10 minutes to villages, beaches and restaurants. Manoj was a very friendly and fun Tuk Tuk driver and our mission was to find great beach sunsets every night! The food was good at the hotel, bedroom very comfortable and the staff couldn’t have been more helpful. The not to be missed highlight was a tour of a Hidden Buddhist Temple, hand painted  inside over 3 yrs by Nuwan an Artist depicting Buddhas stories in wonderful colours. Very memorable and  so wonderfully peaceful there. Also they have great massages.
title: Tabula Rasa - Great stay

Dear Artymarie,

Thank you for your wonderful and detailed review! 

We are delighted to hear that your 8-night stay with us was unforgettable. It’s fantastic to know that our team and services, including the Ayurvedic spa treatments and our dedicated massage therapist, exceeded your expectations.

We are thrilled that you enjoyed the quality of our food, from the divine breakfast to the à la carte options at our main restaurant. It means a lot to us that we were able to provide you with an exceptional dining experience, as we always strive to offer the best to our guests.

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Koggala 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Nous venons de séjourner 8 nuits dans ce fabuleux hôtel, l’ensemble du personnel est absolument fantastique.
Les traitements au Spa sont de très grande qualité et adaptés à vos besoins selon les recommandations d’une Dr Ayurvedique si vous le souhaitez. 
J’ai bénéficié des soins d’une adorable masseuse à plusieurs reprises. C’est quelque chose que je fais très rarement, je n’aime généralement pas ça, mais ses traitements vont définitivement me manquer! 
Nous avons souvent voyagé et même dans les hôtels dits de luxe, la qualité de la restauration est souvent catastrophique. Ce n’est pas le cas ici, le petit déjeuner est divin, et le restaurant principal est vraiment délicieux, nous avons testé plusieurs plats à la carte et n’avons jamais été déçus. 
Tout est d’une grande propreté. 
L’hôtel était, pour nous, idéalement placé à proximité des plages de surf et non loin de Galle, Unawatuna, Kabalana, Ahangama et autres villages où nous pouvions nous rendre très facilement en tuk tuk. 
La plage a gauche de l’hôtel est paradisiaque pour s’y promener et s’y baigner. 
Le petit déjeuner, les massages me manquent déjà et je n’ai qu’une hâte, y revenir en famille. 
Merci à tous 🙏🏼
title: Un séjour inoubliable

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Carl & Emma,

Thank you so much for your incredibly kind and detailed review. We are absolutely delighted to hear that your 15-night stay with us over Christmas and New Year was so special. It warms our hearts to know that you had such a memorable time in Sri Lanka, and we are honored that you chose The Fortress Hotel and Spa to be a part of your holiday.

It’s wonderful to hear that the Loft Suite, with its incredible views and comfort, exceeded your expectations. 

We are glad you enjoyed our hotel's many features, from the delicious breakfast to the infinity pool and everything in between. Your compliments about our team mean the world to us, and we will be sure to pass along your thanks to Subash, Ashintha, Chamindi, and the rest of the staff who made your stay memorable.

It was a pleasure to have you with us for such a special time, and we are happy to know that we could be part of your holiday celebrations, including the Christmas, and New Year’s events also the Pirith ceremony on the 1st of January.

Thank you again for your thoughtful review, and we sincerely hope to welcome you back in the future. 

We are The Fortress Family will always be here to provide you with more unforgettable memories.

With best wishes!
placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Koggala 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Go with the flow - always smile and respect your hosts
Say hi to the Bar Guys ............................
text:
We had 15 nights in The Fortress and Spa for Christmas 24 and into New Year 25.
The most wonderful time at the most wonderful time of year.
The views as you walk through the enormous wooden gates are fantastic.
Beautiful hotel, fabulous food, amazing staff, brilliant atmosphere, the superlatives dont even come close to describing reality.
We stayed in an Ocean Loft Suite - a treat to ourselves as it had a few extras and we had a patio as well as a balcony, but all the rooms were amazing. Our bed was the most comfortable we had ever had in a hotel - and I mean that !!!
Each night our bed was turned down but I insisted on opening the blinds - if I woke up I could still see and hear the sea from our bed.
We stayed on an all inclusive package - we had everything we could possibly wish for. Each day breakfast was a mix of English, continental, fresh fruit, traditional Sri Lankan, delicious local breads, with hot stations serving waffles (if thats your thing), eggs cooked to order, but my favourite, Hoppers and Egg Hoppers.
The infinity pool was brilliant, never too busy, and with views out into the waves.
The staff around the pool were amazing - nothing was too much trouble and we always enjoyed sharing family stories with the team.
We rarely had lunch (breakfast was too amazing).
Evenings started with a cocktail followed by the most amazing dinner fare. Sri Lankan, soup, salads, sushi, anti pasti, seafood cocktails and a grill station with the most mazing seafood. Wonderful wines - the list goes on.
Outside the hotel, the traffic had a beautiful chaos about it - pedestrians and cyclists alongside Tuk-Tuks, cars, trucks and buses - oh the buses challenging tuk tuks to that space ahead but with respect from both sides - we should adopt that attitude in the UK.
We had a list of experiences before we arrived and the hotel staff helped us achieve everything we had wished for - and a whole lot more.
Our sincere thanks to our drivers Subash and Ashintha.
Udawalewe National Park with our friend Subash. A fantastic day with elephants.
On Christmas Eve we had a walk around Galle Fort, Lion Beer in The Ivy, then back at the hotel we saw Santa who presented gifts to all the children before an amazing gala dinner.
Our Christmas Day was wonderful - after breakfast we walked along the amazing beach from the hotel - almost nobody on the beach. We visited the turtle sanctuary - baby turtles seem so helpless.....
Boxing Day was the 20th anniversary of the devastating tsunami and we were humbled to visit the tsunami memorial and statue at Hikkaduwa with our driver Ashintha. We shed many tears for the people of Sri Lanka.
The next day was an early start with Subash as we went to Ella via 9 arch bridge. Then a train ride from Ella to Bandarawela in an open carriage, then onto Liptons seat and ending the day hiking to and swimming in the pools at Upper Diyaluma Falls - an absolutely wonderful day.
Our next adventure was whale watching - wow. A speed boat out to the whales, we saw a Blue whale and mum and baby Fin whales. After we  fished from the boat and caught a tuna!! We walked from Mirissa harbour along the beach towards Coconut Hill - the perfect end to a perfect day.
Next adventure was a boat trip on Kogalla lake - what a fantastic experience. We saw crocodiles, beautiful birds, the biggest monitor lizard we have ever seen and we fed fruit to monkeys.
New Years Eve was a wonderful gala with amazing food, a band and superb fireworks on the beach and on New Years Day we were honoured to take part in the Buddhist New Year blessing - THANK YOU.
Our last trip was to Sigiriya - an amazing place with amazing views.
Our most humble thanks to Subash, Ashintha and all the staff at The Fortress Hotel and Spa. Too many to name individually but you gave us so much pleasure and fun - you know who you are.
My special thanks to the Bar Team - I hope I brought some fun to evenings.
Above all else our special thanks to a wonderful lady - Chamindi, you made our stay so perfect - thank you so so much to you.
THANK YOU - we hope we can visit again in the future and to anyone reading this review - Sri Lanka is beautiful, the people of Sri Lanka are beautiful - need I say more.
Love to everyone at the Fortress Hotel and Spa
Carl & Emma
title: The most fantastic holiday in the most amazing hotel in the most beautiful country !

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued guest,

I have come here with my family and am struck by this breathtaking hotel. It is a beautiful hotel, quaint yet grand. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean, the pool so inviting and the beach boasts of crystal clear waters with rich marine life teeming! The food is delicious and the service is impeccable. 

There was a slight issue we had with the renovation works. The hotel took cognisance of our concerns and extended the best possible help to us for which we are thankful. My brother in law celebrated his anniversary here and we couldn’t have asked for better! 

A shout out to Mr Jinendra, Mr Tihillan, Mr Samantha, Masha, Amasha, Kavisha, Ms Gayani, Mr Lakshsiri the lifeguard, Ms Chamindi and the chefs and staff of the hotel. Menal for a lovely spa treatment and the lovely housekeeping staff! Hope to visit soon again! Thank you Forest Resort & Spa!

text:
5* all the way!  One of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World and so it is. What an amazing hotel! Once those huge doors of the hotel open and you enter the grounds the first thing you see is the view of the ocean and beautifully Dutch inspired architecture.

Greeted with a smile, welcome drink on arrival, smooth check-in. 

Absolutely stunning property with well appointed rooms. All rooms except The Fortress rooms overlook the ocean. We had the Ocean room and Beach room. Bathrooms well lit and plenty of space. His and her sinks, large shower and jacuzzi bath tub. Choice of pillows options too.. sheer luxury!

Food is of top quality. Chef Asela made sure of that and that our dietary requirements were met… vegan, veg and non veg.All the dishes were excellent and tasty.

Breakfast catered for all palates. A good selection to choose from. There was variety of fruit juices ,curries, Continental food,breads, pastries,omelettes, Hoppers, Sri Lankan dishes …very spoilt for choice.

Management, especially Nadeesha made our stay so comfortable. Always greeted us with a huge welcoming smile.Nothing was too much for her.All our concerns were addressed.

The property itself is very well maintained. Pool is beautiful as are the grounds.

During our stay we made such good friends with everyone that it felt like they were part of our family…it was sad to leave.

 In fact we liked it so much that my daughter and her Fiancée have decided to get married there this year!

A huge thank you to you all for making our stay very memorable and we’re looking forward to seeing you all again this year and making more wedding memories.
title: One of the best hotels I’ve stayed at

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Koggala 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our third stay at The Fortress Resort, and once again, it exceeded our expectations. We stayed in an Ocean Loft Suite, which was absolutely huge, spanning two floors and featuring a spacious indoor plunge pool. The addition of a dedicated butler made the experience even more special.

The room was incredibly spacious, well-lit, soundproofed, and equipped with all the amenities we needed. Although we encountered a minor issue with the electricals, the technical team promptly resolved it. The plunge pool was a highlight for us, with the water maintained slightly above ambient temperature—perfect for us and our child, who thoroughly enjoyed it too.

As always, the food was excellent. We opted for breakfast at the resort and tried in-room dining, which, though slightly more expensive than on our previous visits (likely due to exchange rates), was still worth it for the quality and convenience.

The service was impeccable, with attentive and helpful staff who made our visit truly memorable. This level of hospitality is what keeps bringing us back. The Fortress Resort remains the only place in Sri Lanka that we’ve visited multiple times—and it has consistently surpassed our expectations.

We can’t wait to return for another exceptional stay!
title: A Perfect Stay, Every Time: Our Favorite Sri Lankan Getaway

We stayed 5 nights in fortress and since our arrival the hospitality was top notch. The quality of the hotel facilities, food and room service is a 10/10!

The open buffet breakfast quality is super good and there are many varieties. The restaurant views are outstanding facing the pool and the ocean. One thing I truly admired about the hotel is the eagerness of the staff to make you feel happy and satisfied. We experienced an unforgettable honeymoon all thanks to this hotel! ❤️

Totally recommended for a couple getaway or a honeymoon destination.

text:
Stayed for 3 night in an ocean room.

This is was my second visit to the Fortress having stayed there in 2012/2013. I am pleased that the hotel has been so well maintained in general, although the rooms and bathrooms could do with a small amount of TLC to bring them back to their best, although they are still very good.

The staff are wonderful, and the food that we had whilst we stayed was good without being very good with the exception of the crab curry, which was excellent.

The atmosphere of the hotel is very serene and it is certainly aimed at the higher end of the market without ever feeling pretentious.

Hotel is highly recommended - the only downside I would see for some is that the beaches on either side of the hotel are not ideal for swimming, however the waves crashing against the rocks from the swimming pool as you sip on a cold Lion beer make up for this and then some.
title: Still a Great Hotel

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Koggala 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Im Fortress Hotel hat es uns sehr gut gefallen. Die Zimmer sehr großzügig und schön. Das Hotel hat einen tollen großen Pool mit wunderschönen Blick auf das Meer. Morgens kann man von dort die Stelzenfischer und Surfer sehen. Es gibt genug Liegen und Sonnenschirme und einen superguten Service am Pool. Überhaupt war das Personal in der gesamten Hotelanlage sehr freundlich, äußerst hilfsbereit und zuvorkommend. Zweimal habe ich im Wellnessbereich Yoga gebucht. Die Einzelstunden mit Priyantha waren sehr gut und wer Interesse an Yoga hat, ob Anfänger oder fortgeschritten, sollte ihn unbedingt buchen. Es lohnt sich und ich habe von den zwei Einzelstunden bei ihm sehr viel mitgenommen. Auch die Massage im Wellnessbereich war sehr gut. Das Frühstück war auch sehr lecker. Abends haben wir meist außerhalb gegessen. Dies war immer sehr gut und preiswert, aber etwas entfernt und da man an der Straße nicht gut laufen kann, sind wir immer mit Tuktuk gefahren. In der Nähe des Hotels gibt es leider nicht viele Restaurants und Shops. 
Es gibt einen kleinen Zugang zum Meer, aber da die Wellen und Strömung sehr groß war, konnte man dort nicht richtig baden. 
Ganz in der Nähe ist der schöne Kogalla Beach, der zu unserer Zeit leider auch starke Strömung hatte. Trotzdem herrlich zum spazieren. Alles in allem, wir können das Hotel sehr empfehlen !
title: Traumhafte Entspannung

roomTip: The location of the hotel is excellent. Check the room location for priivac.. Plenty of great restaurants nearby. Good breakfast selection.
text: We decided at short notice to stay on the South Coast of Sri Lanka and relax for a few days at the Fortress.  Our stay was exactly what we had planned and the hotel staff were excellent as were all the facilities. The restaurant was good and the resort is close to several beachside areas which had great little restaurants. We were in an entry level Fortress room which was large, clean and well serviced each day.  The only disappointment we had was being unable to have our curtains open due to the constant flow of staff talking loudly and walking right past our window and being able to see right into our room while we were changing, having a shower or just laying in bed at night. This was very surprising for a hotel of this quality and price and the lack of privacy should not be an issue even in an entry level room.  We would stay again but take care about the room selection.
title: A good stay.

placeInfo/address: Matara Road, Koggala 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir hatten eine unglaublich tolle Zeit in dem Luxus Resort in Koggalla. Die Zimmer sind sehr groß, sauber und schön eingerichtet, perfekt zum wohlfühlen und entspannen. Die direkte Strandlange ist top. Wir waren jeden Tag im Meer und auch in dem großen Pool. Das Meer ist sehr wellig, aber man kann gut für eine Abkühlung reingehen, der Sandstrand ist sehr schön und das Meer trotzdem klar, wir waren auch einen Tag schnorcheln und haben ganz viele Fische gesehen (Ausrüstung gibt es im Hotel). Das Personal war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Besonders  gut hat uns auch das Frühstücksbuffet gefallen, tolle Auswahl (frische Waffeln, Pancakes und alle Variationen von Eiern) aber auch typische Gerichte aus Sri Lanka.
Wir hatten Halbpension und jeden Abend ein tolles 4-Gänge Menü, das uns sehr gut geschmeckt hat, vor allem auch weil es typische Gerichte für Sri Lanka gab.
Einmal gab es Buffett mit einer sehr beeindruckenden Auswahl an Currys, Spezialitäten und Fisch.
Wir haben unseren Aufenthalt sehr genossen und können das Resort 100% weiterempfehlen.
title: Tolles Luxus Resort zum Entspannen

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Amy,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala.

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us at Cinnamon Wild Yala.

I'm delighted to hear that you enjoyed the comfort of our rooms, the quality of our food offerings, and the convenience of our location for your safari adventure. It’s also great to know that our team could assist with a packed lunch for your full-day safari—thoughtful touches like these are part of what we strive to offer every guest.

I truly appreciate your suggestion regarding the road access and pick-up service. You're absolutely right—the access road can be challenging, especially for low-clearance vehicles. While we currently base our transport support on weather and operational feasibility, your feedback highlights a valid point. I’ll certainly take this up with our team to explore more flexible solutions in the future, as seamless logistics are a key part of the guest experience.

Thank you once again for your honest feedback and for staying with us. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back again soon—with an even smoother experience from arrival to departure.

Yours sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan
Resort Manager
Cinnamon Wild Yala
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82614 Sri Lanka
text:
Cinnamon Wild is perfectly placed for anyone looking to take a Yala safari - it's very close and you stand the chance to see animals at the hotel. 

The rooms are nice and fairly spacious with good amenities. The food was also very good - we ate at the buffet for breakfast and dinner one night. They also graciously packed us a lunch to bring while were out on an all day safari. To this end, I'd say it's worth just booking the all inclusive, as there are no other restaurants around the area. You're going to end up eating there anyway, so save yourself the trouble.

My only complaint is that our guide asked for someone from the hotel to come pick us up by security, as the roads in are extremely bumpy and he was concerned for his sedan. The hotel refused because it wasn't raining that day, and as such, our guide had to trek down a dirt and very bumpy road that wasn't made for cars. Having a service to pick-up guests between all of the hotels would have really made things feel smooth.
title: A Stay in the Wild

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Megan,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

What an absolute pleasure it was to read your heartfelt feedback — thank you for taking the time to share such a beautifully detailed reflection on your stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala.

Hosting you and the Cinnamon Hotel Management team on your familiarization trip was a true privilege. I'm especially glad to hear that, despite being part of the wider Cinnamon family, you felt fully immersed in the authentic guest experience we strive to create.

It brings me great pride to hear how warmly you were welcomed and looked after by so many members of our team — from Sandushi, Achala, Divya, and Pradeep at check-in, to Chef Manjula and Himal in the kitchen, and Sahan, Amar, and Thamoth at the bar. I’ll be sure to pass your kind words along to each of them — they’ll be overjoyed to know they made such an impression.

And of course, thank you for highlighting the incredible work of Sampath Gunasinghe. His deep knowledge and passion for wildlife is something we value immensely, and I’m thrilled it added so much meaning to your safari.

Your words truly mean the world to me and to our entire team. Knowing that you felt the magic of the wild, the warmth of our service, and the joy of great hospitality is exactly why we do what we do.

We can't wait to welcome you back to Cinnamon Wild Yala for another unforgettable adventure in the heart of nature.

Yours sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan
Resort Manager
Cinnamon Wild Yala
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82614 Sri Lanka
text:
I had the pleasure of staying at Cinnamon Wild Yala on the 27th of May for a one-night familiarisation trip with Cinnamon Hotel Management — and honestly, I’ve never felt so welcomed at a hotel before.

Even though we were part of the Cinnamon team, we made it a point to be treated just like any other guest, and the staff absolutely respected that. Their warmth and hospitality were so genuine — it truly felt like home in the middle of the wild. If I had to describe the experience in one word, it would be magical.

From the moment we checked in, everything was smooth and hassle-free. Huge shoutout to Sandushi, Achala, Divya, and Pradeep for making the check-in process so seamless.

The food was incredible, especially the breakfast buffet! Thank you to Chef Manjula and Himal for not only preparing such delicious food but also checking in on us to make sure everything was up to standard — it absolutely was.

Now onto the cocktails... Wow. A massive thank you to Sahan, Amar, and Thamoth — our amazing bartenders. Hands down the best cocktails I’ve had. If you visit, please try the “Jungle Fowl” — it’s an explosion of flavour and leaves you wanting more!

A big thank you as well to our Nature Trails Yala safari guide, Sampath Gunasinghe. Your knowledge, stories, and passion for wildlife added so much to the experience. It made the safari feel personal and inspiring.

And finally, to Resort Manager Lashanthan Gopalan — thank you for being so warm, friendly, and attentive. You have an incredible team who clearly love what they do. It shows in every interaction and creates such a welcoming, authentic vibe.

To anyone who loves wildlife, nature, and a bit of adventure — I couldn’t recommend Cinnamon Wild Yala enough. I’m already looking forward to my next visit!
title: A Magical Stay in the Wild 🌿

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Bear858,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

Thank you very much for sharing your detailed and insightful feedback following your recent stay with us at Cinnamon Wild Yala. We are delighted to hear that among the three Cinnamon properties you visited, ours stood out as the best and that the intimate, jungle-side setting added to your overall experience.

It’s wonderful to know you appreciated the convenience of stepping directly onto the safari jeeps and enjoyed the comfort of our huts and facilities. Your note about the escorted transfers after dark is very important—safety is our priority, especially given the presence of wildlife like water buffalo roaming nearby, and we’re glad you understood the necessity of this service.

We also appreciate your comments about dining options and will continue to ensure our bar and a-la-carte offerings provide a welcoming and enjoyable experience for all guests. Your feedback on coffee and wine pricing is helpful, and we will certainly keep it in mind as we aim to enhance our guest experience.

It’s fantastic to hear you enjoyed the breakfasts, the small pool, and, of course, the safari with its remarkable wildlife sightings. Your recommendation means a lot to us.

We hope to welcome you back again soon for another memorable stay in the heart of the wilderness.

Yours sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan
Resort Manager
Cinnamon Wild Yala
placeInfo/address: Palatupana, Yala National Park 82614 Sri Lanka
text: I stayed in 3 Cinnamons on recent trip to Sri Lanka and this was the best. Felt a bit smaller than the others and was all the better for it. Right in the jungle and you walk straight on and off the safari jeeps which is very cool. Huts for accomodation, great shower and the air con worked OK.  You do need escorted to and from hotel when its dark, no issue getting the escort though. Think its needed - water buffalo wandered through the resort over one night we were there , not sure I would have wanted to meet them at 11PM!  We didnt eat the  dinner buffet which I dont like, but ate in their bar area where there were excellent tables to sit outside at,  and eat smaller portions off the a-la-carte. A number of people were doing that every night and you didnt feel like an outcast, service there was excellent.   Food was fine, lots for breakfast, coffee average,  beer cheap, wine quite expensive. Same at all Cinnamons.  Nice area to eat at for breakfast. Small pool, very welcome after safari. Didn't do the beach which is close by. Safari was great, lots of birds, elephants and crocs!  Would recommend
title: Fantastic hotel right in the jungle. "Wild" Yala indeed!

placeInfo/address: Polkanda Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tabula Rasa Resort & Spa, A Slh Hotel
text:
A completely holiday saving find!! 
We were in Sri Lanka on a long awaited snorkeling and hiking adventure when I broke my ankle on day 3!😭 ( very stressful!) 
We had to cancel all our travel plans and  accept we had to find a different way to spend the next 10 days. My husband came across Tabula Rasa , what a find ! The perfect antidote to a disaster 😊✨
Every thing was heaven sent. They gave us a ground floor room overlooking the jungle ( monkey watching included) and the sea ( cooling breezes) The room was spotlessly clean, fragranced and comfortable. Fresh water every day , minibar , snacks , nice products. Perfect! The staff were so caring, smiling and attentive. The owner was there and was super friendly and had a great rapport with his team which is great to see. 
The pool was beautiful with an amazing view. I even managed to drape myself in the shallows with my cast propped up on a yoga mat to keep dry. 
The food was fantastic, we especially loved the Sri Lanka breakfast- amazing! 
We found lots to do around the local area , daily  cultural outing's, beautiful beach bars/ restaurants all a fun and breezy tut tut ride away! 
MASSAGE!! I have to tell you about Nuwan! I booked a couple of massages as I love them and really needed them after my fall . I am a massage therapist/facialist and also train spa therapists for luxury hotels.. so Im fussy! 
Nuwans massage was perfect, firm flowing , professional and above all healing ( my thigh of deep bruising was gone in 2 days , which totally freaked out my husband!😂) 
Nuwan is a magical therapist and you must book at least two massages while you're there . 
We also visited his temple nearby which his father built and he has spent several years painting with beautiful frescoes of the story of Lord Buddha . He showed us around and explained all the paintings which was really special We were also blessed by a senior monk  😊✨
Every thing about our stay here was wonderful , dont hesitate, get it booked!! 💫
title: Life saving heaven!

text:
The hotel is tucked away in the mountain overlooking the Indian Ocean with lush green surrounding and amazing views. A true sanctuary for all who wants to escape to the paradise. The room is very comfortable, sitting on the balcony looking at the ocean and sipping a cup of tea is a true bliss. The swimming pool area has the best views. The sun beds are relatively sheltered so you can lie down comfortably for the most of the day without the worry of sun burn. 

Special thanks for the Spa masseuse. Her technique was excellent. 

Only complaints: 
1. Price for food and drinks in the hotel is many times higher than those outside .
2. The bathroom amenities are in ceramic bottles with very narrow necks,  and very difficult to pour out. The hotel should consider replacing them with pump bottles.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from the coconut tree-fringed hilltop in Habaraduwa!

We are delighted to read your review.

It was a pleasure having you. We are so glad you chose to spend your vacation with us.

Dilin Peiris.
General Manager.
placeInfo/address: Polkanda Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tabula Rasa Resort & Spa, A Slh Hotel
text:
It is truly a small luxury hotel set in a beautiful tranquil area.  You wake up to the sound of nature to enjoy a simple continental or Sri Lankan breakfast (must preorder the night before) over looking the pool, onto the forest and the sea.  It is easy to forget your worries and immerse yourself in this serene surroundings. We enjoyed it so much we extended our stay by another night, and during our entire stay there was only one other family, making it a truly exceptionally peaceful experience.
It is important to note that the hotel is located up the mountain so be prepared you will need to get a tuk tuk or a driver to get you to and fro the hustle and bustle of the coastal towns. If you are keen on being amongst the action, this will feel highly inconvenient. 
If you are committed to quietude I would highly recommend going for the larger rooms, as it truly elevates the experience and don’t forget to treat yourself to a spa treatment as well. 
The hotel is well appointed and maintained, but the furnishings are starting to get a little run down if you examine closely. The staff are plentiful and helpful, however some are a little amateurish. They do run on island time so if you are in the rush (eg early check out), you have been warned. 
Overall a wonderful experience at an excellent price point - at around $250 USD per night, I would come back again.
title: Total relaxation in a tranquil setting

placeInfo/address: Polkanda Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tabula Rasa Resort & Spa, A Slh Hotel
roomTip: Take some time to see local attractions - the Peace Pagoda, Gall - beautiful fort town - but mostly, just relax!
text:
Just stunning. Stop scrolling and just book a stay at this magical place. 

I had an amazing 6 nights at this beautiful oasis. You feel like you are a million miles away but are in fact just a few mins by tuk tuk from shops, beach bars and more - you just wouldn't know it as it is so peaceful and serene.

The main pool is an infinity placed to enjoy a spectacular vista. Some rooms even have their own. My villa was spacious and exceptionally comfortable. Great big bed and top quality furnishings.

The food is scrumptious and plentiful. Great selection of drinks and a minibar in the room too. There is a spa and the massage/mani/pedi were most welcome.

The owners and GM are a delight and they are supported by an attentive teamwho can cater for all your needs. There's even a 'butler' app so you can plan excursions, order food and drinks to your room/pool/lounge. Whenever I wanted to go out, a tuk tuk or cab was summoned so you could experience local attractions. Or you could, as I did, sometimes just laze by the pool, cocktail in hand, good book and a full heart.

Highly recommend if you want somewhere to unwind and reset.
title: Stop scrolling and book - fabulous stay.

text: Потрясающий отель! Единственный из всех, что я видела, без старой деревянной мебели и уставшего ремонта. Большой плюс, что в номере не было насекомых и кровать с красивым балдахином от комаров. Во всех номерах свои балконы. Чистый красивый бассейн с теплой водой, возле которого много лежаков с полотенцами. Хорошие завтраки: шри-ланкийский и континентальный на выбор, плюс фрукты, готовят вкусно и сытно. Наедались до отвалу. В номерах чисто, уборка каждый день. Вайфай работают стабильно. Большая территория с воротами и охраной, все ухожено. Очень приветливый персонал, всегда идут навстречу и внимательно относятся к постояльцам. В общем это лучший отель, что я видела на Шри Ланке. Свои 5 звезд вполне заслуживает
title: Лучший отель на Шри Ланке по европейским стандартам

placeInfo/address: Polkanda Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tabula Rasa Resort & Spa, A Slh Hotel
roomTip: Don’t expect to be in the centre of town; the ride up the hill is on a very basic road. But Uber works and the hotel can organise transport
text:
I have just been on a relaxing 2 night break with my wife to Tabula Rasa. The hotel was everything I had hoped for and my only disappointment was that we could only spend 2 nights on the edge of the amazing Sri Lankan jungle.

For my wife and I the highlights had to be the wildlife that could be seen and heard from the privacy of our balcony or the feeling that as we walked from our chalet to the restaurant/bar area we were walking through the jungle!

The welcome from all the staff was friendly and helpful; I always feel a bit guilty mentioning individual team members but Akeela who ran proceedings in the restaurant and Dilshan who was ever present as front of house were both excellent ambassadors for the hotel.

Chef Amith served excellent food and I was delighted at the range of vegetarian offerings for my wife. The F&B prices were reasonable and the views from the lounge and restaurant were beautiful.

We were upgraded to a Plunge Pool Suite which was a private villa with a balcony overlooking the jungle and a plunge pool on the decking where we could relax and watch the beautiful sunset. The room was well appointed and immaculately clean.

I booked via the Hilton Honors App but I have a feeling that booking direct with the hotel could provide future guests with a better package. Mr Dilin who is the Resort Manager was very helpful during the booking process and I found Whats App a good method of communication.

Overall, we had a lovely stay and will definitely be back, hopefully for longer next time! Last but not least, Max the dog deserves a special mention; she was found as a puppy and offered a caring home at the resort.
title: Beautiful Surroundings in Relaxing Hotel

Tabula Rasa (which means ‘clean slate’ in Latin) is a wonderful boutique hotel, with lovely staff, comfortable yet luxurious accommodation, set in the most beautiful jungle looking out to the sea and all the nature of Sri Lanka. 

If you love quietness, luxury and relaxation, nature and wildlife then you must stay here!  All the staff are lovely, especially Akeela. Thank you! 

If you’re coming here and you love dogs, please bring a wee treat or a toy with you for Max - the resident Sri Lankan rescue dog, she’s a lovely, kind lady!

text:
In all my years of traveling I have never before had such a thoroughly professional, enjoyable, and immaculately crafted experience as here. Granted we’re not luxury travelers so this was a bit of a splurge, but it was 100% worth it.

The scenery around the estate is so good you don’t need to do anything else in Nuwara Eliya—a few days here with the local tea factory tour on day 2 is more than enough.

We were welcomed with the best tea I’ve had in Sri Lanka, served with jaggery. The chef not only served dinner whenever we liked, but even showed us how he made the dessert dish after I raves about how good it was. He went to the trouble of arranging everything for us to see in the kitchen, and had even prepared little chef hats for us to help him. 

Everything about this place is immaculate. The grounds, the cuisine, the rooms, the staff (observant but not intrusive), the fire burning in the fireplace as we had dinner. 

This place is in my top five, without a question. 10 out of 10, will definitely do it again. Highlight of our entire trip, which is saying a lot.
title: Perfection.

roomTip: Off the grid experience. Nice food,dedicated staff. Rustic old charm still Lives there
text:
visited Scottish Bungalow on 09 of December 2023 with my family of 4  .Booked Stuart Suit for our stay.  It's a renovated old Bungalow situated inside a Tea plantation managed by a staff of 5. Road to the Bungalow  through the estate is bit difficult and gives you an idea about plantation estate worker's living conditions and difficult living. 

The hotel is filled with old furniture and basic amenities. Electric supply and water heating are a bit temperamental. 

It's 4 room Hotel and food is provided ala carte. Hotel Chef seems to be very dedicated and innovative.  So food always came fresh, tasty with a bit of a local twist. 

Due to rain and lack of time, we could not climb Maha kudu gala  mountain near by. But we had a nice walk in the tea plantation. 

Dedication of Hotel staff and their attempt to make you comfortable and feel 🙏 welcome is commendable.
title: Rustic Cosy place with dedicated friendly staff away from beaten track.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear guest,

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your positive review of your stay at The Scottish planter Glendevon Bungalow. We are thrilled to hear that you had such a wonderful time, and we truly appreciate your kind words.

It's always our goal to provide our guests with a memorable and delightful experience, and we are delighted to know that we succeeded in delivering that during your stay, 
Thank you once again for your loyalty and for recommending us. We do look forward to welcoming you again for your next trip to Scottish planter Glendevon Bungalow.

Manusanka Pitiyekumbura
Bungalow Executive
Scottish Planter Glendevon Bungalow
placeInfo/address: Kandapola Road, Sooriyakanda 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
The Scottish planter bungalow in Sri Lanka is like a peaceful haven on this beautiful island. It blends perfectly with the misty landscape, surrounded by greenery but the approach was a bit challenging without a paved road for cars, All those difficulties dissipated once we arrived at the place, greeted by their warm welcome.

During our family trip to Ragala, every moment became a lasting memory. Right after I booked, Mr. Thennakoon contacted us to discuss room arrangements, asking the weather, showing the genuine care typical of Sri Lankan hospitality. Throughout our stay, a sense of sharing and caring surrounded us, leaving a lasting impression.

The staff didn't just greet us; they warmly welcomed us, creating a calm atmosphere that defined our whole stay. The bungalow, restored with care, reflected an appreciation for English architecture, with simple and elegant technology that embraced a simpler way of life.

Our meals, crafted by the skilled Chef, were delicious. Each dish was a delight, especially for my children who loved the flavours. Even though menus are offered à la carte, they accommodated all the foods we requested. Breakfast was the most delicious and thoroughly enjoyed meal. 

The chef prepared special meals for our two-year-old babies, showing genuine care and consideration for their dietary needs. 
We requested take-away meals for the two babies on day 02, and they were packed and prepared with a lovely manner. Normally, when we embark on this kind of trip, we are truly concerned about our babies' food. However, this time, the chef didn't give us a chance to worry. It really helped us to continue and enjoy our trip.

The entire staff stood out for their exceptional qualities, going beyond the ordinary. Their dedication to preserving these virtues made our experience special, and we are truly thankful.

I want to express my sincere thanks for the immense joy this stay brought to my family. Our time in the Scottish Planter Bungalow wasn't just a break; it became a cherished memory for all of us.
title: A Memorable Stay at Ragala's Scottish Planter Bungalow

text:
Scottish planter bungalow is like a heaven on this mother Sri Lankan soil. It brings the pleasant climate on this beautiful misty land blend with nature filled with lot of greenery & more than 50 bird species.
I went with my family. It was an unmemorable experience for all of us. This is the first time we ever had been to Ragala.
Soon after I made the booking Mr. Thennakoon called me from the bungalow who inquired about the room arrangement simply because my family was too big. I felt the warmth of rich Sri Lankan hospitality through out my stay, where sharing & caring was felt by all of us from the bottom of our hearts. Staff was waiting to welcome us & never was in a hurry which made our stay a calm enjoyable one.
The bungalow had been completely restored in a manner some one can admire the English architecture. All the technology used is very simple & beautiful, teaching the simple human life style.
We enjoyed three meals made by the Chef, which were delicious & all my children enjoyed their taste a lot.
Mr. Madusanka, Mr. Mogan & all the other staff members were simply amazing when comes to the preservation of admirable human qualities which are beyond the majority.
Thank you very much for making my family happy!
title: Beautiful colonial bungalow filled with love

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Room no 4 and 5 of each floor has the best uninteruppred view and with a pool and a sea view.
text:
Riff Hikkaduwa

My wife and myself traveled on Monday the 23rd of June. The experience was great from the point of booking. Indika was nice enough to provide an upgrade to a junior suite at the point of booking itself.

Location:
This property is situated at a very convenient location bordering the main road at Hikkaduwa with a large seafront. The beach is very clean and beautiful. Since we travelled in the off season, the sea was rough and not suitable for sea bating. Buth the sea was beautiful with large waives and splashes. 

Facilities:
This hotel has a spacious living area and two restaurants. One is situated at the ground floor and the other one, a Japanese Restaurant, is situated at the roof top. The hotel has a nice little library, a spa and a gym as well. 

Rooms:
The rooms are modern and very clean. It has very good ambiance in the rooms. The bed is comfortable. The room has tea and coffee making facilities, a shaving kit, shower caps, sewing kit etc. that are very handy. Our room was upgraded to the Junior Site by the hotel without even requesting the same and that suit was large and well maintained. 

Garden:
There is a garden area with several chairs and pool decks that let people relax. The pool is a small one, but it is enough for a mid-size hotel such as the Riff. 

Food:
The food was ample and tasty. The food provided by the hotel is very tasty. The restaurant staff were the main plus point of this hotel. The four-course menu was too much for both of us as the portions were very generous. All the food that we ate was very tasty. The desserts were also very good with the home-made ice cream being the best. 

Service:
The Benisha was very attentive and the boy who served us, Reshmika, was accommodated to all our requests very much willingly and with a smile on his face. They went out of their way to serve us better. All the other people on the restaurant team, including the girl who served us dinner and the other boy on duty today were also excellent.    

Overall:
I could recommend this hotel to any person coming to enjoy a good relaxing holiday with good food and good service.
title: Great food Excellent Service and a Great Location Location

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
text:
Located at the southern end of Hikkadua beach, this is a high end hotel. Luxury cars are parked at the entrance and there’s a wonderful pool at the rear before you head onto the beach itself. There are nice restaurants on the ground floor and there’s terrace. You have use of the pool for a small fee. On the roof terrace, you see a spectacular view of Hikkadua beach itself. It’s wonderful at sunset and very romantic.

Staff are immaculately dressed, professional, engaging and attentive. I’ve swam in several pools in Hikkadua and this is so far the best one. Not too much chlorine and it’s colder than other pools also. The view overlooks the beach. The cascading waves that crash into the beach is fantastic. The pool area is surprisingly peaceful and idyllic. Recommended.
title: Luxury At The Beach.

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
text:
Where do I start?

The atmosphere is both calm and welcoming! Staff opened the car door, helped with my bags, welcomed me in the lobby with a drink and showed me to my room with a quick but informative tour.

And what a room! And what a view! And what a tub! And I could just keep going. I had a permanent grin on my face during my stay and I so regret not booking more nights! The room was amazing, it was clean, cool and well prepared for my stay, even had some classical music playing as I arrived. The balcony was large and had a great view of the pool area, palm trees and the ocean. From the tub and shower you could also take in part of the view.

The pool and pool area was very calm! Most people had chairs down on the beach so I could even swim alone in the pool. Staff was very careful to inform and ensure that no guest went into the ocean due to rough waves for our own security. Once you find a chair on the beach or by the pool they bring you towels and a refreshing water bottle.

Dinner on the rooftop was relaxed, only a few guests and food was tasty and service quick. Breakfast was also a good experience! Attentive staff, easy to order, many options and what a view!

The only complaints I have are few. Firstly I wish the bed was softer. Secondly I would have liked to have been informed that while I went for a massage a member of staff would enter my room after check-in to get it ready for the evening by pulling down the curtain and undoing/redoing the bedlinens. Thirdly the prices shown on the massage-menu are not the actual price and I was not informed during booking but only when I arrived for the massage. Seeing as I had been looking forward to it I was not likely to cancel then. The massage was nice, although I would have liked the massagebed to have a spot to rest my arms while lying on my stomach. 

All in all it was great! The Riff is by far the best hotel I have ever visited and before leaving I was already planning my next trip back!

Thank you for a wonderful stay!
title: Absolutely spectacular - Five stars!

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
roomTip: No need to worry about anything - the hotel will take care!
text:
For me it was the first time staying in the hotel rather than my friend. Everything was perfect! Firstly we decided to stay only for 2 nights and then moved to another place but after all cancelled our next destination and came back to Riff Hikkaduwa! The location is great - nice beach and shore, lack of people and noise. Rooms are clean and nice, the views are stunning. Highly recommended! 
Thanks to front office team for the high level of hospitality and service - Lalith, Malshi, Beenu, for the great gesture and yummy food to F&B team - Chamod, Theekshana, Ravindra, Sachintha, Pasan, Danushka, Ananda! I would like to mention also security guy Ashoka, he was so friendly and nice and housekeeping guy Roshan that took care of us all our staying near the pool. 
Thanks to all the team in the hotel - our stay was amazing! 
Definitely will come back!
title: Sri Lankan paradise

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
text:
This isn’t just a hotel — it’s my place. I keep coming back to Riff Hikkaduwa for one reason: it’s perfect. The food, the vibe, the beach, the staff — everything feels easy, stylish, and full of heart.

The front office dream team — Lalith, Malshi, Beenu — always make me feel like a VIP. They already know my name, my favorite view, and probably my breakfast order by now!

Big love to Chamod, Theekshana, Ravindra, Sachintha, Pasan, Danushka, and Ananda — you guys are the real stars of the show. So friendly, fun, and always making sure everything is just right.

The F&B team? Next-level. I’m convinced the chefs here are secretly magicians.
And Ashoka from Security — thank you for always watching over everything with calm vibes and a kind smile.

Riff is where I relax, recharge, and remember how good life can be. Already counting the days until my next stay!
title: Where My Flip-Flops Feel at Home

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
text:
The overall experience at Riff was excellent. From the check in to check out. The room was one of the most beautiful rooms I have seen and the attention to detail was great..the sea view from the room is amazing. The Japanese on the rooftop was excellent and so was all the other meals. Love the set menu concept and the choice you get for breakfast. Benisha at the restaurant was a 💯 always with a smile and ready to help you. 
Overall it’s a gem of a place!
title: An amazing weekend gateway

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Look in to time of year/ possibility of swimming in the ocean
text:
A wonderful hotel! It’s smaller designer hotel, right on the beach.
The views are fantastic, the rooms large and beautiful. Staff are super friendly and helpful.
You can lie on the sunbeds and order drinks, which is not a given in Sri Lanka.( currently staying at the Taj in Bentota- they have no beach facilities- you have to pay to use sunbeds, no drink or food).
The breakfast was a la carte, and very good. Cool rooftop bar/japanese restaurant- great food and drinks with relaxing live music.
I truly loved this hotel!
Only con- is that the sea was too choppy to swim in this time of year- so would look into that if planning a trip!
title: Close to perfection!

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
text: Loved this small hotel—big comfy rooms, amazing food, and top-notch service. The beach is gorgeous, though not swimmable during the offseason. Luckily, there’s a safe spot just 10 minutes away. I’d come back just for the food and service!
title: Great Stay on a Beautiful Beach

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
roomTip: They have UK plug sockets.
text:
I stayed at this hotel in March and had a fantastic experience. The staff were incredibly friendly, and both my friend and I really enjoyed our time there. I arrived early on the first day, and thankfully, they allowed us to check in ahead of time, which was much appreciated.

The hotel is located right by the seafront, offering lovely views. However, the sea can be quite rough, so it's not really suitable for swimming.

The area around the hotel is fairly quiet, but there are a couple of great restaurants just in front of the hotel that I’d recommend: Two Brothers Palace (cash only) and Bella’s (accepts both cash and card). Both offer authentic and delicious food.
The hotel is about 30 minutes to an hour away from other popular spots like Mirissa and Galle. I’d recommend taking a taxi, which is quite affordable—around £20 for a round trip. We used a company called Less taxi throughout our trip.

The hotel also helped us book an excursion for £126, which included a visit to Ella and the Elephant Sanctuary. A hotel staff member picked us up at 4 AM in a comfortable Mercedes van equipped with Wi-Fi and chargers. He stayed with us throughout the day and ensured everything went smoothly. They even provided a generous breakfast box for the trip. All in all, a really memorable and well-organized experience.

When we checked out the hotel they kindly gifted us some Sri Lankan tea – would highly recommend this hotel.
title: Fantastic stay

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid monsoon season as causes tidal issues
text:
Fantastic hotel with superb service and great roof top bar and restaurant!!!  3 superb dinners! 
Pool area was very nice and service very good. 
Spa massage treatments were good. 
Staff and management could not do enough to make our stay wonderful. Compliments to Raymond and his team!!!
title: Fantastic hotel and outstanding staff

placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
text:
Best of Lanka booked this boutique hotel so we could undertake local activities and then lounge by the beach for a couple of days before our midnight flight home.  Pure luxury, with all the care and attention you would expect from a top hotel.  Plus there is a genuine focus on food by the hotel.  A minor price premium over a local restaurant ensured a very superior experience indeed.
Top marks!
title: Luxury on the beach

ownerResponse/text:
Dear valued guest, 

Firstly, we would like to thank you for this amazing review and recommendation! It was a pleasure to have you and your family stay with us at Riff Hikkaduwa. We’re so glad you enjoyed the stunning views, the warm hospitality of our team, and the overall experience.

It’s wonderful to hear that you appreciated our breakfast selection and had the chance to try something different each day. Dining by the pool and enjoying dinner at our rooftop Japanese restaurant sounds like a fantastic way to make the most of your stay and we’re delighted that you enjoyed it.

The infinity pool and beachfront setting truly offer a relaxing escape, and while the waves can be strong at times, it’s great that you were able to enjoy the views and even try surfing nearby. Seeing a turtle nest right in front of our hotel must have been an unforgettable experience!

Thank you for choosing Riff Hikkaduwa, we’re so happy to have been part of your family’s memorable holiday and would love to welcome you back again!
placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Riff for five nights in February after a week of touring Srilanka. It was a great stay! All the staff were lovely, friendly and helpful. Hotel is really beautiful and the views from the rooms are stunning. 
Food was great, really diverse choice for breakfast. Not a buffet stile but I loved it even more. I tried different things every day, and everything was yummy. We had lunch by the pool every day. Also had dinner at Japanese restaurant on the top floor twice and it was delicious. 

Best thing was a beautiful infinity pool, chairs on the beach ( you can always find a spot ) and a gorgeous white sand beach. Waves in front of the hotel were too big for swimming in the sea but I could have watched them whole day :) you can swim just few minutes walk down the beach. And it is a great place for surfing so we tried that also. There are lots of restaurants on the beach also great food. And great beach for morning run/walk. We even had a turtle come one night and laid eggs in front of the hotel.
Thank you everyone at Riff for making this a memorable stay for our family. We loved it!
title: Beautiful modern boutique hotel on a stunning beach

ownerResponse/text:
Уважаемый гость,

Прежде всего, мы хотели бы поблагодарить вас за этот замечательный отзыв и рекомендацию! Было действительно приятно, что вы и ваш муж остановились у нас в Riff Hikkaduwa. Мы рады слышать, что вам понравилась спокойная атмосфера, удобство нашего расположения и комфорт нашего отеля.

Ваши добрые слова о нашем персонале значат для нас очень много! Мы гордимся тем, что предоставляем теплое, внимательное обслуживание, и приятно знать, что о вас так хорошо заботятся.

Мы также рады, что вам понравились наши завтраки и что ресторан пришелся вам по вкусу. Мы приложили много усилий, чтобы обеспечить высокое качество блюд с элегантной подачей, и приятно слышать, что вы это заметили!

Спасибо, что так высоко нас рекомендовали и упомянули, что Riff Hikkaduwa — это идеальное место для тех, кто ищет спокойствия, но при этом находится достаточно близко к оживленной энергии Хиккадувы. Нам приятно знать, что вам понравилось пребывание в нашем отеле, и мы надеемся снова приветствовать вас для приятного отдыха в будущем!
placeInfo/address: No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka
text:
Отдыхали с мужем в отеле Riff Hikkaduwa с 19 февраля по 1 марта 2025 года. Отель отличный. Очень удачное местоположение - немного на отдалении от самого цента городка Хиккадува, но это большой плюс - нет шума и суеты улицы. Тишина и атмосфера, способствующая отдыху и расслаблению. Поездка на тук-туке до центра занимает 3 минуты (цена около 300 рупий - это примерно 100 рублей). Можно и пешком пройтись - это  примерно 10 - 15 минут)
Сам отель очень уютный. Отличный видовой бассейн. Свои лежаки на пляже.
Отдельно хочу сказать про персонал! Это отзывчивые и добрые люди! Все! Готовы придти на помощь в решении абсолютно любого вопроса. 
Про ресторан в отеле - у нас были только завтраки. Очень вкусно! Огромный выбор блюд. Заказ по меню. Меню на завтраке очень разнообразное! Все блюда прекрасного качества и, что немало важно, эстетичная европейская подача! Прекрасно работают официанты! Ни минуты лишнего ожидания! 
Несколько раз ужинали в ресторане отеля. Это действительно вкусно! По сравнению с ужинами в городских кафешках - просто супер! Еще раз хочу отметить качество блюд и чистоту!! Огромное спасибо менеджеру ресторана Benisha. Очень улыбчивая, внимательная и отзывчивая девушка! 
Я бы ОЧЕНЬ рекомендовала этот тихий спокойный респектабельный отель парам, семьям с детьми и взрослым людям! Молодежи, желающей острых впечатлений, шума и суеты - лучше, наверное, остановиться ближе к центру))) А тем, кто отдыхает в этом отеле всегда есть возможность попасть в эпицентр веселья, а потом вернуться в свой тихий уютный и комфортный номер без шума и суеты.
title: Прекрасный бутик-отель с европейским сервисом!

placeInfo/address: Kandapola Road, Sooriyakanda 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
During our recent family escapade to Nuwara Eliya, we were fortunate to discover the hidden gem that is the Scottish Planter Glendevon bungalow. Nestled amidst the lush green hills and surrounded by meticulously maintained tea gardens, this charming bungalow proved to be a haven of tranquility and timeless elegance.

From the moment we stepped foot into this over 100-year-old heritage building, we were transported back in time while still enjoying modern comforts. The architectural marvel that stands before you pays homage to the Scottish planters who once graced the lands of Sri Lanka in the 1880s. The intricate design elements and awe-inspiring colonial architecture are a testament to the rich legacy that this place holds, and it's heartwarming to see how well it's preserved and cherished.

Our family of avid travelers was accommodated with utmost warmth and care. The staff's genuine hospitality made us feel like cherished guests in a dear friend's home. Every corner of the bungalow seemed to tell a story, and we couldn't help but be enchanted by the cozy atmosphere that enveloped us. Our spacious and tastefully appointed room was a perfect retreat after exploring the surrounding tea plantations and breathtaking landscapes.

Mornings were a delight as we woke up to the soothing melodies of nature and enjoyed hearty breakfasts overlooking the verdant gardens. The serenity of the surroundings and the crisp mountain air were truly invigorating, and we relished every moment spent on the property.

Whether you're seeking a romantic getaway or a family retreat like ours, Scottish Planter offers an experience that transcends time. It's a place where history, nature, and warm hospitality converge to create cherished memories. As we bid adieu to this enchanting abode, we left with hearts full of gratitude and a promise to return to this haven of peace and elegance.

Thennakoon and Morgan were helpful. 

🏞️ Embrace History, Serenity, and Home-like Comfort at Scottish Planter - Where Timeless Beauty Meets Modern Hospitality! 🏰🍃
title: Unforgettable Colonial Charm Amidst Nature's Embrace!

Our stay at Scottish Planter - Glendevon Bungalow was fantastic! The rooms were immaculately clean, the grounds are gorgeous and well manicured, and the food is out of this world delicious. The best part of our stay was the marvellous staff, right from the chefs, assistants, butlers, gardeners and the tour guide who walked us to the nearby Tea Factory Liddesdale, where the tour was engaging and educational. Our 11 year old loved it, and our 20-somethings also enjoyed. Would definitely come again and strongly recommend to all. The only sad part was leaving- our group of 6 all felt we could have stayed here and enjoyed for a week. We felt like celebrities, we were treated so well. 
Magnificent people, splendid place.
title: PARADISE. AHHH-MAZING.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from the coconut tree-fringed hilltop in Habaraduwa!

We are delighted to read your review.

placeInfo/address: Polkanda Road, Habaraduwa 80630 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Tabula Rasa Resort & Spa, A Slh Hotel
text:
We have just come home after 10 days at Tabula Rasa. There is not a single thing I would change. It was an exceptional hotel in every way. 
The resort was spotlessly clean throughout. 
Our welcome was fabulous with all that days team greeting us,  including the general manager Dillon. 

Our room was comfortable and we had magnificent views from the balcony. The room was kept clean throughout our stay. There is a focus on environmental issues and so the towels were changed every 3rd day,  but if we needed fresh towels sooner we could have them.  Bathroom "stuff", (Shaving kits, toothbrushes, soap etc) were all environmentally friendly. 

On arrival the chef came and checked our individual requirements. I am a vegetarian and I have some food allergies. I also HATE coconut!  I knew I would have to "put up and shut up" going to an Asian county. However,  this was not the case. Each and every meal I had was freshly prepared with no coconut. I had the most delicious food whenever we ate at the hotel. Thank you to the head chef and the catering team.  A Special mention to Akila, the waiter and general lovely man. He was a breath of fresh air with kind and gentle service. He was quick to learn our preferences ( me: black coffee.  My husband: tea with milk and sugar). Nothing was too much to ask. 

The front of house was always well managed and Upeka was so kind and welcoming.  She helped to arrange many things for us and was always interested in what we had booked and where we were going. Packed breakfasts were arranged if we needed them. All her suggestions were appropriate and helpful. 

The hotel arranged a driver for us when we needed, including our airport transfers. Samira was a gem. He was a top guy with a lovely sense of humour. We felt completely safe being driven by him and once again nothing was too much trouble. 
The hotel also suggested the local Tuk Tuk driver,  Ataru. He was fantastic, once again we felt very safe being driven by him. 

The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and the gardens are particularly pretty. All the garden and maintenance team were a pleasure to engage with. They always had a smile and wave. 

The pool was fabulous overlooking the jungle and we frequently saw the monkeys whilst watching from the edge of the infinity pool.

If I sound like I'm overdoing the praise,  I'm not. It truly was a fabulous as this,  and then some. 

Wonderfully relaxed but there was attention to detail throughout. 

I hope I haven't missed any one out of my review.  There really are no negative comments to make. 

The Sri Lanka way of life is gentle and kind and we experienced this from every person we met at Tabula Rasa. 

Thank you..... we'll be back in another couple of years.
title: Don't bother looking elsewhere. Fabulous in every way.

roomTip: If you go for a plunge room, ask for Number 7. The best view. Always have your camera ready - a lot of monkeys and other cool animals ;)
text:
I don't even know how to express the experience we had in Tabula Rasa. The scale ends at "Excellent" but it is not enough, It is "Excellent" +++++.

We had a lovely week stay in this place and OMG. , it has been the best experience we have ever had anywhere. From the very first moment on site, we felt like at home.  The Resort itself is very well maintained and well planned. They have thought about everything you might need during your holidays. The Plunge Suit with Ocean and Jungle view was awesome. The infinity view pool was fantastic and clean, we enjoyed our time just having a drink and chat in a swimming pool. In the evening we enjoyed just sitting at our private terrace so we can listen to the sounds of jungle. 

However, this all would be just "excellent" without the people working here. They are literally AWESOME. Always friendly, always smiling, always happy to help but also just to have a small chat. Best hotel team I have ever met in my life. Food quality, taste and service is like in the best restaurant in the world. We highly recommend to eat local dishes as they are simply fantastic, tasty and well balanced. 

They of course offer burgers, pizza and other European meals, but why would ask for it if they have such lovely Sri Lanka cuisine? If you worry that your kid will not find anything to eat - worry no more. They have great pancakes, chicken nuggets, etc.

To sum our holidays up. Thank you, for everything. Time went so fast, but I am 100% sure we will be back. And if you are in doubt, if this resort is worth visiting  - forgive all your doubts,  just experience it. The words cannot express how good it actually is.
title: One in a milion place.

We stayed three nights and enjoyed a meal at the restaurant on the first.  The food was good, but was our most expensive meal of our stay in Sri Lanka.  Good food though!

Swimming pool is lovely, sun loungers comfortable and monkeys swinging through the trees above adds to the experience.
Would I recommend ? Yes, for a few nights’ break from the touring, it’s a lovely place to hideout.
