placeInfo/address: 265 Galle Road Kollupitiya, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed as a family.
The hotel gave us an upgraded room.
The room was really nice and comfortable!
Breakfast buffet was delicious and had many kinds of dishes.
The club lounge was perfect! It was very comfortable and we could totally relax.
The lounge food service was fantastic! All the dishes were really delicious and we all had great dinner at the lounge.
One of the chef, Ms. Amandi was really a nice staff. She was friendly with my kids and us. She taught us a lot of information about Sri Lanka. She always helped us and thanks to her, our stay in Sri Lanka became perfect! Thank you so much, Ms. Amandi!!
I’d love to stay at this hotel again!!!
title: Amazing stay

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make sure to take good photos while enjoying the garden with the lake and pools.
text:
We had a wonderful stay at this hotel and truly appreciate the effort the staff puts into making guests feel welcome. The room was spotless, comfortable, and well-maintained, offering everything needed for a relaxing stay.

Room service was prompt, polite, and efficient, and every request was handled quickly and with a smile. I was especially impressed with the dinner service – the food was delicious, beautifully presented, and full of flavor. 

The garden with the pool is well maintained and the background mountains gives attractive views.
title: Excellent room with foods

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Gorgeous surroundings for a relaxing stay. Make sure you have a camera to hand for all the bird life by the lake and the monkeys in the trees! Beautiful pool too with a small bar. Great selection of food from the buffet ( we had breakfast and evening meal).
title: Beautiful place to Relax

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed here for several nights when exploring the cultural triangle. It was a beautiful hotel, the staff were attentive and friendly and the food was good with plenty of options. The view from our room was lovely. The rooms were cleaned well and staff always gave you clean, fresh drinking water when asked.
title: Lovely start to our holiday

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: This was our favourite hotel in Sri Lanka. Beautiful view out over the pool and lake. Lovely balcony, where you could hear the sounds of nature around. Very tranquil. Friendly and attentive lovely staff, very helpful. We were greeted with a refreshing towel and drink on arrival, check in was easy and we were helped with our bags. It’s a beautiful hotel in lovely natural surroundings. Our bathroom and room was lovely. They gave us a little cake for our honeymoon and a honeymoon message on the bed. They helped surprise my husband with a birthday cake with his name on it. The pool was clean and the perfect temperature. Highly recommend this hotel. I got a foot massage in the spa which was very relaxing. There is lots of options for the food and it is to a very high standard. We visited Minneriya national park and Sigiriya rock while staying here. We were sorry we couldn’t stay longer than 2 nights!
title: Beautiful hotel in picturesque natural surroundings with lovely staff

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel is a class of its own. The surrounding and the view beyond Lake is amasing. Never seen such a long swimming pool except jetwing lagoon. Water is crisp and can spend there till evening. Buffet dinner and breakfast is so good and staff are so friendly. I wish we could stay longer! but I hate bathroom door when I am with kids.
title: Unforgetable stay

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
A lovely hotel to begin our tour around Sri Lanka. The rooms are large and well appointed with a bath overlooking the beautiful view from the balcony. The bed and pillows were so so comfortable! 
The food was great. We ate at the buffet every evening, such a selection, we were very well fed! 
The staff are friendly and couldn’t do enough for you. Would highly recommend. 
The pool was fabulous with the gorgeous view of the lake, it was surreal. 
My daughters enjoyed the chocolate milkshakes and iced coffees!!
title: Ticks all of the boxes for a wonderful hotel!

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: It’s a tuktuk tide to dambulla which the hotel can arrange. Not sure if the app “pick me Sri Lanka” would have been a bit cheaper
text: Fantastic hotel . The room was spacious. The  pool was huge with a great view over the lake. The food was plentiful and a good range to cater for all. The scenery, bats at night and birdsong in the morning were just the tonic. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.
title: Fantastic

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We absolutely loved our stay at Jetwing Lake. The hotel offered a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of nearby tourist attractions, it provided us with a peaceful, calm environment to unwind and recharge.
Our room was huge, featuring a large balcony where we could sit and enjoy the stunning views of the lake. The bathroom was equally impressive, offering plenty of space and modern amenities to make our stay even more comfortable. Waking up to the serene sight of the lake every morning was a true highlight of our stay.
The dining experience was great(we opted for half board). The breakfast spread was varied, fresh, and satisfying, with options that catered to all tastes. The evening dining was equally impressive, offering delicious meals with high-quality ingredients.
The staff at Jetwing Lake were a standout. They were friendly, attentive, and always ready to assist with any request.
title: A lush, tranquil, stay

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights as part of our Sri Lanka tour.  The hotel is a lovely oasis just outside of Dambulla.  We had a ground floor room with access to the pool which suited us perfectly.  The room itself was large with a huge bathroom containing both a bath and a walk in shower.  Bed & pillows were both really comfortable.

We were out each morning but returned in the afternoon and made use of the sunbeds and pool which were always quiet (no blaring music & no fight for a bed!) & had beautiful views of the lake. 

Breakfast is buffet style with lots of choice & well prepared.  We stayed on a B&B basis but ate in the buffet restaurant each evening as the choice & quality was so good.  I don't think there was anywhere within walking distance that would have been an option.

The gym is small but well equipped.  

All of the staff were friendly and attentive.  We noted that this hotel has a few trainee managers that seemed to go the extra mile to ensure that we had an enjoyable stay, in particular was Ishodha (not sure about the spelling!) who was especially attentive.  Good luck to him, he has the makings of a fine hotel manager!

We would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a stylish, quality stay in this part of Sri Lanka.
title: Where style, comfort and quality collide

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make sure you don't accidentally switch on the "do not disturb" sign which is by the suitcase rack - we did so didn't get our room serviced
text:
This is a modern, stylish hotel where you will be well looked after.
It is a beautiful location on a lake and with a mountain in the distance.
Lovely large rooms with a balcony overlooking the pool, lake and mountain.
The buffet dining facilities offer a wide range of food to suit all tastes.
Despite its size our stay here was very quiet, perhaps because the large groups on coach tours are out on excursions during the day. 
Well located for visiting the Cultural Triangle, Sigiriya Rock and one of the National Parks for an elephant safari.
title: A great base for visiting a variety of tourist attractions

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Fantastic service, great massage by Namas (I think) - the buffet was really good. Pool is waaaaay bigger than you think. Pool staff are particularly exceptional. 

Gym was good. Lake in the evening was a delight on the eyeballs. 

Would recommend to a friend.
title: Lake > Pool

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Wonderful stay at Jetwing Lake! Our suite was absolutely enormous and well equipped…a special shoutout to Hasun who provided us with exceptional service and such warm hospitality. On our last day he even spoiled us with a beautiful and delicious high tea. Many thanks to Shan who served us at both restaurants with a big smile and faultless service. Another kind thank you to Ravindra who took excellent care of our room during our stay. Mr Nalin Herath, General Manager, goes above and beyond with his team and taking care of his guests….
title: Terrific Experience At Jetwing Lake

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
This is an amazing, near new hotel in a beautiful location. Modernist style, beautifully appointed room & grounds. The staff are genuinely helpful & friendly. 

The buffet & room service are great.

We were lucky to get a top floor room in the building not overlooking the pool, in the wing looking to the lake & trees, so were entertained by the monkeys visiting our balcony, along with the squirrels & birds. We could easily see birds including fish eagles & kites. Most of the monkeys run away except a couple of them, so don’t leave food or clothes on the balcony… we were amused that a male knew where to look for food through the window.

There are birdwatching & other tours which we didn’t have time for but wish we had done.

The pool is 70 metres long, & warm, with a bar near it. The gym is very good. 

A ride to Dambulla town is about 15 minutes.

If I had to comment on a negative… the light switches are in very strange places! 

Highly recommended.
title: Fantastic, immersed in nature, wonderful team. Our stay was too short!

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Such a beautiful hotel. Our room was amazing with stunning views overlooking the pool and lake, and the staff all very friendly. 
Food was lovely and the laid back atmosphere great! 
The activities looked good but unfortunately we didn’t have time to do any, maybe next time! Wished we could have stayed longer!
title: Amazing hotel with stunning views for a peaceful & relaxing stay

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Absolutely stunning pool and view. Our second experience of Jetwing hospitality on this, our first trip to Sri Lanka. Great staff, beautiful rooms. We loved it .We look forward to trying more Jetwing hospitality on our next trip. Stunning building its a real pleasure to stay here.
title: Fabulous

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Wow! The hotel is set in the most peaceful setting with rooms overlooking the pool, grounds and lake. The bedroom and bathroom were huge. Every member of staff friendly and the service was exceptional. Breakfast and dinner were served at a dining area with indoor and outdoor seating overlooking the grounds.
title: Faultless Hotel

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: We absolutely loved this modern hotel. Quiet calm location after the bustle of surrounding tourist locations. Huge room, balcony and bathrooms. Wonderful views over to the lake. Friendly, attentive staff and exceptional breakfast and evening dining. Highly recommended
title: We loved this hotel.

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel is located in the beautiful Dambulla area in front of the lake. Marvelous landscapes surround the hotel. The food was delicious, and we were given superb service from the front office and F&B. It was a very calm environment, and we heard only birds sound. Highly recommend staying here. Thank you very much!
title: Superb place to stay

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: High floor for the best views.
text:
As part of our tour of sri-lanka, we stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel room was lovely overlooking the lake in the garden block. Our room was very spacious and comfortable with a great shower and bath with a view. It was lovely sitting out early evening watching the monkeys playing in the trees,listening to the peacocks and many different birds. I could have stayed there forever with the view. 
The buffet restaurant had lots of choice for both breakfast and evening meal. Lovely to sit outside for both and listen to the wildlife. Loved the different closed areas for starters and dessert which prevents birds flying in to steal the food.
We found the hotel to be both clean and comfortable and staff welcoming and pleasant. 
I would definitely recommend and sadly not enough time to spend enjoying the facilities due to a tight schedule of our tour however we did make use of the wonderful swimming pool which had a lovely view of the grounds.
Unsure if there is any entertainment in the evening as we were shattered and retired early to get ready for another adventure the following day.
Thank you to all the staff for an enjoyable holiday.
title: A room with a view

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The floor gets wet when it rains so beware when walking and try the egg hopper it’s a must !
text: This hotel is fabulous it has a wonderful eco feel around it. As with all Jetwing hotels in Sri Lanka the staff are amazing, wonderful warm and welcoming. I couldn’t fault anything it was all top class. The food was plentiful and varied, try the egg hopper they are a revelation. The view from the dining/ breakfast room over the lake was tranquil. The bed was very comfy and the staff amazing . I know I have said that before but it’s worth saying twice !
title: Truly amazing

placeInfo/address: 295A Galle Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: Good hotel with a nice view. We had a great stay at the SOFIA COLOMBO. good staff with polite ethics and, especially, the blue court lady who made our first impression, wooow. Her smile is welcoming and pleasant, and her makeup was perfect and neat. It was the first time I had ever seen a staff worker dressed perfectly and of high quality. Her gestures and postures are so professional. Unfortunately, I couldn't capture even her name. Some staff chased us for a review and mentioned their names. But it is not good for the hotel's image. We should appreciate persons who really appreciate.
title: Good hotel with humble staff

title: Wonderful Stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr.Callum Crundwell,

Thank you for such a comprehensive review of Villa Sielen Diva! We are extremely humbled by your heartwarming comments. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us!

The Villa is meticulously designed to accentuate the views of the Indian ocean from every angle and our suites are no different. The floor to ceiling glass panels are designed to frame the endless views of the ocean perfectly.

Our chefs take great pride in their dishes whilst upholding our food principles of locality and seasonality. The menu at Sielen Diva has been curated with a lot of love and care and we are very pleased that you enjoyed our cuisine. The Villa Sielen Diva Family
placeInfo/address: 776/1 Galle-Matara Coastal Rd, Talpe 80615 Sri Lanka
text:
We recently stayed at Siemens Diva, and I cannot recommend this place anymore, if I could give it a higher review I would. 

Firstly and most importantly, the hotel is stunning as it suggests from the photographs, but what sets this place apart is the staff, Hasantha and George especially made my stay here amazing as it was my partners birthday and they put on everything amazingly and effortlessly. They go above and beyond in every aspect of your stay you feel like royalty but it is also so effortless for them and always to make your stay as comfortable as it can be. The staff across the whole property are amazing and they all deserve a mention. 

The hotel itself is on stunning grounds, immediately backing onto a stunning beach was lovely to take a stroll down. The rooms offer a view which could be put in a gallery. The pool is a great size and again gives great views. Room is cleaned daily. The massage service and other activities they offer are also top notch. 

There are so many small gestures which don’t go unnoticed from popsicles when it’s really hot, to fresh aloe Vera when you’ve been in the sun a bit too much the previous day and it these things which show the staff across the hotel care. 

Whilst I didn’t get the chefs name, he deserves a huge mention too as the food is honestly some of the best food I have ever had, especially the biryani which I highly recommend. From breakfast to dinner, you couldn’t fault a dish. 

Having stayed in places across Europe, Asia, America, I can easily state you will not receive a better service anywhere, and if there is I am yet to find it. 

The best way to finish this review is with a really big thank you as it’s deserved and i can’t wait to come back!
title: Amazing stay

text:
We stayed at Sielen Diva for a couple of nights on our honeymoon and loved it. The location is fantastic - right on the beachfront and close to the nearby towns of Unawatuna and Galle. It felt like we had our own private beach, while also having great access to the local sights and amenities. 

Our room was huge and had a lovely big bathroom. The large window also provided a fantastic sea view each morning.

We were well looked after during our stay, and the staff were very attentive. Thoughtful touches, like welcome mocktails, ice lollies, and a honeymoon cake made us feel extra special.

I would highly recommend Sielen Diva for luxury, comfort and relaxation.
title: Fantastic location, rooms and service

placeInfo/address: 776/1 Galle-Matara Coastal Rd, Talpe 80615 Sri Lanka
text:
Where do I begin? This hotel is breathtaking. The design, service, FOOD and location. 
I stayed in the Musikaya room, on the first floor with sea-facing views/ baths every morning, Also nice small touches like the slippers and open dresser area. The chef is phenomenal, I had a great prawn kottu, avocado salad and amazing breakfast choices. The location is in Thalpe between Unawatuna and Ahangama, what I liked about this is that it was an 8 min tuk tuk ride to the best yoga studio in the south (IMO) Sri Yoha, a fantastic fitness retreat centre; Makahiya fitness and the bustling bars/towns of Unawatuna/Ahangama, while also being in its own serene beachfront location.  Another thing to note is there are many tuk tuks outside the hotel so getting around is not an issue. I WILL return here. Special shout out to Boss Man George :) and Laskshita. Nothing was too much hassle. THANK YOU!!
title: Paradise Solo Trip!!

text: This is truly a small, boutique hotel of amazing architectural design. Tucked slightly down the coast (thankfully!) from Unawatuna. The whole gaff exudes class. The boss man Hasanth runs a beautifully tight ship with exceptional 5 star service running through his brilliant team to a top class chef and wonderful cocktails. The pool is outrageous and the beach with turtles (keep your eyes peeled), stilt fishermen at the end of garden and tranquility all right there. The adult kids loved the games room and the tuk tuk drivers at the end of the drive were all perfect. Thank you.
title: Exceptional

Everything in Sielen Diva is a 10.

Food is fantastic, with a variety of choices running from srilankian dishes (not to miss the curry) to more occidental choices. Tip: save time for a relaxed breakfast to enjoy it.

A must! Thant you Hasantha and all the team for making our end of trip so nice and special!

text: Our week at Sielen Diva couldn’t have been better. It’s a gorgeous space with a chic, relaxed atmosphere. A sort of neo-modernist block over the open lounge area with the crashing ocean visible from everywhere including all the rooms with their full glass walls. The hotel is right on the beach so there’s nothing to impede the view. Because of the current situation in Sri Lanka we were the only guests and had the whole place to ourselves all week. Hasantha, Akalanka and the rest of the staff are all so charming and smart and genuine and took such great care of us rspecially with the pains they took over a birthday dinner and our last night dinner.  And the food ruined all other Sri Lankan food for us it was so good. We never wanted to leave.
title: Chic relaxed atmosphere

text: Honestly didnt want to leave the property. The team and service was just excellent! View was beyond magnificent! Rooms were superb! and the property is a work of absolute art! Highly recommended for all travellers. Do yourself a favour and book now! Great for groups of friends, families and couples looking for a getaway just 2 hours south of Colombo.
title: Amazing hospitality! Didn't want to leave. Highly recommended.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear  lottespencer1,

Thank you for publishing this exceptional review of the Sielen Diva.

We are thrilled that you enjoyed your 5 night stay at the villa. As you correctly mentioned the Villa is meticulously designed to accentuate the views of the Indian ocean from every angle and our suites are no different. The floor to ceiling glass panels are designed to frame the endless views of the ocean perfectly.

We are very pleased to hear that the staff were attentive and friendly, and our tranquil atmosphere ensured a relaxing stay.

Our chefs take great pride in their dishes whilst upholding our food principles of locality and seasonality. The menu at Sielen Diva has been curated with a lot of love and care and we are very pleased that you enjoyed our cuisine.

The memories that you have taken away is a result of the passionate team here whom we are blessed with. Our staff are an extension of the Villa’s personality and love to host our guests.  We shall ensure that your kind remarks reach them. 

We hope to welcome you back again very soon.

With best wishes,

The Villa Sielen Diva Family
placeInfo/address: 776/1 Galle-Matara Coastal Rd, Talpe 80615 Sri Lanka
roomTip: All the rooms face the sea so you can't go wrong
text: We spent a delightful 5 nights at Sielen Diva with our two kids (10 and 7) in February.  The hotel itself is more like a stunning home (my son said we were 'living like Ronaldo'!) with just a few rooms, all fancing the beautiful beach and ocean.  We were greeted like family and the team could not do enough for us throughout our stay.  Our room was spacious for 4 of us, with a large bathroom.  The breakfasts were amazing (those pancakes!) as was every meal that we had at the hotel.  The pool is freshwater (not always the case) and despite it being a mostly couples hotel, no-one minded our kids enjoying the pool for hours.  The location is great as you are close to lovely beaches at Dallawella (with turtles!) and Unawatuna, as well as the beautiful fort city of Galle a bit further away.  But all within easy reach via tuktuk, which the hotel organised easily for us.  All the staff were polite and friendly, and could not do enough for us as a family.  Special mention to Charith who went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and help with every query and question, from restaurant recommendations to lost flip flops!  He made us feel like one of the Sielen Diva family.  A wonderful hotel which we will always remember fondly, and hope to return one day.  Thank you.
title: Wonderful family break at Sielen Diva

placeInfo/address: 776/1 Galle-Matara Coastal Rd, Talpe 80615 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a fantastic experience staying at Sielen Diva. It was our first stop in Sri Lanka and the hotel really is a stunning and relaxing location. Everyone that worked there was really friendly and couldn’t do enough for you! A big shout out to Hasanta who managed to work his magic to get us a table at a restaurant in Galle that was full booked which was one of the best meals we had in the country! 

Where they also went above and beyond was when we realised we had left our passport and cash in the safe after we had checked out! 🙈 By that time we had driven 2hrs down the coast so Hasanta reassured us he would keep it in the hotel safe until we returned to the area a week later. It was such a peace of mind and really appreciated! Can’t wait to return again one day and would recommend anyone to book a visit as well! Only thing I would change next time is stay longer! 🏝😁
title: Fantastic place and people! 😎

ownerResponse/text: Thank you so much for your kind comments. Great that you participated fully in our every day free demos and tours. Kevin
placeInfo/address: Ehelepola, Pallepola, Matale 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a breathtakingly beautiful place. 3 villas set in a pepper (corn) farm. Our room had a tremendous view out across coconut and other palm groves to distal hills. The pool had a great location which was located by another villa. The staff very happy to get one of the hotels tuktuks to take you. Opportunity to have bird watching tour , farm tour, cookery demo amongst other things. 
Staff lovely.
Communal dinner in the evening which was fun. Set dinner which was a bit too western perhaps.
title: Holiday

ownerResponse/text: Many thanks for your wonderfully supportive Review. We built Hilltop initially as our Family home before we developed Jim’s as a Boutique Hotel: we too love staying at Hilltop. It’s our home from home and so peaceful. Plus the amazing bird life at dawn welcomes everyone each day at Sunrise. Kevin
placeInfo/address: Ehelepola, Pallepola, Matale 21100 Sri Lanka
text: A truly delightful place to either relax or use as base to explore the sights of the cultural triangle. The beautifully appointed villas are spread out and this adds to be feeling of peace.  The staff are always on hand to serve snacks and drinks and ferry you about in one of their 4 tuk tuks. I particularly enjoyed staying at Hill Top villa which has the beautiful pool. Mango villa has some great family rooms and there is a fantastic Ayurvedic spa.  It’s a delight to explore the farm and take a tour to milk the cows and learn about all the wonderful produce - much of which is served in the restaurant. A truly memorable stay.
title: Simply Superb

ownerResponse/text:
Annie

So many thanks for your wonderful review. 

And so pleased you thoroughly enjoyed your Yoga Retreat. 

Please pass the message to your family and friends: perhaps you’ll come back ? 

Best wishes for Christmas. 

Kevin
placeInfo/address: Ehelepola, Pallepola, Matale 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed at Jim's Farm Villas in Nov 19 whilst attending a Yoga retreat. I stayed in Mango Villas. which is closest to the restaurant, Spa and Yoga Pavillion. There are three villas at the farm, each one beautiful. My room had one double bed and two singles. The electric sockets were fully UK compatible. Two spacious wardrobes. AC and ceiling fan. There was a hairdryer. shampoo, conditioner and shower gel in the bathroom.  
The restaurant was superb. Breakfast was fruit juice, fresh fruits Toast and jams, and then full English. Plenty of fresh coffee. The evening meal was read to us by Madhu the rest manager. The staff were more than happy to help with any requests we had. The water on site was fully drinkable. Each room had a umbrella to use.
The spa had plenty of excellent treatments.dressing gown provided. 
At hilltop villas there was a swimming pool, all pool towels provided.  Daily excursions on AC bus with Jims farm, 
Staff were the most friendly people i have ever met. nothing was to much trouble. 
villa manager, Jesse was very informative about everything, he even changed money for us. We had a tour of the kitchens and a tour of the working farm. 
Every day we had cake and coffee. we had a special visit from a Buddhist Monk who blessed us all. Transfer from Colombo airport 3 hours , the transfer is very smooth.  I cant wait to go back soon. Nikhil and Madhu made this a great holiday along with those whose names i cant even remember.
title: Yoga retreat in Paradise

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you so much for your support. We’re so happy that your stay was a great experience for all of your Group. 
Janet and I had huge debates re shampoo, body wash etc: I’m so pleased you were happy with our large locally sourced bottles, which can be easily refilled. Good for environment re low use of plastic plus we’re supporting local quality shampoo suppliers. 
And it’s a great Aloe Vera shampoo product plus wonderful Coconut Oil for conditioner. 
Kevin
placeInfo/address: Ehelepola, Pallepola, Matale 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Mango villas have a veranda at the front and a terrace with views at the back
text: Travelled here as a party of 6,we all agreed that Jims farm villas was the most amazing experience. Everybody from the GM to the workers on the farm made us so welcome. The rooms in Mango villas are stunning, with a fantastic view from the shower! They also give you full size bottles of shampoo etc so no need to pack your own. Meals are beautifully prepared and if you have any dietary requirements they will accommodate them. The young men that do all the cleaning and serving of meals are without exception polite and quietly attentive, they will also drive you from place to place on the farm via tuk tuk. If you want a holiday to be completely relaxing then this is the place where you can get away from it all(no TV in the room, just sounds of the jungle) this is the perfect spot.
title: Amazing experience

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Ehelepola, Pallepola, Matale 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
This place was the cherry on top of a two week trip travelling around Sri Lanka. I stayed there for three nights with two friends after travelling from Mirissa, Ella, and Kandy and it was our favourite accommodation of the whole trip. The staff were very friendly, incredibly kind and helpful - they organised a driver at short notice after our train was cancelled due to strikes, gave us a tour of the plantation, and organised a cooking demonstration.

Its a wonderful place to stay and is in an excellent location for visiting Dambulla and Sigiriya. The farm has a very relaxed atmosphere, is a beautiful place to walk and the pool is also very clean and inviting. The rooms are beautiful, clean and spacious and there are a variety of board games, a pool table and table football.

The restaurant is beautiful. We had two dinners there, one was a four course dinner which was incredible, especially the soup which my friends and I agreed was the best we had ever tasted. On our last night we ordered a Sri Lankan curry expecting one or two dishes. Instead we were served with 12 different curries plus a variety of other sides! it was the best meal we had out of the whole trip. 

Thank you to all of the staff at Jim's Farm Villas!
title: Our favourite accommodation of the whole trip!

ownerResponse/text: We are so happy you’ve found a second home at Jim’s Farm. We love hosting you and your groups. Kevin

placeInfo/address: Ehelepola, Pallepola, Matale 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a lovely stay here just after the terrible events of Easter 2019 in Sri Lanka. Under circumstances no one would wish for we were made to feel welcome and safe.  The rooms were lovely; the ambiance relaxed and the ethos was one of calm, eco-living and sustainability. The farm tour was fun; we milked cows and though the area is spread out the tuk-tuks were  always ready to move us about if needed. Great cookery demonstration and the food was delicious: whether a Sri Lankan curry feast or a sandwich.  

Jim’s Farm grew on us the longer we stayed.
title: Oasis of calm...

placeInfo/address: Ehelepola, Pallepola, Matale 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Jim's Farm Villa's for 3 nights, a family with teenagers. Beautiful rooms, extremely spacious and what a view! Delicious food and friendly staff! Special hotel with the different villas located across the farm grounds. Super hotel!

We used the hotel as a basis for the cultural triangle, but I wouldn't recommend the hotel location for that. The drives to Pollanaruwa, Sigiriya etc are still quite long. But I would definitely recommend to stay at this beautiful place and enjoy nature, the farm and do some nearby activities. We did a farm tour, which was very interesting. And I could stay forever on my balcony with a book and enjoy the views. Absolutely wonderful!

And a special thanks to the friendly staff!
title: Lovely stay!

ownerResponse/text: Jenny and family, Thanks for your very kind comments. I’ll make sure Asanka is thanked personally. We look forward to your return to Sri Lanka and Jim’s Farm Villas. Kevin
placeInfo/address: Ehelepola, Pallepola, Matale 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
From the moment we arrived, we were blown away by the welcoming staff, the stunning location and the wonderful atmosphere. We stayed in the Hilltop Villa alongside the owner, Kevin, who provided us with many a trip in his 1974 Mercedes to dinner and gave us tours of the farm and the nearby village. The villa was beautiful, clean and well-equipped. A special mention to Osana who brightened up our mornings with his lovely smile and trips to breakfast in the farm’s Tuk-Tuk. Jesse, the manager, helped organise a variety of trips and a driver to stay with us. He was also very accommodating when I became ill one day. Himself and Osana made sure I was fed, watered and comfortable - because of this, I made a speedy recovery. 
The farm’s dogs and birds are another perk of staying here - we loved Bingo! 
Dinner was created mainly using the resources on the organic farm and every night it was a surprise. I enjoyed every meal! I also loved the communal aspect as we got to know several families from across the world. 
Overall, I am counting down the seconds until I return. I had a hard time leaving! It was just beautiful.
title: A little slice of heaven

text:
We stayed here for three nights our bedroom had a whow factor fabulous vistas and a seating areas front and back. A shower with a view and I fell in love with the towel elephants it was a struggle to take them apart!
The staff so kind and helpful. Great cookery demo and tour of the farm. Fascinating with all the spices and fruit. Never expected to milk a cow.
The evening meal were great and we were with a champion bunch of other guests the communal dining worked really well and we were sorry to say goodbye.
I wouldn’t recommend the massage or facial at all. The sandwiches at lunch were average.

This place is one of the loviest place we have ever stayed. It’s been thoroughly thought out to give every guest a magical experience.
Our room was in Mango it was huge and the bathroom was spectacular with breath taking views over the jungle. The food was mouth wateringly delicious the scenery was inspiring and we learnt more about life’s bounty in 3 days than we thought imaginable.

text:
Cinnamon Lodge was our first stop after a one-night hotel stay in Colombo. It was a good intro to the charming side of Sri Lanka, this being our first visit.
The lodges were unassuming in design yet comfortable and spacious inside.
It was a relaxed place to rest after our strenuous climb up the Lion Rock the following day. The highlight for me was the bar pavilion where there were two young musicians performing during weekends.
Given the active daily sightseeing we didn't really spend much time in the hotel, unfortunately.
title: Charming, laid back and restful accomodation

Dear Guest,
Greetings From Cinnamon Lodge Habarana! 
Thank you for choosing Cinnamon Lodge Habarana in Sri Lanka for your recent getaway and for sharing your wonderful feedback with us We are delighted to hear that you found our resort to be a great place to relax and that your experience from check-in to check-out was excellent. It is fantastic to hear that our food offerings, particularly the Sri Lankan specialties, were a highlight of your trip.

Cinnamon Lodge Habarana.
placeInfo/address: Dambulla-Habarana Road Off Kandy Road, Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
roomTip: This is an excellent spot, but maybe not so convenient when it's raining heavy.
text:
We just came back from Srilanka yesterday. This was a most leisurely trip for us - 6 friends from Pune, India.. The first stop was Cinnamon Lodge, Habarana. We liked the resort from the word go, due first to it's different styled reception area, instead of a typical hotel, or even a resort, this was different, in the sense it was fully open on the front with a feeling of ancient houses of Maharashtra, India which were called as wadas. every cottage has 2 rooms, one on ground and one above. The rooms are beautiful, they have made a rare combination of privacy and company which is lovely. The lake and the swimming pool is really worth a visit, in the mornings, someone used to play flute which just breezed throughout the resort, giving a very calm feel, without disturbing. Evenings - it was western, party music. The food spread is marvellous with most of Srilankan, Indian, Chinese, Thai and western cuisine on display. The Srilankan food was superb. Mainly the hoppers, milk rice, fish curries, various symbols etc. 
The most remarkable feature was service - service like never experienced, so friendly, so helpful, and always with a smiling face. 
I would especially would like to mention Dinesh, who gave our group a real treat of a service. Our housekeeping person was also very helpful but can't recollect the name right now. 
Overall a great place if you want have a leisurely holiday. especially rewarding if you're a creative person.
title: Great ambience, food and service at Cinnamon Lodge, Habaranna

text: I recently stayed at Cinnamon Lodge Habarana, and it was truly a refreshing experience. The property blends seamlessly with its natural surroundings. You’re immersed in greenery the moment you arrive. The entire atmosphere is calm and soothing, perfect for a quiet getaway or a nature-based retreat. The service stood out. Warm, attentive, and genuinely hospitable without being intrusive. The staff made sure everything flowed smoothly, from check-in to departure. The rooms were spacious, clean, and well-appointed, with a rustic charm that matched the overall aesthetic of the lodge. I particularly enjoyed the balcony views, where I could spot birds and monkeys in the trees. It felt like being in the middle of a living forest. The buffet spread offered a decent variety, and the dining area was beautifully set, especially in the evenings. The property is vast and great for walks, with little bridges, lakes, and tree filled paths that let you take in the surroundings at your own pace.
title: A serene escape into nature

placeInfo/address: Dambulla-Habarana Road Off Kandy Road, Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Outstanding resort - very eco minded - the rooms are large and well stocked. Big comfy beds and hot showers ( needed after Sigiriya climb)
text: This is truly an outstanding hotel in Sri Lanka. The resort spreads out along a large lake with view points in the trees with views that will take your breath away - one evening we could hear the elephants on the other side of the lake - wonderful The entire area is well laid out with brick pathways taking in every inch so walking along these well maintained routes is lovely after an evening meal. The restaurant is fabulous with at least 5 separate areas of food laid out for everyone to try. I would like to mention Thakshila who took amazing care of me and introduced me to various new taste sensations - some were “different” but most were delicious. The pool is huge and the staff were welcoming and attentive. All in all my stay at Cinnamon Lodge was outstanding. If you visit Habarana  - there really is only one place to stay
title: Absolutely beautiful resort

text: I was recently a solo traveller visiting Niyagama House and Sri Lanka for the first time.  Elke and her extended family have created an incredibly special place. I also had an aerial yoga session which was fun, relaxing and she took some great photos which I will treasure.  She was so welcoming, friendly and is passionate about everything she does.  She personalised my programme, including my meals and I could not be more grateful.  The rooms were super comfortable, a real 5 star feel and my room had a balcony with stunning jungle views.  The food was delicious and I really enjoyed eating my meals looking out over the pool.  The pool really is stunning, perfect temperature, relaxing sunbeds and wonderful views of birdlife and fireflies in the evening.  Do not hestitate to book here for a truly unique experience. placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Check the website if retreats happening as then the house can be very busy. 
Going in low season is a bonus as it’s quieter
text:
If you want a peaceful serene and quiet place to switch off, do some yoga and meditate then this is the place for you.
Elke was very welcoming and friendly and very knowledgeable about yoga and healing therapies. 
The house is beautiful with lovely courtyard in the centre and rooms on top floor all around, most with balconies but some quiet open spaces to sit and read. 
Rooms were comfortable and typical Sri Lankan wooden furniture for beds, wardrobes etc. 
We did Yin, Hatha and Aerial yoga sessions with Elke which are charged additionally and early morning meditation is free. 
Aerial yoga was an exhilarating experience and a must try as Elke is very patient and very safe teacher. 
I also did some EFT - tapping sessions with her which was very helpful. 
The staff are all lovely as they are part of the family and Prasad who took care of all our needs was amazing, so kind and patient. 
Food can be ordered A la Carte or can pay $18 for selected meals and some hot drinks included. 
We had authentic Sri Lankan curries a few nights which were very tasty and delicious. 
It’s a good place to unwind and rest and the options to choose to do the yoga practices and meditation is great.
Location is very good, only about 15 minutes to Galle by Tuk Tuk and couple of hours from Colombo.
title: Oasis of Tranquility and calmness 🙏

Elke

text: Absolutely gorgeous and relaxing holiday at Niyagama. This was our second visit and I think it will become an annual trip to rejuvenate and relax. The house, pool and general setting at stunning. You can sit in your balcony or by the pool and see nothing but trees full of monkeys and birds. Thet food was delicious and varied, healthy fresh fruit breakfasts, herb omelettes, Sri Lankan breakfasts such as coconut rice , fresh fruit juice etc, the dinners were equally lovely and always with such thoughtful service from Prasad. Elke's yoga classes were a masterclass in gentle encouragement and were changed each day to keep things challenging.we made considerable progress in just one week and my husband healed two quite significant muscular skeletal issues he had arrived with doing 2 yoga classes a day. Trips to Galle are easy in the hotels tuk tuk but we actually stayed out most of the time because it was simply so lovely! Very very highly recommend this very special place. You will come away feeling like a new person!

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
There are truly no words to fully describe how incredible my stay at Niyagama House was. It was an oasis of calm and beauty, providing the perfect space for relaxation and rejuvenation. After a busy year, I came here to unwind before continuing my travels around Sri Lanka, and it exceeded all my expectations. The peaceful surroundings, impeccable service, and wonderful amenities made it an unforgettable experience.

* Elke answered all of my questions prior to booking so I was very clear on what I was booking and how much it would cost. I did loads to research prior to booking. 
* Elke and her team were incredibly welcoming from the moment I arrived. Their kindness made me feel completely at home.
* The house is stunning, with several balconies that offer breathtaking views of the serene landscape. It even has a charming little library.
* My bedroom was the perfect retreat, featuring a comfortable bed, mosquito net, and a lovely deck where I could enjoy my morning tea while watching monkeys play in the trees.
* I spent many hours by the beautiful pool, swimming at my leisure, surrounded by nature's tranquility.
* A peaceful walk around the area gave me the chance to greet the friendly, smiling locals.
* The food was absolutely delicious and full of flavor. It was served on the verandah, with views of the pool and trees, making every meal feel special. There are no restaurants nearby, but the food here was some of the best I had during my entire trip.
*  I arranged for a local masseuse to visit, and the massage was wonderfully relaxing, adding to the overall rejuvenating experience.
* The house is about 20 minutes by tuk-tuk from Galle Fort, which I visited a couple of times during my 10-day stay.
*  As a beginner, I took part in Elke’s Yin yoga class, and she was incredibly attentive and supportive. The morning meditation was also a peaceful start to each day. There are various packages available for yoga and meditation, or you can simply relax and enjoy the stay.

While Niyagama House was the most expensive place I stayed during my month in Sri Lanka, it was by far the best. 

Overall, I absolutely loved my time at Niyagama House and will definitely make it a priority to return in the future.
title: A Serene Escape

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We came upon Niyagama by chance and can't believe our luck!

Elke and her team were warm, lovely hosts. The house and our bedroom were comfortable and beautiful, as are the pool and surroundings. A local walk offers the opportunity to see locals with their ready smiles. It is about 20 mins to Galle Fort by tuk tuk (available from the hotel) but offers a calm oasis immersed in nature. The food was healthy and fabulous and served with care in a lovely setting.

 As a novice to yoga, and with a bit of kind, gentle  encouragement, I tried out Elke's Yin yoga class,  She was attentive, motivating and supportive and I found it relaxing and rewarding. I also had a heavenly massage.

You cannot fail to be enchanted by this place. Highly recommended!
title: A wonderful, serene, friendly haven

text:
I spent 10 days at Niyagama house in November on a Mindset Yoga Retreat. This was the most wonderful experience in an ideal setting. It was a peaceful, nurturing, and luxurious resort with wonderful food, massages, pool and staff. 
If you are looking to just chill and relax with day trips into the area it’s perfect and also wonderful to come home to from a day out exploring.
The yoga was awesome! We tried the aerial yoga which was great.
The week long program of mindset yoga and mindfulness training with Elke was integral to my making positive life changes. I would highly recommend both the resort and the packages available even if you could only stay a few nights.
title: Mindset Yoga Retreat

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Ich komme gerade aus dem Niyagama House von Elke de Silva, wo ich mit einer geschätzten Kollegin unser erstes gemeinsames Retreat gegeben habe. Was mir vorher nicht klar war, dass es auch für unsere Gastgeberin das erste Retreat in ihrem neuen großen wunderschönen Raum war. Ich weiß gar nicht, wo ich anfangen kann mit meinem Lob und Teilen, denn an diesem Ort hat einfach alles für mich und uns gestimmt: Vom Empfang der Gastgeberin Elke, über die liebevoll und individuell gestalteten und sehr gepflegten Zimmer (jeden Tag bekommst du wunderschöne frische Blüten im Zimmer arrangiert) über den unfassbar schönen, großzügigen Retreat-Raum, der rundum verglast mit Fenstern, die sich alle öffnen lassen, einen Panoramablick in den Dschungel bietet, bis hin zu entspannenden Pausen am herrlichen Pool. Die einheimische Küche hat uns jeden Tag mit köstlichen Currys verwöhnt, ganz zu schweigen vom Sri Lankanischen Frühstück, das ich absolut lieben gelernt habe. Jeden Morgen beim Frühstück besucht Elke jeden einzelnen Tisch, erkundigt sich, ob etwas fehlt, hört nach, welche Pläne für den Tag anstehen, gibt super wertvolle Tipps, arrangiert Fahrten, erfüllt Sonderwünsche und ist einfach immer für alles ansprechbar. Das Gleiche gilt für ihr super professionelles und gleichzeitig herzliches Team. Hier werden Wünsche erfüllt, bevor du sie überhaupt ausgesprochen hast. Ganz gleich, ob du hier ein Retreat veranstalten willst, an einem der Angebote vor Ort teilnehmen magst oder einfach nur eine Zeit der Entspannung suchst: Niyagama House und Elke sind auf allen Ebenen eine hundertprozentige Empfehlung!
title: Niyagama House: Außergewöhnliches Retreat- und Entspannungs-Highlight im Süden Sri Lankas

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Niyagama House is by far the most beautiful and peaceful retreat we've ever visited. We were thrilled to return for the fourth time. Practicing yoga with Elke is always a highlight—she has an extensive knowledge of yoga and leads inspiring classes, but what truly sets her apart is her sweetness, humility, and wonderful sense of humor. Elke is the perfect hostess.
The shalas are the most beautiful spaces we've ever practiced in, and the house, with its stunning architecture, is impeccably clean. The pool and pool area are top-notch, and the food is absolutely delicious. A walk through the lush garden, surrounded by a variety of plants, birds, and monkeys, only adds to the sense of tranquility.
Niyagama House is the ideal place to find peace of mind, calm, and balance. We're already looking forward to our next visit!
title: Best retreat in Sri lanka - Peaceful Paradise!!!!

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Dieses wunderbare Hotel empfängt schon mit einer offenen Rezeption und insgesamt mit sehr ansprechender Architektur. Check in war smooth Dank sehr freundlichen Personal. Die Zimmer sind riesig. Wir hatten Zugang  zum ebenfalls riesigen Balkon von Bad und Zimmer. Clever: die Kleiderschränke lassen sich bad- und zimmerseitig öffnen. Das Restaurant ‘im Garten’ ist kompletten offen und bietet eine tolle Atmosphäre. Auch hier sehr zuvorkommendes Personal. Das Frühstück und Abendessen sind super - für jeden etwas dabei. Sensationell der 70m Pool. Ideal zum relaxen vor oder nach den Ausflügen.
title: Luxuriöser Ausgangspunkt zur Erkundung des Kulturdreiecks

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We were here for 3 nights whilst exploring the Cultural Triangle. We were fortunate to have a room with a balcony overlooking the garden and the lake. It was a beautiful setting and we awoke each morning to the most amazing bird song.  Our room was spacious and comfortable. The reception staff were charming and made us feel welcome, the staff in the main restaurant were similarly friendly and very accommodating. We did try the Chinese restaurant on the top floor on one occasion but we were very disappointed in the food and although not busy the service was slow. The buffet breakfasts provided an amazing choice of fruit, cooked food, cold meats, cereals etc. Something for everyone’s taste. 

The hotel is very eco conscious with their own solar panels as well as a water purification plant. Plenty of fresh water was available in refillable bottles. 

But best of all were the housekeeping staff. They never seemed to stop work and yet were always cheerful and full of fun. On our last evening we returned to find an elephant made out of a towel on our bed along with flowers and ‘Goodbye’ written in grass stems. It made us smile - such a lovely touch.
title: A beautiful location, a lovely hotel and brilliant housekeeping

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our base for a few days whilst we went and explored the surrounding areas. 

Cannot fault the staff, the room (very spacious and modern) or the food (lots of salads and fruit unlike in other hotels that we have stayed at as part of our trip). 

I would highly recommend this. There are some other well known hotels and chains in Sri Lanka that have a lot to learn from this hotel.
title: Fantastic peaceful setting and excellent hotel

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:

All linen and items provided
Thought for a new hotel would be great to have some usb charging outlets 
View from the rooms are spectacular 
Swimming pool was wonderful easy steps to walk it 
All meals very good and all staff very helpful 
You could not fault this hotel or staff
title: Just wonderful

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The restaurant can get busy about 8pm
text:
A modern hotel with modern up to date facilities.
The hotel is set a little away from the main road and offers a peaceful retreat.  The staff are helpful and always have a smile on their face.  
Our room was luxurious with a great view of the lake, garden and pool.  Although we didn’t use the pool, it looked very inviting.
There are indoor and outdoor bars and a large open restaurant adjacent to and opening onto the garden.  There is an A La Carte or buffet option: both offering delicious food and a variety of options.
This is a hotel where large tour groups may use, but the space is plentiful.  We found this not to be off-putting.
Certainly a great hotel to use to explore Dambulla, Polanuruwa and Anuradhapura.
title: A modern hotel of quality

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka

text: What a gem of a place. Super rooms, staff, meals, facilities. Just wow. We stayed 3 nights during our tour. Nothing bad can be said about this hotel. Bar and meal prices reasonable for this standard of accommodation. Didn't want to leave. Recommended

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, Greetings from Jetwing Lake!

Thank you so much for sharing your wonderful experience at Jetwing Lake! We're thrilled to hear that you had such a fantastic stay, from the warm and welcoming greeting to the stunning room upgrade. It's always great to know that the little touches, like the politeness of the staff and the gorgeous view from your balcony, helped make your time even more special.

We're also glad you enjoyed the food, especially the Sri Lankan dishes and the Egg Hoppers! The atmosphere with the fire torches really adds to the experience, and it's great to know that both your dining experiences and the excursions, like the visit to Sigiriya Rock and the safari at Minneriya National Park, were memorable.

Your comments on the cleanliness, eco-friendly initiatives, and the professionalism of the staff truly reflect the essence of what Jetwing Lake aims to provide. We’re so happy you had the chance to appreciate both the service and the sustainable practices. We hope you’ll return to one of the Jetwing hotels for more amazing experiences, and we’re delighted that you had such a great time overall.

Thank you again for the thoughtful review, and we wish you many more unforgettable adventures!

Ayubowan! (May you live a long life!)

Nalin Herath
Deputy General Manager
Jetwing Lake
placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: A room on the first floor gives you a great pool & lake view
text:
After over a day travelling from the UK, Jetwing Lake was our first hotel stop for 2 nights and our first proper taste of Sri Lanka. On arrival we had the politest greeting with drinks & snacks, received a tour of the hotel and was shown to our room - a complimentary upgrade to the super deluxe.  When the young lady asked if it was ok to come into the room and then took her shoes off, we knew we were on holiday and we knew this hotel, and Sri Lanka in general, was going to be epic. 

After getting our head around the size of the room, the gorgeous view from our balcony over the pool & lake, the huge bathroom and the secret cupboard (I'll leave that as a surprise) we headed for a wander around the lake and to the bar for a celebratory drink where we were met with the same high level of service from the bar staff. One drink quickly turned into three or four.

Dinner time was fantastic and we dived into anything & everything Sri Lankan - all of it tasted so good.  We were half board for info and the food was buffet style for us. They lit fire torches outside adding to the atmosphere. Safe to say we slept well on night one ready for our first excursion of the holiday the next day.

Jetwing Lake is perfectly located for Sigiriya Rock which we went to the following morning. We then had a few hours relaxing by the amazing pool watching the birdlife, and then in the  afternoon we had our first safari close by at Minneriya National Park.

Our second evening and the following breakfast was just good as the first. During this breakfast we also ventured into the world of Egg Hoppers.  You have to try them!  The lady cooking the Egg Hoppers deserves a shout out for her friendliness, and cooking skills of course. 

The setting is beautiful and unlike anywhere we had stayed before and the level of cleaniness all around the hotel & gardens is definitely worth mentioning. Our room was spotlessly cleaned during our stay. Every member of staff we spoke to was polite & friendly & professional, from cleaners & gardeners to reception & restaurant staff. The sustainability & eco side of the hotel is also worth mentioning and it was nice to stay somewhere which has a real commitment to it.  Most of it you don't see but the little things, like water & bathroom condiments being refilled in glass bottles, I'm sure makes a noticeable difference.

From Jetwing Lake we went on to stay at Jewtwing St Andrews and Jetwing Yala later in the holiday and each of these hotels, although both different in style, was equally as good. I would highly recommend staying at any of these Jetwing hotels.
title: A great start to the best holiday ever!

placeInfo/address: Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We wondered when we booked that this hotel might be a bit too much of a concrete block placed in paradise but booked because of its isolation and convenient location. 
Sure it is a modern building but it is keen to openly support sustainability and make as little impact as possible. The rooms and facilities were contemporary and spotless. The buffet on half board was very high quality and also al la carte reasonably priced. Drinks prices average for high end hotels. 
Used by lots of tour groups that they handle well and we never queued at all.  
Overall, smart, clean and functional hotel with attentive, smiling staff everywhere. 
One tip is to take an early evening cycle on their free bikes or walk with a camera around the lake. The bird life is amazing. 
Finally we fully expected to be mauled by mosquitoes given the lakeside location and our propensity for waking. I did not see a single big mosquito over 3 days and did not get bitten once!
title: Contemporary and functional luxury hotel in wonderful lakeside setting.

text:
A perfect bedroom with a morning view of the lake and the distant misty mountains, accompanied by nature's bird orchestra. We saw huge brown kites. We were even visited by a troop of monkeys. 
The bed itself was supportive yet yielding. The room had a big bath as well as a separate shower. Perfect.
The food was varied, well-presented and tasty. The morning coffee was too weak for us, but they brought our own pot with a stronger brew.
We took a 6am bird walk with a local guide which was amazing. The lakeside is abundant with birds of many kinds.
All staff were nice except the one who told me wouldn't be interested in the gym because I have a big belly. He was rude. 
The location means you need a driver, or taxis, or your own vehicle.
title: Tranquility by the lake

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for choosing Cinnamon Lodge Habarana during your recent trip to Sri Lanka and for taking the time to share such a detailed review. We're truly delighted to hear that you loved our location, appreciating its setting within a nature reserve, the peaceful walks around the lakes, and the wildlife encounters with monitor lizards.

It's wonderful to know you found your deluxe room great, with its colonial feel, lovely colours, comfortable bed, and effective air-conditioning. We're also glad you enjoyed the good shower in your bathroom, despite it being a little dated. We're particularly pleased to hear that our pool was the best of the Cinnamon properties you experienced and that you had no trouble with sunbeds.

We sincerely appreciate your candid feedback regarding the dining experience. We understand that the buffet style may not suit all guests, and we regret that our à la carte option didn't feel like a comfortable alternative for you as a couple. Your comments about the bar service, the comfort of the seats, and the visible broken concrete in the bar area are also very valuable. Please be assured that we've taken note of these points for our ongoing improvements, as we continuously strive to enhance our guest experience.

Despite these points, we're very happy that you still found the overall look of the place great, especially our open-plan and outdoor reception area, and that you had a lovely stay overall.

We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back to Cinnamon Lodge Habarana in the future, providing an even more seamless and enjoyable experience.

Warm regards,

Tharindu Ekanayake
Executive - Guest Services
Cinnamon Lodge Habarana
placeInfo/address: Dambulla-Habarana Road Off Kandy Road, Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed in 3 Cinnamons on recent trip to Sri Lanka, we loved this location. Situated in the middle of a nature reserve and we did walk round the hotel grounds, next to lakes which was very peaceful.  We stayed in a delux-room, top of one of the chalets and the bedroom itself was great. Colonial feel, lovely colours, comfortable bed and air-con worked, a 5 minute walk from the main restaurant and bar, a walk where we did occasionally meet some wildlife in the form of the ubiquitous monitor lizards which was fun. Good shower in bathroom which was a little dated, but totally fine.  It’s a big place & caters for large tour company tours so as a couple we weren’t too interested in the large buffet style option for dinner. They don’t really cater for anything else; an a-la-carte option in a separate room/area was available, but we would have been eating on our own and this felt a bit "second class citizen" so we went out to nearby restaurants which suited us much better. Pool was the best of the ones we experienced at Cinnamons and we had no trouble getting a sun-bed. Bar service was a bit slow, the seats quite uncomfortable without cushions, and the bar area had a fair bit of broken concrete visible which spoiled the look a little. Still, the overall look of the place is great and we loved the open plan & outside reception area.   One annoying point was the inconsistency of getting a glass of water at breakfast, some gave you one without question, others charged you for a bottle of water which is pretty annoying at breakfast. Not sure why it was so hit and miss for the water. Anyway, lovely place to stay overall.
title: Beautiful lodge-style accomonation on a nature reserve

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently spent ten days at Niyagama House at a mindset yoga retreat.  This included daily yoga practices in the morning and late afternoon, morning meditation sessions and learning about self help through EFT practice.  It was a truly wonderful time of calm and focus, together with improving my flexibility and learning and discovery through the EFT process.  Elke was a patient and compassionate teacher throughout our time and I would highly recommend this retreat.

Even if you are not a yogi I would recommend Niyagama house as a beautiful oasis of calm amongst the tea plantations with amazing birdlife.  Elke's husband is also the chef, who prepared  delicious and varied Sri Lankan dishes throughout our stay.  The accommodation was also lovely.  I would recommend the a room with a balcony to experience the wonderful birdlife if you are an early riser and you may also see a few monkeys in the trees!
title: A wonderful yoga retreat in the tea plantations

text: I just loved my 4 days and nights at Niyagama House. Glorious lush hilltop  surroundings form the setting for this sanctuary of stillness, peace, and quiet. Even the  giant teak bedroom doors self close with a hush.....as do the toilet seats! No detail left unconsidered. The small  but attentive service team are gently unobtrusive but somehow always there when required.... a pot of tea or cooling lime juice by the sparkling clean pool for example. Food is great,  the grilled fresh fish particularly recommended.I ate every meal there, fresh flowers greeting me at every meal 🙏  I did take the easily arranged 20 minute tuktuk ride into Galle but after just an hour longed to get back to Niyagama House. Made use of the well equipped yoga room.......walking barefoot across the cooling black marble floor of the inner courtyard an abiding memory. Amazing!
title: Stillness, and peace lovers, this is for you 🤗

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I was lucky to be able to spend two weeks at the beautiful Niyagama House. After doing lots of research about a place to stay, I decided on this guesthouse as it fulfilled my requirements - beautiful clean accommodation, peaceful environment, delicious food, highly rated yoga classes, great service. After my time here, I can say that it was even better than anticipated.

This guesthouse on a tea plantation is a little paradise. In the mornings I would drink my cup of coffee on the balcony while listening to and watching the incredible surrounding nature - monkeys climbing on the trees and birds chirping.

The hotel is beautifully constructed and the family who runs it maintains it meticulously. The food in the restaurant is on par with the best as the chef is very skilled. Everybody who works here is friendly and treats you very well.

Hatha, aerial and yin yoga is all offered here. Elke, the owner and yoga instructor, is a superb teacher who can adjust to all skill levels and quickly helped me improve my skills.

Galle Fort is a fun 20 minutes Tuk Tuk ride away. I was considering staying there for a couple of days, but I'm glad I didn't as the Sri Lankan heat is more unbearable in town. Visiting Galle Fort for a few hours was enough and I was glad to return to the Niyagama House pool afterwards which is surrounded by nature.

Overall, I highly recommend Niyagama House - it is an upscale hotel without the upscale price tag. Contact the hotel directly for the best price. This unique and special guesthouse is also great for long term stays.
title: Unique and special guesthouse

Ich werde euren Review jetzt ins Englische übersetzen und ausgedruckt in die Küche hängen, damit ihn das gesamte Team geniessen kann :-).

Alles Liebe und Gute für euch und namaste von der Teeplantage,
Elke
placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir haben uns im Niyagama-Haus absolut wohl gefühlt. Das Personal ist überaus freundlich und hilfsbereit. Das Essen hervorragend. In ganz Sri Lanka haben wir nicht so gut gegessen.Der Yoga Unterricht bei Elke ist sehr professionell. Sie macht das aus Leidenschaft,diese Energie überträgt sich auf jeden Teilnehmer. Es entsteht auch kein Zwang,auch wenn eine bereits gefällte Entscheidung kurzfristig geändert wird. Wir konnten sofort im ganzen Haus die Spirituelle Atmosphäre die von der Freundlichkeit und Wärme der Gastgeber ausgeht spüren.
Tips for other travellers	Wenn du nicht unbedingt ans Meer willst,ist es ein herrlicher Ort der Ruhe und Entspannung. Gleichzeitig hast du die Möglichkeit etwas für deinen Körper zu tun.Eine perfekte Kombination um dem Stress des Alltags auszugleichen. Es gibt einen kleinen Rundweg ums Haus und als Ausflugsziel ist die historische Innenstadt
title: Traumhaft Schön

ownerResponse/text:
Liebe Sandra,
vielen lieben Dank für deinen wunderbaren Review!
Es war eine eine tolle Auszeichunung für uns, dass du nach deinen bereits gebuchten drei Wochen noch eine weitere Woche verlängert hast, da du dich hier so gut erholen konntest. 
Für den Service, der wirklich ein paar Mal zu wünschen übrig liess, möchte ich mich auch nachträglich nochmals entschuldigen. Unser neuer Housekeeping Boy ist noch nicht ganz ausgebildet, und es wurde versäumt, dessen Arbeit zu überprüfen.
Umso mehr freue ich mich, dass dir die tropische Natur, unser Essen und mein Yoga gut gefallen haben.

Ich wünsche dir alles Liebe und Gute und einen erfolgreichen Start nach deiner kleinen, erholsamen Auszeit!
Sonnige Grüsse von der Teeplantage,
Elke
placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Dran denken: falls Alkohol gewünscht, selber mitbringen. Entschleunigung geniessen.
text: Habe wunderbare Wochen (!) im NiyagamaHouse verbracht. Yoga mit Elke wirklich empfehlenswert. AirYoga unbedingt ausprobieren! Tolles RubyZimmer (schlafen ohne Klimaanlage dank der 2 Fenster etwas frische Luft möglich bei offenen Fenstern in der Nacht). Affen direkt beim Haus beobachten, Naturkino pur. Preislich schon eher teuer. Teils ist die Singalesische Crew etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig, nicht immer sehr zuvorkommend. Der Pool mit Süsswasser wunderbar und das Essen immer frisch zubereitet, sehr empfehlenswert. TukTukDriver vom Haus sicherer und ortskundiger, ruhiger Fahrer. Rundum empfehlenswert! Sehr erholsam. In 25Min mit TukTuk am Strand.
title: Einzigartiges Haus in der Teeplantage

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The breakfasts are wonderful
text: We loved being here. The house is utterly gorgeous. The swimming pool vast. The vegetation all around us mature and tropical. Prassad was a sophisticated waiter and also warm - he taught my kid how to make all sorts of animal shaped napkins. Elke is an impressive woman. An architect, she created this paradise with attention to every detail. The design on the windows, the heavy cutlery, everything screams of quality. She is also a thoughtful yoga teacher and I thoroughly enjoyed the meditation and yoga sessions overlooking the beautiful grounds. Our marble floored bedroom was beautiful and generous. The whole place whispers tranquility. We’ll definitely come again.
title: Warm, sophisticated tea plantation retreat heaven

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Bereits der erste Kontakt mit Elke via WhatsApp hat mich bestätigt, dass das Niyagama House der richtige Ort für meinen Urlaub ist! Und es war so viel mehr. Es ist ein tolles Refugium im Kolonialstil für alle, die Ruhe und Natur mitten im Dschungel Sri Lankas suchen. Es ist sehr geschmackvoll und hochwertig eingerichtet und jede Ecke lädt zum Verweilen ein. Das Sri-lankische Essen ist einfach nur ein Traum und dazu noch gesund. Darüber hinaus ist Elke eine super erfahrene Yogalehrerin, die mich innerhalb der acht Tage, die ich zu Gast war, so viel weiter in meiner Praxis gebracht hat. Ich habe mich rundum wohl gefühlt an diesem Ort, der mit so viel Liebe zum Detail gestaltet wurde und unterhalten wird. Es hat mir einfach an nichts gefehlt.
title: Wunschlos glücklich im Paradies

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
If mosquitos love you a lot - bring some deit!
Don't be in a hurry. Give yourself some time to really enjoy this spot and it´s nature.
text:
I was looking for a place to relax and unwind and found paradise in the midst of the jungle. 
Niyagama House offers the perfect mix of tranquility & luxury. Everything is perfectly blended into nature - as if it belonged there. 
You can easily unwind on the terrace, by the pool or walking the plantation itself. It´s stunningly beautiful. The super attentive staff is always around to cater your needs. Fresh juices, snacks, lunch or dinner all is cooked fresh and upon request. 

If you feel the need to jump into the Indian ocean - it´s just a fun tuktuk ride away. Elke will give you the perfect spots on where to eat, enjoy the sunset or go for a swim. 

It´s also the perfect spot to host you very own retreat. Next time I´ll book niyagama house for my very own Retreat on the tea plantation.

Don´t miss out on this very special place.
title: (Re)treat yourself!

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: The place is beautiful! I spent my days doing yoga, swimming and walking. The service and hospitality was excellent. The food was delicious! I highly recommend for anyone looking to do a yoga retreat!
title: Excellent service, excellent yoga, idyllic scenary!

roomTip: Look at the chilli signs on food labels, they get very hot!
text:
We had a wonderful three night stay.
The grounds are very well looked after and our room was lovely.
We enjoyed watching the monkeys play.
The food was quite varied and tasty but so make sure you pay attention to how many chillis are on food labels as it does get very hot!!
A special mention to Chamindu who remembered our room number and always took time to talk to us about our day and plans for the next day.
We enjoyed the swimming pool, it is not often they go that deep!
title: Lovely 3 night stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you so much for your incredibly detailed and positive review of your recent stay at Cinnamon Lodge Habarana!

We're delighted to hear that despite the drive from Colombo, you found our location to be a perfect hub for exploring the ancient capitals, Sigiriya, and the surrounding nature parks. It truly is an ideal base for discovery.

It's wonderful to know that our Deluxe Suite perfectly accommodated your party of four with its spacious two floors and common areas, and that you enjoyed the balconies. We are especially thrilled that the dedicated butler service was a pleasant surprise and that Asanka made your stay so comfortable and memorable. We'll be sure to pass on your high praise to him directly for being so helpful and always a step ahead!

We're also pleased that you loved how our hotel blends seamlessly with nature, offering you the chance to spot wildlife and enjoy tranquil strolls around the lake. It's a key part of the unique experience we offer.

Your compliments on our delicious breakfasts and dinners, with their large variety of local and continental options, are much appreciated. We're also glad you found our staff friendly and very attentive, and that our currency exchange service was convenient for you.

Thank you once again for choosing Cinnamon Lodge Habarana and for sharing such valuable feedback. We hope to welcome you back for another exceptional stay in the heart of Sri Lanka's cultural triangle!

Warm regards,

Tharindu Ekanayake
Executive - Guest Services
placeInfo/address: Dambulla-Habarana Road Off Kandy Road, Habarana 50150 Sri Lanka
text:
The location is long a drive from Colombo airport, but is a perfect hub to visit ancient capitals Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa, Sigiriya or go on a safari to the numerous nature parks around the area.

We booked Deluxe Suite directly from hotel website, it was perfect for a company of four as it had two bedroom on two floors plenty of common space a balconies.
The surprise about the suite was that the guests get a butler for the stay. We were happy that Asanka was there for us - he was extremely helpful and was a step ahead of us (dinner reservations, lunch snacks, transfers) and made the stay comfortable and memorable.

We loved the hotel as it was perfectly blended in the nature surrounding it. You have a chance to spot giant squirrels, various birds and monkeys, stroll along the trail around the lake.

The breakfasts and dinners were delicious with a large variety of local and continental options from a buffet or a la carte. 

The staff is friendly and very attentive.
You can exchange dollars, euros and pounds at the reception for sri lankan rupees
title: Perfect hub for vacation

text: This was the first of four hotels we stayed in, during our time in Sri Lanka and it was beautiful. It is accessed via a long driveway, through lovely gardens to the main reception. The rooms are lodges set in the gardens near a large lake. Ours was a ground floor deluxe room, which was beautifully decorated and very spacious. We also had an outside sitting space which overlooked the lake which was quiet and tranquil. The hotels main dining area, bar and lounge were a short stroll through the gardens.  The food was buffet style and there was plenty to choose from and it was all delicious. This hotel was outstanding and we absolutely loved the location. I would definitely return should we ever go back to Sri Lanka and would also highly recommend to others, a truly wonderful stay.
title: Beautiful hotel in wonderful surroundings.
