placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed in March for the fourth time in Niyagama House and it was so wonderful to see, how well they did take care of the property during the last three difficult years! Everything was spotless, new fabrics with bright colors, and the service as professional as we remembered it.

Our week was filled with energizing yoga, tasty and healthy breakfasts, relaxing massages, and excursions to Galle and the Indian Ocean. I found that one big PLUs of Niyagama House is that the guest relation is organizing all transports for you. The same tuk-tuk driver is picking you up from the beach and you don’t need to organize it yourself.
We are wishing Niyagama House only the very best for its future – and we will come BACK :-)
title: Back in paradise AGAIN

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: The Niyagama House is a true gem. It’s an oasis up on a hill from Galle, surrounded by birds and a beautiful tea plantation. It has the feel of being in a villa with many lovely nooks to read or just relax. The grounds and pool are amazing, and every room is beautifully designed and maintained with Sri Lankan style furnishings and textiles. AC is provided, but my favorite thing is sleeping under the four poster canopy of a mosquito net with the doors open to the sounds of crickets and frogs with fireflies all around. Elke, the owner, and Prasad are always nearby to provide suggestions or assistance. The food is delicious and the pool is divine. Highly recommend!
title: A true gem

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Niyagama house is a wonderful experience. First of all the colonial-style house situated on top of a hill -- such a quaint beautiful location! And even more so when you swim in their big infinity pool which stretches into a quiet valley full of bushes, trees and all kinds of birds! They come to drink and swim here. Which indeed makes the place kind of a paradise for nature and bird lovers. 

Apart from that Niyagama house has friendly staff and great fruit lassis :). Elke who feels like the heart of Niyagama is warm and radiates something very warm, healthy and grounded. I picture her among her dogs, which are also part of the hotel. 

If you want to relax and get away or join a mindfulness training and turn your life around -- Niyagama house is the place. 

Thank you Niyagama.
title: Infinity for nature and bird lovers

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Finally I found this wonderful place where I could really come to rest. The daily Yogaclasses with Elke were wonderful and i learned a lot. 
The rooms are beautiful and equipped with everything your heart desires. Every day the staff made them new even in the evening and it smelled very fresh. The massages were great and relaxing. All the staff very attentive, friendly and professional. I had a wonderful time and will be back :) Thank you Elke!
title: Paradise

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: What a great retreat! I could totally relax and re-energize some days after my round trip through this amazing country. The owners did use the last year to renovate the house and it feels like it was never closed. Healthy curries (they adjusted the spiciness to my taste), wonderful Hatha, Yin, and Aerial yoga classes, the amazing pool and just a short tuktuk drive to the beach or to Galle Fort (they organized it to be the same driver, so I was feeling very safe). Thanks to the super service I felt like a princess! It was a perfect mix! Thank you so much!

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Spent at Niyagama House 4 days / 3 nights (with our 3 kids). This place is a must when travelling to Sri Lanka. Close to Galle city. Great pool, delicious b-fast / diner. Surrounded by nature. When staying here, you also support a place that knows how to treat the nature. 100 % recommended!
title: Max. satisfaction!

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: Excellent break at this lovely small hotel. The staff were great, attentive but not over intrusive. Had a very informative tour of the surrounding tea plantation along with the various fruits etc. It is an 8 bedroomed colonial style building with the restaurant on the veranda overlooking the infinity pool onto the forest where you can witness the monkeys jumping from tree to trees. The owner Elke along with Prasad and all the staff make sure you have an enjoyable stay. It does not have an alcohol license but they will arrange for  tuk-tuk to pick up anything you want. It is a little off the beaten track but if you want a relaxing quiet base it is perfect. Probably the most enjoyable place we stayed in Sri Lanka.
title: Excellent stay

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Choose a balcony room is available.
Purchase alcohol in duty free on arrival
text:
From the moment my husband and I arrived we felt like we were in a little piece of paradise. The place is so calm and peaceful and we were exceptionally lucky to be the only guests here for a couple of days. We stayed for a total of 4 nights. We really appreciated the wet towel and fresh coconut on arrival. We were very kindly upgraded to a balcony room which I enjoyed drinking a cup of tea on each morning and listening/watching the monkeys and the birds. The swimming pool is huge and big enough for exercising in. The food here was very tasty. We particularly enjoyed trying a new Sri lankan dish each morning for breakfast. Janika (waiter) was particularly attentive to all of our needs without being intrusive. The staff in general at Niyagama House are gentle and friendly. Elke is a beautiful soul who has an air of calmness and kindness about her. She has designed a beautiful property that has western comforts yet in the middle of a tea plantation in Sri Lanka with all the beauty of nature this brings. We also enjoyed trying a couple of yoga classes with Elke. She is an excellent teacher and was able to find a style that my husband and I as beginners were comfortable with. I enjoyed these classes so much that I feel inspired to begin regular classes back at home. During our time at Niyagama House we both tried Ayurvedic massages. I had a 60 minute massage and my husband a 90minute massage. He enjoyed his massage so much that he had a second one two days later. Niyagama House was part of our honeymoon stay and the staff went above and beyond to make this extra special for us with flowers on our bed and dinner table each evening. The bedroom itself is big and spacious with an excellent mosquito net so we did not have any bug bites during the night. Everything was very clean. We really appreciated that the bed was prepared for sleeping each night with beautiful flowers whilst we went for dinner. 
My husband and I have just returned from our time in Niyagama House. We were very sad to leave but feel very relaxed and that our stresses have melted away after 4 wonderful nights. I can't recommend this place enough. We have stayed in resorts in Maldives, Dubai, Vietnam, Mexico amongst others and Niyagama House tops the list of being the best value, most beautiful location and overall the most excellent experience! We are already thinking about our return visit. Thank you so much Elke and your team for making our honeymoon stay so special. 

Top tips 
Stay for at least 3 nights to enjoy the full experience. 
Book a balcony room if available to experience drinking tea and watching the monkeys in the morning. If no room is available however there is a beautiful shared balcony space you can use. 
My husband and I don't eat much seafood but it looked tasty! We can highly recommend the vegetable curries. 
If you have enough time I recommend a trip to Galle Fort for dinner, walk and watch the sunset with an ice-cream. Also be sure to visit Barefoot store for beautiful souvenirs at a very good price. Aqua Pizzeria is nice if you are looking for a cheaper option and a bit of a change in cuisine. 
If you drink alcohol, purchase this at DutyFree on arrival. You can also prebook to collect this on arrival. 
Although more expensive that independently booking an uber/taxi we recommend the transfer service to the airport. The driver has a very comfortable air-conditioned van with cushions and cold water which meant we could rest and not be sweaty arriving at the airport. 
If you book an Ayurvedic massage be aware that this a more gentle massage compared to Swedish styles but they are extremely relaxing. My husband fell asleep both times. 
Don't be afraid to try a yoga session. Elke is an excellent teacher and I am confident she can cater to all abilities. You won't feel awkward/uncomfortable in her presence as there is no judgement. 
There are many books available to read in the library. You can 'swap' your book if you run out of reading materials. 
You are in a tea plantation so there are some insects. Be sure to bring an environmentally friendly mosquito repellent e.g. citronella with you. 
No need to bring shampoo etc with you as luxurious shampoo, conditioner, face wash, body lotion is provided in beautiful ceramic pots in the bathroom. These were some of the nicest toiletries I've had even in comparison to larger resorts in Maldives and Dubai.
title: Beautiful honeymoon stay in secluded paradise

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Niyagama House for 3 nights. It is a beautiful property with picturesque gardens set in a tranquil setting. Completely agree with previous entries that the owner Elke was very helpful and made our stay nice and relaxing. The food served was amazing and tailored to our needs. The pool sits nicely in the gardens and is very clean and tidy. Our room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. 
The staff at Niyagama were polite, professional and helpful. If you want a quiet, relaxing break close to Galle, this is the place to come !
title: Absolute Gem !

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: we were upgradedto the Pearl suite that had an amazing balcony
text: Just finished a 3 night stay at Niyagama House, a small hotel situated in the most beautiful surroundings.  It was an amazing stay wonderfully hosted by Elke: we enjoyed yoga (daily for my wife and once for me as a beginner!); birdwatching; lovely food and excellent service.  We didn't go anywhere else during the 3 days (Galle Fort is 20 mins away) but just enjoyed the pool, the surroundings and the wildlife.  I was particularly impressed when a hawkbill landed on the balustrade of our balcony one morning.  We will definitely return when next in Sri Lanka.
title: Beautiful place, perfect stay

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Niyagama House is a  place, which seems surreal and absolutely breathtaking when you enter it the first time. You can tell that every inch has been thought of carefully. It is by far the most beautiful and stylish Hotel I have ever been to.
It‘s a place to meet yourself while chilling at the extraordinary Pool and enjoying the outstanding cooking skills of the restaurant. But you also want to have time in your room, which is spectacular in furniture, lightning,  comfort and view (monkey neighbours!).
And what makes a stay in Niyagama House feel like home is the staff, of course. Costumer relations is a big thing here, so lay back and let the magic happen. 
Elke is an exceptional landlady and a beautiful soul, which is sharing her wisdom and good vibes around the house. If you are lucky she is offering yogaclasses in one of the special Yogaplaces at Niyagama. 
Don’t miss to book an Ayurvedic massage while your stay.
I recommend you to book at least for 3 days to dive into the Niyagama experience. Highly recommended. 
Thanks for having me!
title: Secret Paradise with WOW effect!

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent  a few days in January 2020  at this beautiful house on a hill on top of a  tea Plantation  and it is something we will  remember for a long time. Everything worked perfectly well from food to the pool to the Yoga classes and the conversations with Elke. Everyone was exceptionally friendly and we felt at home from the first minute. Elke is a star, full of passion and knowledge, she is a great person to meet and to spend time with and talk about tea, yoga, Buddhism ,history, music and literature.
The combination of relax and activity, food, pool, even a walk around the plantation made our stay complete. Try it, Piero and Luisa
title: Niyagama House exceeded all our expectations

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
This place is like a small, hidden paradise on earth. We planned to stay 3 nights and extended it to 4, because we loved it! Good place to calm down, do Yoga and enjoy life. 
Elke is a really good Yoga teacher and offers not only Hatha Yoga and Meditation in the morning but also Aerial Yoga (we really recommend it), Yin Yoga on the rooftop in the evening (with a stunning sunset and view of the stars) and many others. The Yoga- Room has a wonderful view to the garden with the sound of (morning) birds- like in a fairtale. Elke is amazing. She helped us with all our wishes and concerns during our stay. 
The place it located near Galle, surrounded by tea and the jungle. You can see a lot of birds, at night bats and sometimes even monkeys from the jungle. 
The food was extraordinary delicious- not only a large selection of continental breaktfast but also sri lankian specials. 
The staff was really pleasant, friendly and accommodating, the room was comfortable and felt like home. 
The whole place is made with love and we instantly felt good there and never wanted to leave. 
We will definitely come again – for Yoga, good food and to calm down and let the good vibes touching our souls.
title: Our personal highlight in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Me and my wife stayed for a 3 night blissfull meditation and yoga retreat.
Everything here really exceeded our expectations, so we extended our stay.

The estate is situated a bit up surrounded by a tea plantation and with lovely gardens surrounding the house. It's very quiet and peaceful.
You really get a nice feeling when living surrounded by nature, jungle and can watch animals like lovely birds and monkeys etc
The house is beautiful and our room was spacious and very comfortable, so well planned in every detail. We had an own balcony, but even if you don't have there are some really nice ones for everybody to use.
Lovely pool and pool area.
The staff is very welcoming and helpful, always with a smile. The food is lovely.
Elke, the owner is a great host, really checking that all is great, also helped out with our planning for the visit, taxi etc.

We had really great Hatha YOGA classes every morning and in addition we joined some nice Yin and meditation classes in the evening. Elke is an amazing yoga teacher! She is experienced and checking on each student, making everyone feel safe and comfortable. Always with warmth and a smile.

Can't really don't find anything to improve right now, so If you want to recharge and relax this piece of heaven is the right place to be!!

Warm Regards Mattias and Catharina
title: Fantastic stay in this piece of heaven!

Thank you so very much! We are deeply honored. About the time you took to write this review and about you coming back again and again.

A big hug to you and to X from the tea plantation!!!

Take care and see you next time :-),

Elke
placeInfo/address: Niyagama - Akmeemana, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: All the rooms are up to great standards. Choosing a room with a balcony in such a beautiful setting is recommended.
text: Niyagama House is just out of this world. I have been back a number of times and each visit opens up new experiences and memories that stay with you long after you have checked out. You can uniquely be at one with nature and yet pop into the city of Galle to walk around the busy streets if you want. Returning to Niyagama is like stepping back into a secret garden of sanctuary and calm. I love the fact that you experience Sri Lankan smiles and hospitality from the staff and have the comfort of European standards of service, cleanliness and functionality during ones stay. As a guest you are never ‘over served’ which comes as a welcome relief. You are however attentively served when it suits you. That makes a big difference. I wish there were more places to stay around the world like Niyagama House. As yet I haven’t found any that matches what they do. Well done to Elke and her amazing team.
title: Keep coming back!

roomTip: Wifi er vanvittigt dårlig på stedet
text:
Virkelig hyggeligt lille sted. Villaen ligger direkte på stranden og har den skønneste udsigt fra pool og have. 
Der er kun 5 værelser og derfor er lille intimt sted der primært henvender sig til par/venner der rejser uden børn. 
Vi boede der er uge og nød hver dag (indtil der tjekkede gæster ind med børn)
Personalet gør rigtig meget for at imødekomme ønsker til mad mv. De er meget høflige og hjælpsomme. Kokken laver fantastisk mad så det er ikke nødvendigt at forlade matriklen hvis man ikke ønsker det. 
Der serveres afternoon tea hver eftermiddag. Hyggelig “gimmick” som gør at gæsterne lige samles og får mulighed for at tale sammen eller bare nyde lidt lækkert til ganen og udsigten udover vandet. 
Fin mindre pool som rengøres hver dag. 
Der kan ikke bade lige udenfor villaen grundet voldsomme bølger. Ønsker man at bade ved stranden skal man lidt op ad stranden fra villaen. 
Villaen ligger i udkanten af Hikkaduwa. Der er 15-20 minutters gang op til der hvor butikker og restauranter ligger som perler på en snor.
Rejser du som par/venner uden børn kan denne villa i meget høj grad anbefales
title: Skøn lille perle

placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed at this beautiful boutique villa/hotel for 3 nights at the start of April and my family and I absolutely loved it. We travelled around Sri Lanka for 2 weeks and without doubt, this was the nicest accommodation we stayed in. The staff were all so nice, helpful and available to assist us and there is a private chef cooking great food all day/night... And the food is cheaper than most restaurants we visited and far superior. The manager, Sunil went above and beyond to ensure my family and I were comfortable and enjoying ourselves. If you're in Hikkaduwa, this is a great place to stay.
title: Absolutely loved it!

placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed at Villa Saffron recently with my mum and my daughter. From the minute we arrived Sunil and the team were on hand for anything we wanted! (Even offering to send someone out to buy wine for us!) 
My daughter who is 5 was so well looked after and any food she requested was made with no fuss (even down to pancakes at breakfast!) She had Fish Fingers and chips every night and loved it! The complimentary afternoon tea was so thoughtful too! 
The pool area is lovely and my daughter spent most of her time in there. With there only being 5 rooms this Villa is so quiet and so peaceful and I would definitely recommend!
title: Such a lovely stay

placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
The ocean directly outside the hotel is choppy, to swim go right and up to where there are lifeguards and surfers. 

The hotel pool is good.
text:
Stop looking and get booking if you want luxury, peace and tranquillity - before its too late.

If you want pure luxury, fully taken care of and a quiet unspoilt setting - book this beautiful Villa. 

If you're a details person read on............

Ideally I wouldn't write this review, through through pure selfishness so that when I want to book again there is availability! 
Villa Saffron is the ONLY place I have EVER wanted to return to, and we have travelled quite extensively over the years.

Sunil is one of the most thoughtful people and is keen to ensure your stay is perfect, he caters for all your needs, and is able to offer advice for places to go and see. Kason is also a key member of the team who is also very helpful, either one is available at the property 24 hours a day so you feel confident you are in safe hands. All the team ensure the Villa is spotless and everything is available for you, they go about their work quietly without disturbance in their polite and charming manner.

The beach is glorious, it is swept each day by properties and restaurants to ensure it is maintained and free of any debris (though there is little anyhow). 
To the left, you will find a long, peaceful walk with scatterings of bars, go to Catamaran - run by Sunil (a different Sunil to Villa Saffron) and his family.  
To the right there are lots of bars and restaurants, a short walk along you will find surfers racing the waves and places you can stop and watch. 
There are fishing boats which go out at night and if you are lucky you may find them pulling their catch in as you are eating breakfast, it was exhausting just watching them!

We stayed in the Saffron Suite which was stunning, and huge. The balcony offered a glimpse of the sunset and provided some much needed shade at the end of the day. Outside the 2 rooms upstairs there is a seating area inside and another on the balcony, these can be used by other guests but as there are just 5 rooms at this property and there are seating areas downstairs there is so much space we found we were able to be on our own most of the time.
title: Stop looking and get booking if you want luxury, peace and tranquillity - before its too late.

placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Come prepared to relax and be well looked after!
text:
This is our second time at Villa Saffron and it is still one of the loveliest places to stay. 
The rooms are spacious, with comfortable beds, very clean, roomy bathroom. Service is excellent, Sunil and his team look after you the moment you arrive, with kind, attentive service. 
The breakfasts are fabulous, with a range of traditional Sri Lankan food on offer as well as more traditional breakfast items on offer. 
The food on offer during the day for lunch and evening meals is also delicious and good value. We ate there 4 times during our week’s stay and were never disappointed.
The pool is beautiful, as are the gardens. The sound of the sea is never far away. It’s easy to go for walks along the beach, or get a short tuk tuk ride into main Hikkadua. 
Highly recommend.
title: Excellent place to stay, quiet, relaxing, beautiful setting, fabulous service. Highly recommend.

placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
A wonderful weeks stay in a beautiful boutique hotel. Sunil and his staff were very attentive and made our stay memorable enough to rebook again for next year.
Highly recommend, perfect for couples who wish to chill and relax.
Excellent food and service
title: Beautiful boutique hotel

text: Lovely villa with such a nice decor in Hikkaduwa. I stayed there with my mom for 2 nights during our trip to Sri Lanka and it was the most beautiful place we stayed at. placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed here with a couple of friends and Sunil was very welcoming and all his staff very attentive.  The rooms were clean, the decor was amazing, the showers were exceptionally good and powerful and the pool was a dream.  Being able to get on the beach at the bottom of the garden was amazing and the outside furniture to rest was very comfortable.  The chef produced some delicious, highly presented food, there was no need to go elsewhere.  We all loved our 2 night stay and everything was made perfect by Sunil and his staff.  I would highly recommend going to this villa.
title: Amazing location in a beautifully decorated villa on the beach

placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Parking is available, ask the staff for anything you need, if you want to eat out you can easily reach Hikkaduwa town on foot and there are some nice restaurants around.
text:
The property is just beautiful! Done in the open tropical villa style, with  well appointed spacious rooms, beautiful decor, a gorgeous tiled pool and easy beach access, it was a treat for the eyes. There was a beautiful courtyard as well, with the concept of a controlled tropical jungle garden.

Special word of appreciation to Mr Sunil and his helpful, attentive staff. They make the best Sri Lankan milk tea! ☺️ All the food we ordered was fabulous, they accommodated all our requests (extra cups of tea during the day!) and went above and beyond to be helpful and attentive.

We really appreciated the peace, calm and quiet as well as the safety offered for a group of female travellers! Would fully recommend it and will definitely be returning!
title: Girls trip - had a blast!

placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed only 1 night after a long flight. The manager Sunis and his staff try to take care of you to the maximum. Dinner was delicious and breakfast very extensive and as an extra pancakes for our children. Furthermore, the small-scale accommodation has a nice swimming pool and you walk through a private gate to the beach. Very special and also a relaxing place to stay for a few nights. Only downside was that in one room the air conditioning did not cool enough, luckily there was also a ceiling fan.
title: Great accomodation at the sea.

placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
We verbleven 3 nachten in Villa Saffron en hebben het heerlijk naar ons zin gehad. Een ideale plek om rustig te acclimatiseren na onze reis uit Nederland. 
Ook heerlijk gegeten in de villa, waarbij rekening werd gehouden met het glutenvrije dieet van onze dochter. 
Wat een gastvrijheid op deze plek! Iedereen is zo vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Sunil de manager vroeg ons ook regelmatig of alles naar wens is. Het eten was erg lekker! Als ze er zijn, dan zeker de Jumbo garnalen eten! Echt heerlijk. 
Ook een prachtige tuin, uitkijkend op de zee. Erg rustig toen wij er waren, maar voelde niet ongemakkelijk.
title: Een oase van rust aan de oceaan

placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka

text: An absolute "Gem" located in the South of Sri Lanka, this is a "MUST STAY AT" Boutique Villa in Hikkaduwa. title: An Absolute "Gem" located in the South of Sri Lanka, Villa Saffron Hikkaduwa, is truly a piece of Paradise!

text: We don’t have enough superlatives to describe our stay at Villa Saffron. When we stepped through the front gate we felt like we were escaping from the bustling town into an oasis of calm. The villa is a beautiful construction in itself and it has been very tastefully furnished by the owners.  The rooms are spacious and we felt at home immediately. It wasn’t just the environment that made us feel at home. We very much appreciated the warm welcome and attention to detail provided by Sunil, the manager. Sunil took time to get to know us and our personal preferences which meant that he gave a high level of personal service that you don’t get in other properties. The rest of the team also made sure that everything was perfect for our stay;  the delicious food served, the spotless garden area and the cleanliness of the whole villa. Last but not least, the pool and the view over the beach just took our breath away and we spent many an hour gazing at the trees, beach and waves. Villa Saffron will recharge anyone’s batteries. We will recommend this place to everyone we know and hope to come back soon. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
title: A perfect stay!

text:
Our stay at Villa Saffron Hikkaduwa was nothing short of spectacular, far exceeding our expectations in every aspect. Visiting at the start of the off-season, we were delighted to find that we practically had the entire villa to ourselves, providing an intimate and exclusive experience.

The villa's staff were outstanding; their attention to detail and genuine care ensured our stay was comfortable and memorable. The facilities at the villa were first-class—everything was clean and well-maintained, from the spacious interiors of the rooms, huge bathrooms, to the expansive balcony offering plenty of privacy. The ambiance was perfect for relaxation and unwinding.

One of the highlights was the food prepared on-site; it was simply first-class, rivaling top restaurants in flavor and presentation. Having the ability to walk straight out to the ocean and enjoy a clean, serene beach was the cherry on top of our relaxing stay.

While the villa isn't close to major shopping areas, it didn't detract from our experience as the tranquility and beauty of the location were exactly what we needed after days of travel and sightseeing. Villa Saffron is the perfect place to recharge, making it an ideal retreat for adults looking for a peaceful getaway.

We highly recommend Villa Saffron Hikkaduwa and are already looking forward to our next visit. It's truly more suited for an adult retreat, offering a slice of paradise for those seeking a serene escape.
title: Serene and Luxurious Stay at Villa Saffron Hikkaduwa - A Hidden Paradise!

text:
This is our second visit to Saffron Villas and it was like time had stood still.
A warm friendly Sri Lankan welcome. The same faces, warm, helpful, discreet and kind.
Just 5 rooms you feel you are staying in your own private villas. Lovely pool, delightful room. Direct access onto the most wonderful beach.
Situated on the edge of town far enough away to feel peaceful but a walk away if you want more activity.
The villas has been so beautifully and sympathetically restored and furnishings reflect that as does the artwork.
Dining is simple. Bring your own alcohol. Fridge and kettle in rooms make all the difference for such a relaxed location.
Definitely return visit in the diary.
title: Peaceful relaxation

text: Villa Saffron is such a gorgeous property. Architecturally designed with beautiful touches.  It is definitely a private home not a hotel kind of place, which is exactly what we wanted. We had the largest room there (Saffron) up on the first floor with a huge external balcony too, overlooking the pool/ocean. All the other rooms looked lovely too, all with there own special features. We ate well, sitting on the terrace enjoying the delicious food and relative calm. The grounds were very well looked after and it was a lovely place to sit and chill by the pool. The surf was a short walk up the beach, the main reason for staying in that area, and did not disappoint. The non-surfer was equally happy walking on the beach and just enjoying Villa Saffron! Sunil and his team were incredible…..could not fault their attention to detail and were always available, yet very discreet, should anything be needed.  What a great team…..thank you so much.
title: Highly recommend Villa Saffron

ownerResponse/text: We truly appreciate the wonderful review. Please do visit us again soon.
placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
My stay at Villa Saffron in Hikaduwa was nothing short of exceptional. Tucked away from the bustling road, this quiet retreat provided the perfect escape. The highlight was undoubtedly the outstanding staff, with Manager Surin leading the way in ensuring a memorable experience.

The location strikes a perfect balance—serene and peaceful, yet just a swift 5-minute journey to the vibrant restaurant and shopping hub. The villa’s limited size, with only 5 rooms, lends an intimate atmosphere that adds to the charm.

A piece of advice: book the rooms on 1st floor to enjoy added privacy. The ground floor lacks the seclusion found in the upper levels. 

Overall, Villa Saffron is a hidden gem, offering tranquility and top-notch service.
title: Nice , Private , quiet .

text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Villa. It has some of the best and most friendly staff I’ve ever come across. I travelled with a 10 y.old fussy eater and my elderly mother. I must say they both felt well attended. The staff were ever smiling and extremely helpful. I booked the garden suite which suited us fine and there was a comfy lounge area just outside it where we mostly hung out. It’s great that this villa provides a lot of hang out areas enabling my travelers to enjoy the villa experience.  The beach and the pool are feet away. This is a good spot for surfers as it’s only a few meters away from the surf scene. The reef is also within walking distance. We spent hours snorkeling and it was great. The breakfast at the villa was delicious and the menu provided a good many other varieties too. Good chef & great team overall! Hoping to return soon and book one of the suites overlooking the pool & ocean.

ownerResponse/text: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience and for the kind words.
placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
Провели на этой вилле 10 чудесных дней.
Хиккадува - маленькая деревенька, одна улица, на побережье, немного отелей, гестхаусы, магазинчики, кафешки. Эта вилла - уютный большой дом, в котором 5 комнат - 5 номеров. Отношение персонала - наивнимательнейшее, помощь во всем. Это не отель, но у вас уберутся в номере, поменяют полотенца (зубные щетки и тапочки рекомендуем взять свои), покормят в удобное для вас время завтраком, обедом, ужином, принесут сладкий комплимент в 5 вечера с чаем/кофе. Очень приличный уровень питания - прекрасный шеф, который делает отличное домашнее кокосовое мороженное и восхитительные овощи в темпуре, равиоли с тыквой или рыбу в белом соусе. Вашему маленькому привереде будут подбирать рацион и терпеливо готовить на разные лады картошку или рис (наш 7-летний молодой человек мало что ест, но приехал домой весьма упитанным)) , отдельные слова благодарности - Sunil Dissanayake. Не было ничего, что бы мы попросили и не получили. Благодаря Санилу гость чувствует себя как дома. Спасибо от всей нашей семьи! Пляж напротив виллы прекрасен, но вход в океан каменистый и мы были в сезон больших волн. Купаться не реально. Но в 5 минутах езды на тук-туке хороший пляж (turtle beach), приплывают огромные морские черепахи. На пляже можно расположиться «диким» способом на полотенце под пальмами (осторожнее, кокосы)) либо в отеле на пляже - хорошая инфраструктура (шезлонги, полотенца, бассейн, бар, можно взять обеды шведский стол). Местные жители очень приветливые и доброжелательные, отдых прошел на отлично.
title: Прекрасно отдохнули всей семьей

roomTip: Saffron is the big one with a jacuzzi
text: A very comfortable stay. It is about 20 minutes from the Baddegama exit on the E01 expressway, and 25 minutes from Galle on the Galle toad.  The food was a little limited. We rented four of the five rooms in the main section of the villa...the four spice named suites without Garden. Meal choices were a little limited and they don't have a concept of half board. They have to go and buy ingredients for what you order from the menu so you have to order your dinner in the morning. The food was well executed but not exactly plated or anything. It is a very good option for families. If it is raining you have to leave the main dining area as they are no screens in case the rain beats in. The rooms are large and the four poster beds are soft and comfortable. The rain shower in the upper floor is run by a pressure pump so if the power fails you have to use the hand shower. The power was intermittent on our last day.
title: Lovely private villa for 10

ownerResponse/text: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave such a wonderful review of our hotel. We truly appreciate your kind words and are thrilled to hear that you had an excellent experience during your stay.
placeInfo/address: 776 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
Saffron Villa has the best staff, the manager Sunil welcomed us warmly on arrival,  and from the start, the general standard of service was excellent. It is a family friendly resort, and there were guests of the age of 12, and under, who really enjoyed the pool. All requests were promptly obliged by Sunil and his team. The place has a decent beach, which was very clean as well! 

All the staff - restaurant and the room maintenance were very good. And the food... was amazing! Starting from the authentic rice and curry dishes for lunch, to the other traditional food - string hoppers, coconut roti, kola kenda and the fresh fruit platters for breakfast. They serve tasty cakes like pineapple upside down, at tea time as an accompaniment to tea and/or coffee.
The chef was great and came out of the kitchen to check with us if everything was alright. 

We would highly recommend this place!
title: A family friendly villa in Hikkaduwa!

roomTip: Book 3 safaris to avoid the post safari blues
text:
Our 2 nights with the team at Camp Leopard were just incredible. From start to finish the team treated us like kings. The food is incredible, the care that is taken in preparing the meals is something special and the team have a strong commitment to sourcing all ingredients naturally and locally. The accommodation was perfect; glamping in the jungle with nature on your doorstep but still with those home comforts vibe, you can really see how much thought has gone into this set up. 
As for the safaris JUST WOW, hands down the best experience we have ever had! Nicky our ranger was so knowledgable about both the park and the wildlife and the jeep team really go all out to make sure you see as much as you possibly can. Our only regret - not booking a 3rd safari, we saw so much on our dusk and dawn safaris and had the best time but left with major safari blues and a desperate want to do it all again. 
Big big love and thank you to Ruwan, Nicky and the whole team for making our experience, fun, authentic and so much more than we expected. Additional temple visit and cooking class just created the perfect memories for us. A team who are so passionate about making your stay incredible. 
If you’re considering Camp Leopard, DO IT you will not be disappointed 🫶🏻🐆
title: The most incredible experience. Camp Leopard is an unforgettable place run by a passionate team of people.

text: Sehr gute Organisation des Aufenthaltes: Wir wurden an einem Meeting-Point am 12 Uhr abgeholt, kurze Fahrt zum Camp. Dort eine kurze Einweisung und sich einrichten im Zelt. Dann geht es auf Safari am Nachmittag bis um 18 Uhr. Ordentliches Abendessen, nur für uns viel zu scharf. Am Morgen wurden wir um 5 Uhr geweckt und 30 Minuten später auf eine weitere Safari zu einem anderen Teil des Parks. Gegen 8 Uhr eine kleines Frühstück. Gegen 10 Uhr zurück im Camp, auschecken. - Wir hatten Glück mit unserem Fahrer und Guide und sahen 4 x Leoparden und auch Elefanten. - Alles in allem gute Organisation, auch wenn es mit ca 600 € für 2 Personen all inclusive relativ teuer ist (Fahrer verdient ca 5000 LKR am Tag). Die Betten eher klein. Bad einfach aber sauber.

Wir haben Camp Leopard für zwei Nächte besucht und drei Safaris gemacht. 
Alles war rundum besser als wir es uns vorgestellt haben. Jeder einzelne Mitarbeiter ist super lieb, hilfsbereit und man merkt dass sie lieben was sie tun! Wir würden definitiv wieder dieses Camp für unsere Safari im Yala Nationalpark wählen. 
Earl, unser Guide während allen Safaris hat sich so super gekümmert und sich bei jeder Sichtung die wir gemacht haben mit uns gefreut. Das Essen hat uns umgehauen und wir sind jeden Abend mit vollem Bauch ins Bett gefallen. 
Auch die Kommunikation voran via WhatsApp war super unkompliziert und schnell!
Rundum war es perfekt für uns.

placeInfo/address: Yala National Park Buffer Zone off of Katagamuwa Road, Kataragama 91400 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: Yala National Park Buffer Zone off of Katagamuwa Road
text:
Camp Leopard is a charming and unique destination, offering a blend of comfort and wilderness that is hard to find. However, my feelings about our stay are mixed. While the camp’s facilities, service, and the safari experience itself were exceptional, our visit was marred by poor organization (by our tour operator - Aitken Spence), and a lack of proactive solutions to enhance the experience (by the staff of Camp Leopard).

We initially booked two nights, expecting to arrive on October 30th, have dinner, and enjoy an early night in preparation for the 6 a.m. safari the next day. The morning safari was spectacular, lasting four hours and offering incredible sightings, including a leopard—an unforgettable moment, especially for my husband on his first-ever safari. However, the remainder of our day on October 31st was left unstructured. When we asked about additional activities, the only suggestion was to “read a book.”

This response was particularly frustrating because there were missed opportunities for the staff to go the extra mile. They could have coordinated with neighboring camps or tour operators to secure an afternoon safari or suggested other nearby activities to make the most of our time. Disappointed with the lack of options, we decided to shorten our stay and move on to Galle.

Despite this setback, Camp Leopard has many strengths. The setting is serene, with a well-kept camp that blends seamlessly with its natural surroundings. The bonfire arranged on our first night was a thoughtful touch, allowing us to enjoy a delicious meal free from the company of mosquitoes and other bugs. The staff were friendly, the food was well-prepared and beautifully presented, and the safari arrangement was seamless.

I believe Camp Leopard can offer an extraordinary experience, especially for those planning their visit independently. With better integration of activities and a more proactive approach from the staff, this place could truly shine as a must-visit destination in Yala.
title: A Beautiful Camp with Room for Better Coordination

text: This is just wonderful.  Let’s start with the camp.  Beautifully situated close to the Yala national park.  We were welcomed by the gorgeous staff and shown our lovely tent. We then went out for an incredible afternoon where we saw a magnificent male leopard.  Snakes mating, crocodiles.  A huge elephant and many others species  we then returned to the camp and we were served course after course of delicious tasting food.  We slept like a dream, up early and then out again for a morning safari.  I couldn’t speak more highly of this camp. Everything is organised to perfection. Don’t hesitate to book   You will have a wonderful time.  Just wish I’d stayed two nights xox
title: Just perfection

roomTip: Vimos safaris sin guía, con más gente en el Jeep, peor picnic... Es una experiencia única, recomiendo asegurar la calidad con este hotel.
text:
La atención del personal fue impecable, desde recibirnos todos los días con toallas húmedas y zumos naturales cada día hasta adaptarse exactamente a nuestro horario.
La comida era casera, preparada diariamente y con explicación previa sobre beneficios y propiedades de los alimentos que nos servían (incluso Jackfruit), nos hicieron una hoguera para cenar a la luz del fuego.
Las habitaciones estaban genial, limpias y con productos para nosotros (antimosquitos, hidrogel...).
Se adaptaban en todo momento a las necesidades (no hay horarios cerrados)
Desde el punto de vista del Safari fue impecable también, íbamos solos, con conductor y guía. Nos prestaron prismáticos.
Nos explicaron todo con mucho nivel tanto de idioma como de conocimientos y nos prepararon desayuno, comida y merienda para comer durante el safari (que iban llevando en tuctuc para que estuviera caliente), veíamos otros safaris y la calidad de los picnics no tenía nada que ver.
Vimos 35 especies de animales diferentes (5 leopardos, oso, chacales...)
Muy, muy recomendable!
title: Muy recomendable!

text: Estuvimos dos noches y día y medio de safari. El personal es super atento, llegamos al punto de recogida y nos estaban esperando con el Jeep. Ellos gestionaron nuestra llegada hablando directamente con nuestro taxista. Las tiendas están muy cuidadas y limpias, tienen aire acondicionado y todos los utensilios de aseo. No repitieron ninguna comida en el tiempo que estuvimos, todo fueron platos típicos de Sri Lanka cocinados en el propio campamento, todo estaba buenísimo. El safari lo hacen con un conductor y un guía muy majo que habla perfectamente inglés y va contigo explicándote los animales que van apareciendo, curiosidades y lo que le quieras preguntar. Te dejan preparados los prismáticos en el Jeep para hacer el safari. La ubicación está bien, hay varias zonas de safari con varias entradas y ellos están más o menos en el medio. Fue una experiencia increíble
title: Excelente!

roomTip: Come in the off season to  avoid the masses of tourists. Do more than 1 safari to increase your chances.  Don't rush it.
text:
I cannot rave enough about this safari and the people who work there. We were looked after so well.  Ruwan ensured we were comfortable and got spoilt.

Our guide Earle and driver Lyer (I hope I spelt that right) were amazing. We did 4 safaris across 2 days and were lucky enough to site all of the big 5. Leopards, sloth. Bear, crocodiles,  water buffalo and elephants.  

The people at Camp Leopard really care for the animals and environment.  We were so impressed.
They are connected to other drivers so when there is a sighting they get a call and we head straight there.
Such a great experience.  Will definitely be back.
It's a boutique experience. Personalised attention. 

The company you choose makes all the difference. We had a guide and driver and sometimes another person. Would join us to spot. A lot of other safaris were just a driver.  A driver can't drive and spot very well alone.

Do more than one safari!!!!!
title: Amazing Amazing!!!!

text:
5 stars for this place is not enough to express the delight and gratitude for everything we experienced at Camp Leopard and on Safari.

We had booked a full day safari in Yala and two nights at Camp Leopard.

How Ruwan and his team took care of us was an incredible experience - even in the context of the entire stay for holidays in Sri Lanka. 
His extraordinary openness, cordiality, warmth and care accompanied us from the first minutes of meeting. When we came to Camp Leopard, we were mainly focused on a safari adventure. However, Ruwan suggested that we also take a walk around the area and a trip to the nearby Kataragama temple, one of the most significant in the whole of Sri Lanka. It was a wonderful spiritual experience for us to be able to watch and participate in the ceremony.

Ruwan's stories about Sri Lankan culture and its history were so interesting, we felt that we had unexpectedly received such a beautiful lesson in the history of Sri Lanka, which will remain in our memories forever. It was something amazing! Thank you very much Ruwan for heart you gave us during that afternoon with us. We feel very grateful and can't wait to meet you again at Camp Leopard!

The next day we went on a full day safari to Yala, which was also an exceptional experience! Being able to watch the rhythm of wild animals from sunrise to sunset is an experience worth every penny. Our guide was the fantastic Ruwan (a different person than Ruwan at Camp Leopard), who has several years of experience in national parks. His incredible intuition, focus, attentiveness and knowledge meant that we always knew where to go in search of a leopard (seen 4 times!!), elephants, bears, crocodiles or other species of amazing wild animals. We also had a fantastic driver who could "sneak" so as not to scare the animals - or drive fast and dynamically to the place where they were at the time! What an adventure!!!
During the safari we had fantastic meals prepared, both breakfast, lunch and coffee and cake tasted like from the best restaurant - with the most amazing view (e.g. of bathing wild animals!).

Additional aspects that affect the uniqueness of this place:

- excellent Sri Lankan cuisine!!! The chef cooks with passion and a great sense of taste! (Although if someone prefers European, they will probably be satisfied too - we ordered traditional cuisine all the time).

- all dishes - both in the camp and on safari - are served on ecological tableware (BRAVO!!!)! Zero plastic - this is Camp Leopard's policy

- wonderful, comfortable tents! Air-conditioned, very comfortable mattresses in the beds, mosquito nets, warm shower, toilet. Wow!!!

- respect for animals! There are 5 dogs in the camp, each of them is vaccinated, wears a collar with a name. Each of them was taken in after difficult experiences: the first is blind in one eye, the second has had a paw operation, the third was saved after being bitten, etc.
I must admit that this attitude moves me a lot, especially in Sri Lanka. A wonderful idea!

- roasting marshmallows in a bonfire (our 8-year-old was delighted!!!) and a unique atmosphere during every meal.

At the end, we said goodbye to the entire Camp team and felt like we were leaving our family. 
Ruwan! We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for everything you gave us during our meeting! You create an absolutely unique place - we are already planning to return for another safari with you ❤️. 
I also know that no matter how much I write, it will not do justice to what we experienced. Simply put - we recommend Camp Leopard to everyone - it is an experience that will stay with you forever!
title: Unique experience!!!! More then 5 stars ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ !!!!

book min2 nights at camp leopard and eat here
make sure you do a dusk safari, attend the evening Puja with Ruwan, play w/bubu & dobby
text:
The team is dedicated to make sure everything is perfect, from waking you up in the morning so that you are not late for your safari, to refreshing you every time you get to camp, to cooking amazing meals and more importantly to making sure you feel at home. 
Their safari is a bit more expensive than the ones you will find elsewhere, but you pay for what you get. The safari guide did not get out of the park until i saw a leopard, and the driver was in contact with all other drivers to make sure we did not miss any sightings.
Camp Leopard’s staff will gladly talk to you of you feel like chatting, they will answer your questions about how life is in Sri Lanka, and let you into how it is like to live and grow up here.
Cherry on top was the evening Puja in Kataragama: the guys accompanied us to assist to the rituals and explained to us what was happening, making us feel not as outsiders disturbing, but rather like we were taking part in the ceremony.
To conclude, dear Ruwan, Nikeshal, Earl, Pasan and Wishwa, THANK YOU for your hospitality and kindness!
title: THE BEST EXPERIENCE you will ever have IN SRI LANKA

text: We had a wonderful short stay at Camp Leopard for one night incorporating an afternoon safari and then early morning safari . The staff at camp couldn’t be more helpful , very polite and knowledgeable. The food they prepared was of a high standard and the tent / cabin you stay in provides all you need for a comfortable stay, the bedding was of a high standard and the bed extremely comfortable covered in a mosquito net for protection. My wife commented that the room smelt amazing and was lovely and cold due to the air conditioning.The safaris themselves were superb and although you hope to see leopards ( we did manage some short sightings) there is plenty of other wildlife to enjoy including sloth bears, tusked elephants if you’re lucky , the bird life is amazing and shouldn’t be overlooked for the larger animals . On both our safaris our guides were fantastic , spotting so much that you would have missed and their knowledge of all the animals was fantastic . Myself and wife would highly recommended Camp Leopard .
title: Honeymoon Safaris

text:
Amazing! From the moment we booked Camp Leopard the communication was amazing, they spoke with our driver so they made sure we would arrive at the meeting point in time. When we arrived we were warmly welcomed. We stayed one night and did an afternoon and early morning safari. We had the family room as we were a party of 3 and it was perfect. Super comfy beds and definitely the glamping vibe! The shower even had hot water which was lovely. The tents even have AC! You are out in the bush so expect bugs etc but you have a bell that you can ring if you need a hand getting anything out of the tent.
Special mention to Nicky who was so lovely, friendly and welcoming! A true asset to the Camp Leopard team. The food was amazing and our three course dinner by the camp fire was just the perfect end to our evening.
Both safaris were amazing and we saw so much wildlife and even two leopards which was incredible! Our driver was great and our guide was amazing, so friendly and very informative, with amazing eyesight!
We had the most amazing experience here and we would definitely recommend it, you can find somewhere cheaper to stay but it’s honestly worth paying that little bit extra for this experience!
title: Amazing, highly recommended

text: I heard about Camp Leopard from a recommended post and upon reading the reviews, was quick to book an experience with them! And it absolutely went above and beyond the high expectations we had 😊 Even before arriving, we had constant updates and check-ins with the team to ensure a smooth arrival! We were collected, greeted with a fantastic Sri Lankan lunch and set forth to do our first safari. The chef was experienced and the food so tasty, Ruwan the camp lead was attentive and thoughtful, Nicky was on hand for support and I couldn’t speak highly enough of Chathu and Layya were knwowldgable, responsive safari guides who was able to show us more than 42 animals! Highly recommend and will be back!

placeInfo/address: Yala National Park Buffer Zone off of Katagamuwa Road, Kataragama 91400 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: Yala National Park Buffer Zone off of Katagamuwa Road
text:
My partner and I did a two day one night stay at Camp Leopard. In that time we did a dusk and dawn Safari, and the experience was INCREDIBLE!

Everything from the accomodation, the staff, the food, the safari to the camp’s dogs was amazing!

We arrived outside of the camp grounds and were greeted by Chathu, our safari guide and wildlife expert. Chathu is a positive person with a great sense of humour. She made us feel very welcome before the three of us hopped in the back of the truck to be taken to Camp Leopard.

When we arrived, we were greeted by the rest of the Camp Leopard team, Tharaka, Milhara, Laiiya, and Handa. Along with the camp’s friendly canines. 

The accomodation is very nice, but be mindful you don’t leave any food in your bags. Unless you want thieves in the form of squirrels helping themselves to your items. Apparently they’re a fan of coffee sachets, as my partner found out 😂. However, we were warned.

The safari itself is one of our best experiences from our time in Sri Lanka. But please note, it is luck on the day as to what animals you’ll see. You’re dealing with wildlife and it’s always a roll of the dice where that’s concerned. With that said, during our two safaris, we were blessed to see the big 5 (leopard, wild bore, water buffalo, sloth bear and elephants).

The food that the camp provides is delicious. We were treated to a traditional Sri Lankan lunch and dinner during our stay, both times we were given more food than we could consume. After the dinner we had s’mores over a camp fire and good conversations with fellow guests at the camp.

The experience with camp leopard is one we can’t recommend enough. And we consider it a must if you’re visiting Yala National Park.
title: A Must In Sri Lanka!

roomTip: No crowds at the safaris of Camp Leopard
text: Wonderful! It is amazing to be in the wild at sunrise, hear the sounds and the soak in the scents of the woods when all awakes. We saw many birds, millions of butterflies, even stole a glimpse of young female leopard moving past a heard of water buffaloes - no reaction on either side - the leopard slipped in the bushes while the buffaloes kept on munching grass. We saw jackals, deer, rabbits, monkeys, lizards and a very lazy crocodile. And all of this before breakfast. Just regular sandwiches and coffee, but with an incredible view. And then we ran into elephants - a shy young elephant who was “hiding” behind a tree - not successfully, and then Raja - a really big mature elephant who walked in the middle of the road and simply stopped all traffic. He came very close - we could touch his head, but we didn’t, because your are not allowed to. Still regretting this a bit ..
title: The wild awakens -  not much happening, just wild animals going about their business ;-)

placeInfo/address: Yala National Park Buffer Zone off of Katagamuwa Road, Kataragama 91400 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: Yala National Park Buffer Zone off of Katagamuwa Road
text:
Our experience at Camp Leopard was wonderful from start to finish! We stayed in june on a 3D 2N safari package. It was very easy to book, wtih clear and frequent communication via whatsapp. 

The location is a short drive from Yala but also right next to a national park, so you feel fully immersed in wildlife - expect bugs, frogs, monkeys and an occasional snake. Camp is very homely, with very good amenities for glamping (generally clean, hot water, flushing loo). We loved the little touches - fresh flowers, locally made shampoo and the camp is especially beautiful when lit up at night.

Onsite the staff were kind, attentive and flexible to our needs, creating a very welcoming and familial atmosphere. Food was amazing fresh sri lankan cuision. The evening meals were superb - four courses plus smores served by candlelight outside by a bonfire. Only feedback is that there way too much food for two of us!

The safaris were incredible. We went to block 1 and 5 - would strongly recommend block 5 for a less commercial, more jungle experience. Our guide was extremely knowledgable and shared great stories about the wildlife and local culture. The team's passion for sustainable conservation shone through and with their expertise we saw four leopards, elephants, tropical birds and eagles and much more . 

We couldn't have asked for a better trip, highly recommend.
title: Amazing safari experience

placeInfo/address: Yala National Park Buffer Zone off of Katagamuwa Road, Kataragama 91400 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street1: Yala National Park Buffer Zone off of Katagamuwa Road
roomTip: If you’re getting the bus into Kataragama, they’ll pick you up at the bus station.
text:
Absolutely fabulous experience with Marc and his team at Camp Leopard. I stayed 2 nights, with an evening safari in the first night and a full day safari on the second day. I throughly recommend the full day safari, as you will go into the less busy areas of the park. We had lunch by a river, where we could swim and cool off before tracking leopards in the evening. I have to be honest that we didn’t actually see a leopard (which is apparently a rare occurrence), but the whole experience was still worthwhile. 

Marc is incredibly knowledgeable about the flora and fauna of the region, and if you ask, he’ll also get you up to date with some of the history in the region. Marc happily accommodated me as a solo traveller, without the massive surcharge that can often mean. 

The camp itself is well set up, with various areas for relaxing, including a dining room, lounge and outdoor picnic table. Each “tent” also has a small patio at front. The food was amazing and the atmosphere in the camp lovely. 

Overall, I would thoroughly recommend Camp Leopard to any traveller. It’s well worth the price.
title: Unforgettable experience

placeInfo/address: Yala National Park Buffer Zone off of Katagamuwa Road, Kataragama 91400 Sri Lanka

Marc and his team were amazing and went above and beyond to ensure we had an unforgettable time, we couldn't have asked for more.

We loved the mix of traditional & authentic home-cooked meals which were wonderfully presented (and explained). The team were also very accommodating by providing more familiar dishes for the kids and generally just exceptional in entertaining, educating and catering for our children (3 & 5 years old).

The rooms were clean and comfortable with nets over the beds, power, wifi and air-con, a true glamping experience. 

Our guided Jeep Safari was fantastic, we all learned, saw and experienced so much in just two days and the kids loved it too, we always felt very safe and secure under the guidance of Marc and his team: can't recommend highly enough.
title: The best Yala Safari and glamping experience
